title: Aerial View of Bombing Raid
Scopenote: Aerial view of an unknown location as bombs are being dropped during World War II Allied bombing raids.

title: European Style Building and Graveyard
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a European style building and graveyard in an unknown location.

title: Signed Photo of United States Air Force General Leon Johnson
Scopenote: Signed photo of United States Air Force General Leon Johnson to Major General Robert Landry. Inscription says: "30 January 1956 / To Bob Landry/with appreciation/for fine work/Leon W. Johnson."

title: Harry S. Truman with Margaret Ellen and Mary Ethel Noland
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman (left) is standing with his aunt Margaret Ellen Noland (center) and his cousin Mary Ethel Noland (right) in the front yard of the Noland house in Independence, Missouri. The Noland home is across the street from the home of Bess Wallace at 219 North Delaware Street. See also 72-3605.  Donor: Louise T. Rixey.

title: USS Wyoming
Scopenote: The USS Wyoming, the third vessel to carry the name, was launche3d May 25, 1911, commissioned September 25, 1912 and decommissioned August 1, 1947. Lewis Parks served as a midshipman on the Wyoming in 1925.

title: USS Wyoming
Scopenote: The USS Wyoming, the third vessel to carry the name, was launched May 25, 1911, commissioned September 25, 1912 and decommissioned August 1, 1947. Lewis Parks served as a midshipman on the Wyoming in 1925.

title: USS New York
Scopenote: The USS New York, the fifth to carry the name, was launched October 30, 1912, commissioned April 15, 1914 and  decommissioned August 29, 1946.  Lewis Parks served on her as a midshipman in 1924.

title: USS Flusser
Scopenote: The USS Flusser was named after the Civil War hero Charles Williamson Flusser.  The ship launched September 28, 1935, commissioned October 1, 1936 and decommissioned December 16, 1946.  Lewis Parks served on the USS Flusser as a midshipman in 1926.

title: A United States Navy Submarine
Scopenote: Photograph of the submarine P-10 on which Lewis Parks served in 1935.

title: Crowd Listens to a Speech
Scopenote: A crowd of people in a gymnasium in Lubbock, Texas, listen to a speech by Ivy Duggan.

title: USS Pompano Submarine (SS-181)
Scopenote: Photograph of the USS Pompano, a Porpoise Class Submarine.  The submarine, which  was the second vessel to bear the name, was launched March 11, 1937 and commissioned June 12, 1937.  Lewis Parks became commanding officer on April 12, 1939 when he was a Lieutenant Commander.

title: Staff of Commander Aircraft Battle Force
Scopenote: Staff members of the Commander Aircraft Battle Force are seated and posed for a photograph in San Diego, California.  Standing, from left to right: Lieutenant Coe; [illegible]; Lieutenant Commander Stubbs; Major Thaxton; [illegible]; Lieutenant Harris; Lieutenant Commander Pitts; Lieutenant Commander Glover. Seated from left to right: Commander Duncan; [illegible]; [illegible];  Vice Admiral Ernest King; Captain Bellinger; Commander Royce; Commander Ballentine.

title: Pair of Laysan Albatross Tend a Nest
Scopenote: A pair of Laysan Albatross tend a nest on Midway Island. Photo is part of Lewis Parks's album entitled "Beautiful Midway Goonie Birds." Photo may have been taken by Lewis Parks who was an amateur photographer.

title: Two Laysan Albatross on Midway Island
Scopenote: Two Laysan Albatross on Midway Island. Photo is part of Lewis Parks's album entitled "Beautiful Midway Goonie Birds." Photo may have been taken by Lewis Parks, who was an amateur photographer.

title: Ivy W. Duggan at Cotton Mill
Scopenote: From left to right, Ivy W. Duggan, Congressman William Poage, and Grover Hill converse while evaluating the AAA Cotton Mattress Program.

title: Brigadier General F. L. Martin
Scopenote: Air Force Brigadier General Frederick L. Martin is seated at his desk.

title: Close-up of Beautiful Flower
Scopenote: Close-up view of a beautiful flower. This photo is part of Lewis Parks's album entitled "Beautiful Midway Goonie Birds." Photo may have been taken by Lewis Parks, who was an amateur photographer.

title: Photograph of an Albatross
Scopenote: Photograph of an Albatross on Midway Island.  Photo is part of Lewis Parks's album entitled "Beautiful Midway Goonie Birds." Photo may have been taken by Lewis Parks who was an amateur photographer.

title: Sail Forty Surfacing for L.R.B.P
Scopenote: Tinted drawing of S-40 surfacing.  Embossed with "Sail Forty Surfacing for L.R.B.P."  Lewis Parks served on the S-40 in 1930 as Executive Officer.

title: A Laysan Albatross Parent Feeds a Fledgling
Scopenote: A Laysan Albatross parent feeds a fledgling by regurgitating into the chick's mouth. This photo is part of Lewis Parks's album entitled "Beautiful Midway Goonie Birds." Photo may have been taken by Lewis Parks, who was an amateur photographer.

title: Two Laysan Albatross Caught During Their Mating Ritual
Scopenote: Two Laysan Albatross are photographed during their mating ritual.  The bird on the left is "skypointing," one of the specific movements the species use to attract a mate.  This photo is part of Lewis Parks's album entitled  "Beautiful Midway Goonie Birds." Photo may have been taken by Lewis Parks, who was an amateur photographer.

title: Photograph of a Beautiful Flower
Scopenote: Photograph of a beautiful flower. This photo was part of Lewis Parks's album entitled "Beautiful Midway Goonie Birds." Photo may have been taken by Lewis Parks, who was an amateur photographer.

title: General James Harold Doolittle
Scopenote: Portrait photograph of General James Harold Doolittle of the United States Air Force. Faint inscription reads: "To Colonel Bob Landry, in appreciation of his loyal support. J.H. Doolittle"

title: Collage of Air Corp Military Officers
Scopenote: This is a collage of United States Army Air Force officers. Colonel Robert Landry is in the lower right corner. All others are unidentified.

title: USS Iowa
Scopenote: The USS Iowa, the fourth vessel to carry the name, was launched August 27, 1942, commissioned February 22, 1943 and decommissioned October 26, 1990.

title: A Laysan Albatross Sits On A Nest
Scopenote: A Laysan Albatross is shown sitting on a nest on Midway Island. Photo is part of Lewis Parks's album entitled "Beautiful Midway Goonie Birds." Photo may have been taken by Lewis Parks who was an amateur photographer.

title: USS Tennessee (B-43)
Scopenote: A naval transport  passes in front of the USS Tennessee.  The Tennessee was launched April 30, 1919, commissioned June 3, 1920 and decommissioned February 14, 1947.

title: Photograph of a Beautiful Flower
Scopenote: Photograph of a beautiful flower, possibly an orchid. This photo is part of Lewis Parks's album entitled "Beautiful Midway Goonie Birds." Photo may have been taken by Lewis Parks, who was an amateur photographer.

title: Photograph of a Beautiful Flower
Scopenote: A photograph of a beautiful flower. The photo is part of Lewis Parks's album entitled "Beautiful Midway Goonie Birds." It may have been taken by Lewis Parks, who was an amateur photographer.

title: A Laysan Albatross Parent Snuggles in a Bush with an Older Chick
Scopenote: A Laysan Albatross parent snuggles in a bush with an older chick on Midway Island.  This photo is part of Lewis Parks's album entitled "Beautiful Midway Goonie Birds." Photo may have been taken by Lewis Parks, who was an amateur photographer.

title: View of Diamond Head on the Hawaiian Island of Oahu
Scopenote: Photograph of Diamond Head on the Hawaiian Island of Oahu. This photo is part of Lewis Parks's album entitled "Beautiful Midway Goonie Birds." Photo may have been taken by Lewis Parks, who was an amateur photographer.

title: Ivy W. Duggan With Others
Scopenote: Ivy W. Duggan (far right) stands and talks with a group of unidentified men at an event in Athens, Georgia.

title: Laysan Albatross Photographed in a Bush on Midway Island
Scopenote: A Laysan Albatross photographed in a bush somewhere on Midway Island. Photo is part of Lewis Parks's album entitled "Beautiful Midway Goonie Birds." Photo may have been taken by Lewis Parks who was an amateur photographer.

title: A Grove of Coconut Palms
Scopenote: Photograph of a grove of coconut palms. Photo is part of Lewis Parks's album entitled "Beautiful Midway Goonie Birds." Photo may have been taken by Lewis Parks, who was an amateur photographer.

title: Surf Explodes Through a Blow Hole Somewhere on the Hawaiian Islands
Scopenote: A photograph of the surf exploding through a blow-hole on one of the Hawaiian Islands. This photo is part of Lewis Parks's album entitled "Beautiful Midway Goonie Birds." It may have been taken by Lewis Parks, who was an amateur photographer.

title: USS North Carolina (BB-55)
Scopenote: The USS North Carolina, the fourth vessel to carry the name, was launched June 13, 1940, commissioned April 9, 1941 and decommissioned June 27, 1947.

title: USS Manchester
Scopenote: Tinted photograph of the USS Manchester with the name of the ship embossed in gold letters at bottom. The Manchester was launched March 5, 1946, commissioned October 29, 1946 and decommissioned June 27, 1956. Captain Lewis Parks took command on July 22, 1950.

title: A Laysan Albatross on Midway Island
Scopenote: Photograph of a Laysan Albatross on Midway Island. This photo is part of Lewis Parks's album entitled "Beautiful Midway Goonie Birds." Photo may have been taken by Lewis Parks, who was an amateur photographer.

title: Laysan Albatross Parent Feeds Its Chick
Scopenote: A Laysan Albatross parent feeds its chick that is snuggled in the nest. This photo is part of Lewis Parks's album entitled "Beautiful Midway Goonie Birds." Photo may have been taken by Lewis Parks, who was an amateur photographer.

title: A Laysan Albatross Fledgling
Scopenote: Photograph of a Laysan Albatross fledgling from Midway Island. This photo is part of Lewis Parks's album entitled  "Beautiful Midway Goonie Birds." Photo may have been taken by Lewis Parks, who was an amateur photographer.

title: World War II Pilot
Scopenote: An unidentified pilot emerges from an airplane. The photo is signed: "To a grand commander & pilot. -Gabby"

title: Presentation of Cotton Mattress to Congressman Malcolm Tarver
Scopenote: A presentation is made of a small cotton mattress to Congressman Malcolm Tarver. From left to right stands Ivy W. Duggan, Marvin Jones, Malcom Tarver, and Grover Hill. The men in the background are unidentified.

title: Model for a Ship Figurehead
Scopenote: This photograph of an unidentified woman wearing flower necklaces and a flower in her hair. A basket of fruit is sitting next to her, and she has a cluster of grapes in her hand.

title: Ivy W. Duggan With Colleagues
Scopenote: Ivy W. Duggan (left) stands with some of his associates outside a building in Winter Haven, Florida. All others are unidentified.

title: Army Air Man Hughes
Scopenote: A portrait of Mr. Hughes, Army Air Force member, seated behind a desk.

title: USS Alabama
Scopenote: The USS Alabama is at anchor in Casco Bay, Maine, painted with its dazzle camouflage color scheme.

title: Officers Depart After Recognition Ceremony
Scopenote: An unidentified United States Navy officer returns a salute as he prepares to leave a submarine.  Lieutenant Commander Lewis Parks is standing behind the officer as other unidentified officers salute him. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks's photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: View of a Distant Ship from a Submarine
Scopenote: A ship can be seen far in the distance from the stern of a submarine that is at sea and underway. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks's photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Lieutenant Commander Lewis Parks is Congratulated
Scopenote: Lieutenant Commander Lewis Parks (left), shakes hands with an unidentified United States Navy officer. A group of unidentified officers and sailors stand at attention in the background. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks's photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Lieutenant Commander Lewis Parks Receives Recognition
Scopenote: Lieutenant Commander Lewis Parks (right), receives a recognition ribbon from an unidentified United States Navy officer on board a submarine, probably the Pompano. This is possibly either his first Navy Cross or the Gold Star, both of which he was awarded for service aboard the Pompano. Parks was the captain of the Pompano from 1939 until 1942 when he was detached and assigned to the staff of Commander Submarines, U.S. Atlantic Fleet. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks' photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Sailors Toil On Submarine at Sea and Underway
Scopenote: Two unidentified sailors work topside near the stern of a submarine that is at sea and underway. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks' photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Submarine Sailors Enjoy Dessert
Scopenote: A group of submarine sailors enjoy dessert after their noon meal. Each table seats six men and are folded out of the way when not in use providing the crew a "recreation room" onboard the submarine. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks' photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II." The photograph is cropped off at the top.

title: United States Submarine Underway
Scopenote: An unidentified submarine is pictured at sea and underway. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks' photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Submarine Underway
Scopenote: An unidentified sailor works near the stern of a submarine that is at sea and underway. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks's photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Lieutenant Commander Lewis Parks Shakes Hands with Navy Officer
Scopenote: Lieutenant Commander Lewis Parks (right), shakes hands with an unidentified United States Navy officer after receiving a new recognition ribbon. This is possibly either his first Navy Cross or the Gold Star, both of which he was awarded for service aboard the Pompano. Parks was the captain of the Pompano from 1939 until 1942 when he was detached and assigned to the staff of Commander Submarines, U.S. Atlantic Fleet. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks' photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Naval Officer Salutes Lieutenant Commander Lewis Parks
Scopenote: An unidentified United States Navy officer salutes Lieutenant Commander Lewis Parks (right) as he boards a jetty in preparation for departing a submarine.  An unidentified officer (left) also salutes the officer. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks's photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Naval Officers Pose for Photograph After Receiving Recognition
Scopenote: Five United States submarine officers pose after receiving medals for valor against the enemy. From left to right: Lieutenant Commander Raymond Henry Bass (United States Navy) received the Navy Cross; Lieutenant Commander Willis Manning Thomas (United States Navy) received the Silver Star; Captain Charles W. Styer, Commander Submarine Force, Pacific Fleet awarded the medals; Lieutenant Commander David Rickart Connole (United States Navy) received the Silver Star;  Lieutenant Thomas Patrick McGrath (United States Navy) received a Silver Star, and Lieutenant Ralph F. Pleatman (United States Navy Reserves) received the Navy and Marine Corps Medal.

title: General Robert Landry
Scopenote: Candid image of Colonel Robert Landry appearing to be near a microphone.

title: Officers Discuss Raid on Makin Island
Scopenote: Lieutenant Colonel Evans F. Carlson (left), Chief of the United States Marine Raiders and Lieutenant Commander William Brockman, United States Navy, look at a map of Makin Island and discuss the successful attack. Lieutenant Commander Brockman's submarine shelled Japanese installations on the island while Lieutenant Colonel Carlson's Raiders went ashore and destroyed an enemy seaplane base, killing eighty Japanese. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks's photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Talking It Over After the Raid on Makin Island
Scopenote: Aboard the submarine that carried them to Makin Island for their surprise raid and back to Pearl Harbor, United States Marine Raider chiefs talk the situation over with Navy officers who cooperated in the successful attack. In the foreground are Lieutenant Commander William Brockman (United States Navy) and Major James Roosevelt (United States Marine Corps). At the right, holding a dispatch case is Lieutenant Colonel Evans F. Carlson, commanding officer of the Marine Raider battalion. Others are unidentified. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks' photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Marine Raiders Line the Deck of the United States Submarine
Scopenote: Marines who took part in the Makin Island raid on August 17-18, 1942, line the deck of their submarine. They are receiving accolades from Admiral Chester Nimitz (left), the commander-in-chief of the Pacific. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks's photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Good Luck Dinner Before the Makin Island Raid
Scopenote: The night before the raid on Makin Island, the submarine chefs wished the Marine Raiders "good luck" with a decorated cake.  Lieutenant Colonel Evans F. Carlson, Raider chief, cuts the first piece as Lieutenant Commander C. L. Hogan (right) and Lieutenant Commander William Brockman (left) look on while unidentified others stand watching. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks's photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Marines Ready to Go Topside to Join the Makin Island Raid
Scopenote: Two unidentified United States Marines, part of the U.S. Marine Raiders taking part in the August 17-18, 1942 raid on Makin Island, prepare to go topside and join the others. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks's photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Print of Painting of the USS South Dakota (BB-57)
Scopenote: A black and white copy of a watercolor painting by Dwight Shepler of the USS South Dakota in action with Japanese planes during the Battle of Santa Cruz which took place October 11-26, 1942.

title: USS Alabama
Scopenote: The USS Alabama, the sixth vessel to carry the name, is painted with dazzle camouflage.  The Alabama was launched on February 16, 1942, commissioned August 16, 1942 and decommissioned January 9, 1947.

title: Sailors Sleeping Quarters on a Submarine
Scopenote: Four unidentified sailors relax in the sleeping area of a United States Navy submarine. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks's photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Sailor On a Submarine Takes a Drink of Water
Scopenote: An unidentified submarine sailor takes a drink from a drinking fountain on a United States Navy submarine. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks's photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Submarine Docked in a Harbor
Scopenote: An unidentified submarine is docked in a harbor, location unknown. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks' photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Sailor Looks Into a Submarine From Above
Scopenote: An unidentified sailor looks down the ladder that leads to the inside of a United States submarine. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Unknown Military Officer
Scopenote: An unknown military officer poses for a candid portrait.

title: The Galley of a Submarine
Scopenote: An unidentified Navy cook smiles for the camera and displays the roasting fowls being prepared for dinner on board the submarine.  The photograph is included in Lewis Parks's photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Relaxing on a United States Submarine
Scopenote: Four unidentified submarine sailors relax while off duty on a United States Navy submarine. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks's photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Air Force Officer Bud O'Brien
Scopenote: United States Air Force Officer Bud O'Brien poses for a photo.

title: Two Military Officers and Unknown Woman
Scopenote: Two unidentified military officers and an unidentified woman sit on the floor around a small table eating and drinking a bottle of champagne. Location unknown.

title: Unknown Airman
Scopenote: An unknown United States Airman smiles in a candid photo.

title: Officer Receives Military Honor
Scopenote: An unknown military officer receives either a promotion or honor from another unknown military officer.

title: Air Force Officer Pratt
Scopenote: United States Air Force Officer Mr. Pratt during World War II.

title: USS Alabama
Scopenote: The USS Alabama, surrounded by tug boats. The exact location is unknown.

title: View of One of a Submarine's Work Areas
Scopenote: A group of unidentified sailors and officers study gauges in one of the working areas of a United States Navy submarine. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks' photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Sailors Working on a Submarine
Scopenote: Two unidentified sailors work in what appears to be part of the engine room of a submarine. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks's photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Unknown Air Force Officer
Scopenote: An unknown Air Force officer is seated in front of a map.

title: Unknown Air Force Officer
Scopenote: An unknown United States Air Force officer poses for photo.

title: Airman Looks Out From Cockpit
Scopenote: An unknown United States Airman looks out of his aircraft from his cockpit.

title: Unknown Air Force Officer
Scopenote: An unknown United States Air Force officer is seated in front of a map. Image was most likely taken during World War II.

title: Unknown Air Force Officer
Scopenote: Unknown United States Army Air Force officer poses for a photo outside at a military base during a snow storm.

title: Portrait of Major F. J. Donohue
Scopenote: Major F.J. "Jiggs" Donohue, chief of the 95th Bomb Group intelligence section during World War II, sits behind a desk.

title: Working in Tight Spaces on a United States Submarine
Scopenote: An unidentified submarine sailor works in a confined area on a United States Navy submarine.  The photograph is included in Lewis Parks's photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Watching for the Enemy
Scopenote: An unidentified United States Navy officer stands atop the submarine lookout with binoculars ready should unidentified aircraft or ships appear. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks's photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Loading Torpedoes on a U.S. Submarine
Scopenote: Three unidentified sailors work together to load the torpedoes on a United States Navy submarine. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks's photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Keeping Clean on a Submarine
Scopenote: An unidentified sailor takes a shower while another sailor washes clothes onboard a United States Navy submarine. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks's photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Lieutenant Commander Lewis Parks Receives Recognition
Scopenote: Lieutenant Commander Lewis Parks, with back to camera, receives a new recognition ribbon from an unidentified United States Navy officer on board a submarine, probably the Pompano. This is possibly either his first Navy Cross or the Gold Star, both of which he was awarded for service aboard the Pompano. Parks was the captain of the Pompano from 1939 until 1942 when he was detached and assigned to the staff of Commander Submarines, U.S. Atlantic Fleet. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks' photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Military Officer Seated Outside
Scopenote: An unknown military officer is seated in a chair outside holds a glass. A car is parked behind him.

title: A Submarine Surfaces
Scopenote: A submarine bow knifes sharply upward as it surfaces.  The photograph is included in Lewis Parks's photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Unidentified Men Sit on a Couch
Scopenote: Three unidentified men are sitting on a couch.

Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (left) is seated next to Captain Harry Davis (right).

Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (left) is seated next to Captain Harry Davis (right).

Scopenote: Congressman Walter Judd (left) is standing in a room with Senator Harry S. Truman (right).

Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (right) is seated on a bed with Ed McKim (left).

Scopenote: A portrait of Congressman Walter Judd of Minnesota.

Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman appears to be sitting on a bed.

Scopenote: The USS Mississippi (BB-41) bombards Makin Island in the Gilbert Islands as seen from the USS Baltimore (CA-68).

Scopenote: An unidentified group of airmen are working near a military airplane during World War II.

Scopenote: Three military officers and a woman are seated holding drinks. All are unidentified.

Scopenote: An unknown man looks at the camera and an unknown woman raises her glass. All are siting on the ground, possibly sharing a picnic.

Scopenote: Two unknown women and an a man pose for a photo holding golf bags.

title: Robert Landry at Table with Two Women
Scopenote: Colonel Robert Landry (right) is seated at a table outside with two unknown women.

title: Military Officer Sits in a Chair
Scopenote: An unknown military officer sits in a lawn chair outside with a drink and cigarette.

Scopenote: Two military personnel and a woman are at a pond. All are unidentified.

Scopenote: A woman sits in a lawn chair next to a military officer outside in front of a car parked in a driveway. Both are unidentified.

Scopenote: Landscape image of a cemetery, most likely located in Europe during World War II.

title: Nine Men Playing Volleyball
Scopenote: Nine men play volleyball in an outdoor field. All are unidentified.

title: Group of Civilians on Roadside
Scopenote: A group of civilians pose for a photo on a roadside holding a flag. Possibly from the Netherlands. All people are unidentified.

title: USS Pennsylvania (B-38) Bombarding Guam Island
Scopenote: The USS Pennsylvania, the third vessel to carry the name, is shown during a bombardment of Guam Island in 1944.  The Pennsylvania was launched March 16, 1915, commissioned June 12, 1916 and decommissioned August 29, 1946.

title: Ivy W. Duggan Taking Oath
Scopenote: Ivy W. Duggan (center with hand raised) takes his oath as he is sworn in as the Governor of the Farm Credit Administration. From left to right: Under Secretary of Agriculture Grover Hill, Secretary of Agriculture Claude Wickard, Ivy Duggan, Chief Clerk of the Department of Agriculture Arthur B. Thatcher, unidentified, and War Food Administrator Marvin Jones.

title: B-17s Flying in Formation
Scopenote: United States Air Force, 8th Air Force, B-17 Flying Fortresses flying in formation during World War II.

title: Anti-Aircraft Fire Over Ludwigshafen, Germany
Scopenote: United States Air Force aircraft take on anti-aircraft fire, or flak, over Ludwigshafen, Germany during World War II.

title: Consolidated B-24D Airplane Hit By Anti-Aircraft Fire
Scopenote: United States Air Force, 8th Air Force, Consolidated B-24D Liberator hit by anti-aircraft fire. Image taken in-air from another airplane. The wording on the picture says "Price of Victory." This B-24 was called the "Little Warrior" with nose art of a Native American Indian painted on the side.

title: B-17 Aircraft Releasing Bombs
Scopenote: United States Air Force, B-17 aircraft release bombs during World War II.

title: B-17 Releasing Bombs
Scopenote: A United States Air Force, 8th Air Force, B-17 Flying Fortress releases bombs during World War II.

title: Robert Landry and Two Officers
Scopenote: Colonel Robert Landry, far left, poses with two other unknown military members in front of a map of England.

Scopenote: Two unknown women and an unknown man sit outside and have a picnic.

title: Military Officers Give Presentation
Scopenote: A large metal object, possibly an unexploded bomb, sits in a hole in the ground with a group of men standing around. One man holds a piece of paper giving a presentation. All pictured are unknown.

title: Military Jeep Parked By Pond
Scopenote: A military jeep is parked in front of a building by a pond. Snow is on the ground.

Scopenote: Snow covered building, most likely in England during World War II.

title: Building Alongside of Road
Scopenote: A small building sits alongside a road with telephone and telegraph wires overhead. The location is unknown.

Scopenote: Ivy W. Duggan (left) shows a magazine about cotton to an unidentified woman.

Scopenote: United States Air Force, 8th Air Force, B-17 Flying Fortresses fly in formation during World War II.

Scopenote: United States Air Force military call center during an operation. All men are unknown.

Scopenote: An unknown woman sits at a table.

Scopenote: Two unknown men and a woman sit on the ground in a circle with a thermos and what might be a picnic between them.

Scopenote: An unknown military personnel member peers out a door at an unknown location.

Scopenote: A map of Germany during World War II shows the United States target points and positions of troops.

Scopenote: A United States Air Force, 8th Air Force, B-17 Flying Fortress flies over cloudy skies.

Scopenote: United States Air Force, 8th Air Force, B-17 Flying Fortress releases bombs during World War II.

Scopenote: Three unidentified sailors watch as a swimmer in a swim mask climbs out of the ocean while relaxing at Camp Dealey.  Four other swimmers can be seen in the background. Scopenote: Four unidentified officers share a laugh while onboard a naval vessel. Photograph is part of an album entitled "Submarine Pictures WWII."

Scopenote: A group of submariners on leave at Camp Dealey pose under the palm trees.  Lewis Parks is third from the left next to an unidentified woman and behind a man holding a cup. Scopenote: Aerial view of a city destroyed after a bombing raid during World War II. The location is unknown.

Scopenote: Aerial view taken during a bombing raid during World War II. Location is unknown.

Scopenote: Photograph of damage to a United States submarine. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks's photo album entitled "Damaged Subs."

Scopenote: Admiral Lewis Parks (left) talks with an unidentified photographer (right) while two other unidentified naval officers look on. Photograph is part of an album entitled "Submarine Pictures WWII."

Scopenote: Four unidentified naval officers pose for a photograph while onboard a naval vessel.  Photograph is part of an album entitled "Submarine Pictures WWII."

Scopenote: An unknown man, wearing a Nazi uniform, holds a black comb up to his face to resemble Adolf Hitler as he makes a Nazi salute under a piece of a Nazi airplane.

Scopenote: Aerial view of an unknown location during a bombing raid during World War II.

Scopenote: Bombs are released during an attack over an unknown location.

Scopenote: Aerial view of Bad Kreuznach, Germany during bombing raids in World War II.

Scopenote: Aerial view of an unknown town during a bombing raid.

title: Captured Japanese Submarines
Scopenote: Three captured Japanese submarines at a dock ARE being assessed by United States Navy sailors.

Scopenote: Colonel Robert Landry inspects airmen at a military base, most likely in England, during World War II. Landry is left, all others are unknown.

Scopenote: Aerial view of Winterhausen, Germany during World War II.

Scopenote: Aerial view of Fulda, Germany during World War II.

Scopenote: Aerial view of Dusseldorf, Germany during World War II.

Scopenote: Aerial view of Gustrow, Germany during World War II.

Scopenote: Aerial view of bombs being dropped on Grafenwohr, Germany during World War II. Grafenwohr was the location of Nazi training camps. The United States army took control of the training camp on April 20, 1945.

Scopenote: Aerial view of bombs being dropped over Schleissheim, Germany during World War II.

Scopenote: Aerial bombing plans for Nauen and Wustermark, Germany during World War II. Nauen was the location of a radio transmission station during the war.

Scopenote: Robert Landry, executive officer of the 93rd Combat Wing during World War II (right), poses with a Nazi officer's hat on next to two unknown people during the 93rd Combat Wing Anniversary Party.

title: 93rd Combat Wing 1st Anniversary
Scopenote: Robert Landry sits at a table, second from left, laughing with others during the 93rd Combat Wing 1st Anniversary. Others pictured are unidentified.

title: 93rd Combat Wing Anniversary Party
Scopenote: An unknown woman wears a Nazi officer's hat during the 93rd Combat Wing 1st Anniversary party. All pictured are unknown.

title: Attendees at 93rd Combat Wing Anniversary
Scopenote: Three men and a woman, all unknown, attend the 93rd Combat Wing 1st Anniversary.

title: 93rd Combat Wing 1st Anniversary
Scopenote: Robert Landry, far left, attends the 93rd Combat Wing 1st Anniversary. Landry was executive officer. All others pictured are unknown.

Scopenote: An unknown man and unknown woman attend the 93rd Combat Wing 1st Anniversary.

title: 93rd Combat Wing Anniversary Party
Scopenote: Officer wears Nazi officer's hat during 93rd Combat Wing 1st Anniversary party. All pictured are unidentified.

Scopenote: A man and a woman look down on a document being held by another man during the 93rd Combat Wing 1st Anniversary. All are unknown.

Scopenote: An unknown man and unknown woman sit together during the 93rd Combat Wing 1st Anniversary party.

title: 93rd Combat Wing 1st Anniversary
Scopenote: Attendees of the 93rd Combat Wing 1st Anniversary go through a buffet line. All are unidentified.

title: 93rd Combat Wing Anniversary Party
Scopenote: An unknown airman far right, wears a Nazi officer's hat, belt and medal while at the 93rd Combat Wing Anniversary Party during World War II. All pictured are unidentified.

title: Briefing for Chowhound Mission
Scopenote: Pilots receive briefing for the Chowhound Mission. Chowhound was a humanitarian relief mission flown by the United States Air Force to drop food and supplies to civilians in the Netherlands during World War II. All are unidentified.

title: Aerial View of Rotterdam, Netherlands During Food Drop
Scopenote: Mission 973: As part of a relief effort flown by 396 B-17s to the Netherlands, 237 B-17s dropped food supplies into Rotterdam, Netherlands.

title: Aerial view of Amsterdam, Netherlands
Scopenote: Aerial view of Amsterdam, Netherlands during World War II. The air craft was flying over the area for rest and relaxation.

title: Aerial View of Amsterdam, Netherlands
Scopenote: Aerial view of Dam Square in Amsterdam, Netherlands during World War II. The pilot was flying over during rest leave.

title: Aerial View of Amsterdam, Netherlands
Scopenote: Aerial view of Central Cathedral in Amsterdam, Netherlands during World War II. The pilot flying over was on rest leave.

title: Aerial View of Amsterdam and Schipol, Netherlands
Scopenote: Aerial view of Amsterdam and Schipol, Netherlands areas during World War II.

title: Two Military Officers During Staff Meeting
Scopenote: Two unknown military officers shake hands in a garden during a staff meeting.

title: Colonel Robert Landry and Officers
Scopenote: A group of military officers attend a staff meeting and are photographed on a lawn. Seated in the first row, third from the left, is Colonel Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

title: Battleship Squadron Bombards Kamaishi, Japan
Scopenote: Task Force 34.8.1 battleship squadron 2 bombarding Kamaishi, 275 miles off Tokyo, Japan, as seen from the USS South Dakota (BB-57), July 14, 1945. Battleships from foreground to background are: USS Indiana (BB-58), USS Massachusetts (BB-59), USS Quincy (CA-71), and USS Chicago (CA -136).

title: Mountain Side View of Valley in Japan
Scopenote: Photograph of a large structure with multiple buildings, possibly a farm near or in Nagasaki, Japan. Image shows tiered farm fields surrounding the area that is centered in a valley along mountains.

title: Traditional Japanese Torii Gate Survives Bombing of Nagasaki
Scopenote: A Japanese Torii gate survives the atomic bombing of Nagasaki, Japan. Surrounding the torii is destruction. Two unidentified people can been seen walking under the torii.

title: United States Military Trucks on Boat Headed to Japan
Scopenote: United States military trucks are parked on a shipping boat headed to Japan in 1945. These military trucks would have been used as a part of the occupational period in Japan after the Japanese surrendered in August 1945.

title: Interior of Destroyed Building in Nagasaki, Japan
Scopenote: Photograph of a destroyed building's interior caused by the dropping of the atomic bomb in Nagasaki, Japan on August 9, 1945. Rubble covers the floor of the building and metal beams from the roof still hang over the walls.

title: Smoke Stack Surrounded by Rubble from Atomic Bomb in Nagasaki, Japan
Scopenote: A smoke stack still stands from a building that was destroyed during the atomic bombing of Nagasaki, Japan on August 8, 1945. Rubble can be seen to the horizon were a mountain range is visible.

title: Destruction in Nagasaki, Japan
Scopenote: Photograph of a man pulling a car loaded with items across a bridge that was damaged during the bombing of Nagasaki, Japan on August 9, 1945. American soldiers stand and sit along the sides of the bridge during the occupation period. In the background, two large cylinder forms appear along with electrical wire poles. All people are unidentified.

title: Destruction of Nagasaki, Japan
Scopenote: Steam from a train can be seen as it goes by the destruction of Nagasaki, Japan with mountains in the background. In the photograph, new wire poles have been erected along the damaged brick road.

title: Naval Officers Outside Yokosuka Submarine Base
Scopenote: A group of United States Navy submarine officers pose outside the entrance to the Yokosuka Submarine Base. The photograph was taken shortly after the Japanese surrendered. Lewis Parks can be seen fifth from the left in the front row. All others are unidentified.

title: Japanese Survivors in Nagasaki, Japan
Scopenote: Seven unidentified Japanese survivors walk down a street in Nagasaki, Japan after the atomic bomb was dropped on August 9, 1945. In the background are rubble and the remains of two buildings. Two of the women in the photograph are carrying children on their backs.

title: Devastation in Nagasaki, Japan After Atomic Bombing
Scopenote: Photograph taken in Nagasaki, Japan after the atomic bombing on August 9, 1945. The image shows only a few structures standing surrounded by rubble.

title: Scene of Destruction in Nagasaki, Japan
Scopenote: A scene of destruction in the aftermath of the atomic bomb that was dropped on Nagasaki, Japan on August 9, 1945.

title: Luncheon at a Boarding House
Scopenote: Men pose for a photograph at a luncheon held at a boarding house owned by the Evan Hall Sugar Cooperative. Seated from right to left are E. Chavanne, E. B. Reid, Dr. Keller, S. M. Thomson, John Brown, Ivy W. Duggan, D. M. Hardy, Harold Hedges, R. R. Clarke, A. C. Adams, J. P. Strong, H. Stephens, S. Y. McConnell, S. D. Sanders.

title: A Group of Naval Officers Pose for a Photograph
Scopenote: A group of United States Navy officers pose for a photograph, probably at New London, Connecticut submarine base where Admiral Lewis Parks was stationed in 1929 and 1946. All are unidentified except the first man on the left, John Martin. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks' photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Admiral Lewis Parks with a Group of Officers
Scopenote: Admiral Lewis Parks (standing, fourth from left) poses with a group of unidentified United States Navy officers. The photograph appears to have been taken on a ship. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks' photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Sailors Take a Swim from the Deck of a Submarine
Scopenote: A group of unidentified sailors are taking time for a swim.  One sailor is jumping off the deck of the submarine. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Sailors Working Inside a United States Submarine
Scopenote: Three unidentified sailors are working inside a United States Submarine. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Looking Across the Bow of a United States Submarine
Scopenote: A United States submarine is underway, looking out towards the ocean. In the foreground, an unidentified member of the crew looks out to sea. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Looking Down on Sailor Holding a Nautical Instrument
Scopenote: An unidentified submarine sailor holds a nautical instrument as he stands on the deck of the submarine. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Looking Up Toward the Submarine's Periscope
Scopenote: Two unidentified submarine sailors are photographed from below with what appears to be the submarine's periscope above them.  Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Submariners Working in a Tight Space
Scopenote: Four unidentified sailors monitor gauges and equipment on a United States submarine in a very tight space. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Sailors Tending a Submarine in Port
Scopenote: Unidentified sailors clean up and repair a submarine docked in port. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Sailors Working on a United States Submarine
Scopenote: Four unidentified sailors are work aboard a United States submarine. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Submarine Sailor Speaking into a Transmitter
Scopenote: An unidentified sailor wearing a headset speaks into a transmitter while standing in the hatch of a United States submarine. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT." (2015-214)

title: Sailor Talking Into a Transmitter
Scopenote: A close-up of an unidentified sailor wearing a headset and speaking into a transmitter while standing in the open hatch of a United States Submarine. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT." (2015-213)

title: Sailor Prepared to Take Transmission
Scopenote: An unidentified sailor wearing a headset, appears ready to transcribe outgoing and incoming transmissions.

title: A Bombed Out Building
Scopenote: Photograph of a bombed out building. The location is unknown but most likely in Japan. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks' photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Sailors Doing Paperwork Onboard a United States Submarine
Scopenote: Four unidentified officers update logs and paperwork while onboard a United States submarine. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Submarine at Sea
Scopenote: An almost frontal view of a United States submarine with its reflection on the calm waters. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Monitoring the Depth Gauges on a United States Submarine
Scopenote: Two unidentified sailors monitor the depth gauges on a United States submarine while a third unidentified sailor looks upward in preparation for climbing the ladder to the next level. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Three Sailors Work Inside a United States Submarine
Scopenote: Three unidentified sailors work inside a United States Submarine. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Three Sailors Working on the Conning Tower of a Submarine
Scopenote: Three unidentified sailors are working around the conning tower of a United States submarine.  The sailor at the top is scanning the horizon with binoculars. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: A Sailor Scans the Horizon While an Officer Relaxes
Scopenote: An unidentified sailor scans the horizon with binoculars from the conning tower of a United States submarine while an unidentified officer relaxes next to him. The sailor with the binoculars has two visible tattoos on his arm. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: An Officer Mans the Periscope on a United States Submarine
Scopenote: An unidentified officer uses the periscope on a United States submarine while two unidentified sailors and a second unidentified officer monitor the gauges. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Three Sailors Working Inside a United States Submarine
Scopenote: Three unidentified sailors work at various stations inside a United States submarine. A tattoo can be seen on one sailor's arm. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Three Submarine Sailors Watch the Depth Gauges
Scopenote: Three unidentified sailors monitor the depth gauges while working on board a United States submarine.  One of the sailors has a visible tattoo on his forearm. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Two Sailors Monitor the Gauges While Working on a United States Submarine
Scopenote: Two unidentified sailors monitor the gauges while working on a United States submarine. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Sailors Receiving Instructions from an Officer at the Submarine School
Scopenote: A group of sailors receive instruction from an unidentified officer about a diesel engine in order to be able to make emergency repairs. The class is being conducted at New London, Connecticut, where Admiral Lewis Parks was stationed in 1946. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks' photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: A Group of Naval Officers Pose for a Photograph
Scopenote: Two unidentified naval officers shake hands as the rest look on. All are unidentified. Most likely this photo was taken at the New London, Connecticut, Submarine School where Admiral Lewis Parks was stationed in 1929 and 1946. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks' photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: A Group of Naval Officers Pose for a Photograph
Scopenote: A group of naval officers pose for a photograph, probably in New London, Connecticut, at the submarine base where Lewis Parks was stationed in 1929 and 1946. All but one of the officers is unidentified. The first officer on the left is identified with a handwritten note on the photo as John Martin. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks' photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: The Conning Tower of a United States Submarine
Scopenote: Two unidentified sailors and one unidentified officer are working on the conning tower of a United States submarine. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: A United States Submarine Enters Port
Scopenote: A United States submarine enters port, probably New London, Connecticut. The sailors on the dock and on board the deck of the ship are all unidentified. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: A United States Submarine
Scopenote: Photograph of a United States submarine. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Looking Across the Bow of a United States Submarine
Scopenote: Looking across the bow of a United States submarine that is underway.  In the foreground, an unidentified member of the crew looks out to sea. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: A Sailor Scans the Horizon
Scopenote: An unidentified sailor scans the horizon with binoculars while at sea on board a United States Submarine. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: A Submariner Sleeps Atop Two Torpedoes
Scopenote: An unidentified sailor sleeps in his bunk which is directly over two submarine torpedoes. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Sailors Sitting on Bunks Atop Torpedoes
Scopenote: Two unidentified sailors sit in their bunks exchanging photographs or letters. One bunk is on top of two submarine torpedoes and the other is beside them. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Sailors Scan the Horizon from The Conning Tower of a United States Submarine
Scopenote: Three unidentified sailors and two unidentified naval officers scan the horizon with binoculars from the conning tower of a United States submarine. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Showering and Washing Clothes Onboard a United States Submarine
Scopenote: One sailor showers while another washes clothes in a General Electric washing machine on board a United States submarine. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Photograph of the Deck of a Submarine
Scopenote: Two submarines are docked, probably at New London, Connecticut. The people visible on the far submarine are unidentified. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Sailors Scan the Horizon from the Conning Tower
Scopenote: Two unidentified sailors face the bow of a United States submarine and scan the horizon with binoculars. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Participants in Naval Ceremony Salute the Flag
Scopenote: Naval and civilian personnel on board a United States submarine participate in what appears to be a flag ceremony.  The officers salute as the bugler plays. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: A United States Submarine in Port Draped in Bunting
Scopenote: The United States submarine Bluegill (SS-242), with a small tugboat in the rear, is at port draped in bunting. The sailors on the deck of the ship are unidentified. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Three Sailors On the Deck of a United States Submarine
Scopenote: Three unidentified sailors are walking on the deck of a United States submarine. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: A Ceremony Onboard a United States Submarine
Scopenote: A group of unidentified naval officers a several civilians participate in an unknown ceremony on board a United States submarine.  A military bugler stands in the foreground.

title: Three Sailors Atop the Conning Tower Scan the Horizon
Scopenote: Three unidentified sailors sit atop the conning tower on a United States submarine and scan the horizon with binoculars. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: A Submarine Sailor Works on the Radio Antenna
Scopenote: An unidentified sailor works on what appears to be a submarine's radio antenna. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Eating in the Officers Mess Onboard a United States Submarine
Scopenote: Three unidentified officers are eating in the officer's mess aboard a United States submarine. In the background an unidentified cook peers through the "pass-through" and a second unidentified steward prepares to serve some food. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: A Submariner Watches the Gauges While Working on a United States Submarine
Scopenote: A unidentified sailor watches the gauges and instruments while working inside a United States submarine. A "pin-up" photo can be seen above the top row of gauges. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Officers Onboard a United States Submarine Converse
Scopenote: Three unidentified officers converse over paperwork while serving aboard a United States submarine.  In the background is a map of the Pacific Ocean and a print of a Cod fish. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: A Sailor Climbs Down the Ladder Into a Submarine
Scopenote: An unidentified sailor prepares to climb down the ladder into a United States submarine. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: A Team of Sailors Scan the Horizon
Scopenote: A team of unidentified sailors and officers scan the horizon with binoculars while on board a United States ship.

title: Sunset Seen from the Bow of a United States Submarine
Scopenote: This is a photograph of the sun as it sets behind the clouds while looking across the bow of a United States submarine.

title: Guns and Communication Tower of  United States Ship
Scopenote: This is a photograph of the guns and the communication tower of a United States ship, possibly the Manchester.

title: Sailor in Office of Submarine
Scopenote: An unidentified sailor poses in the office on board a submarine. The photograph is included in Lewis Parks' photo album entitled "Submarine Pictures W. War II."

title: Photograph of Sailor with Binoculars
Scopenote: An artistic shot looking up at the rigging on a United States submarine at an unidentified sailor spotting with binoculars. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Two Sailors Work Onboard a United States Submarine
Scopenote: One unidentified sailor works a wheel while another unidentified sailor appears to be transmitting information through a headset microphone while working onboard a United States submarine.  Behind them on the wall is a print of a Cero, a large Gulf Coast Mackerel. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Sailor Talks into Microphone While Working on a United States Submarine
Scopenote: One unidentified sailor talks into a headset microphone while another unidentified sailor stands above him.  Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Sailors Working Below Deck on a Submarine
Scopenote: Five unidentified sailors are working below deck on a United States Submarine. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Submarine Sailor Looks Out to Sea
Scopenote: An unidentified submarine sailor is looking out to sea.  Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Sailor Scans the Horizon From the Conning Tower
Scopenote: An unidentified sailor scans the horizon with binoculars from the conning tower of a United States submarine. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Looking From the Bow of a United States Submarine Toward the Stern
Scopenote: Looking from the bow of a United States Submarine toward the stern. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Another Submarine on the Horizon
Scopenote: A submarine is viewed in the distance from on board a ship with a lifeboat. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Working Inside a United States Submarine
Scopenote: On the left in the photograph, three unidentified sailors work inside a United States submarine. The unidentified man on the right is operating the submarine periscope. Behind him is another unidentified sailor. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Sailor Emerging from the Hatch of a Submarine
Scopenote: An unidentified sailor smiles at the camera as he emerges from the hatch of a United States submarine. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Sailors Handling Ordinance on a United States Submarine
Scopenote: A group of unidentified sailors are handling ordnance while aboard a United States submarine.  One sailor's face is obscured by smoke. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: Photograph of a Bearded Sailor
Scopenote: An unidentified young sailor sports a full beard.

title: The USS Missouri and USS Yavuz Transit the Bosporus Strait
Scopenote: The USS Missouri (center) and the Yavuz (right) are photographed from a hill in Istanbul, Turkey as they transit the Bosporus Strait. A mosque is in the near foreground. Three unidentified visitors are almost hidden by the brush at the bottom of the picture.

title: Ivy W. Duggan Receiving a Citation
Scopenote: Ivy W. Duggan (right) is looking at a Treasury Bond Citation to the Farm Credit Administration with an unidentified man.

title: Postcard of Christ the Redeemer statue from Rio de Janeiro
Scopenote: A postcard of the Christ the Redeemer statue in Rio de Janeiro sent from Eugene Van Vooren to his wife. The message on the back of the postcard reads "We're anchored in the shadows of this statue. Love, Gene". Mr. Van Vooren was in Brazil on board the USS Missouri as it traveled there to bring President Harry S. Truman back to the United States after his official visit to Brazil.

title: Unidentified Sailors Posing with Christ the Redeemer Statue, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Scopenote: A group of unidentified sailors poses with the Christ the Redeemer statue in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil during President Harry S. Truman's visit to Brazil.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Captain Robert Dennison
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shakes hands with Captain Robert Dennison (right) on board the USS Missouri during the President's return trip to the United States following his visit to Brazil.

title: USS Missouri at Sea
Scopenote: The battleship USS Missouri anchored during President Harry S. Truman's visit to Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

title: Rio Bay, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Scopenote: A view of Rio Bay with Rio de Janeiro, Brazil in the background during President Harry S. Truman's visit to Brazil.

title: Brazilian Military in the Brazilian Independence Day Parade
Scopenote: A group of Brazilian military men march in the Brazilian Independence Day parade in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. This parade took place during the official visit of President Harry S. Truman to Brazil.

title: Brazilian Military in Brazilian Independence Day Parade, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Scopenote: Members of the Brazilian military march during the Brazilian Independence Day parade in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. The parade happened during President Harry S. Truman's visit to Brazil. This parade was the 125th anniversary of Brazilian independence from Portugal. All are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman with President Dutra during the President's visit to Brazil
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center left) with President of Brazil Eurico Gaspar Dutra (center right) are standing as they review a Brazilian Independence Day parade. Standing on the left of President Truman is First Lady Bess W. Truman. Margaret Truman is second from the left, waving. All others are unidentified.

title: Brazilian Military, Brazilian Independence Day Parade, Rio de Janeiro
Scopenote: Members of the Brazilian military march during the Brazilian Independence Day parade in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. The parade happened during President Harry S. Truman's visit to Brazil. This parade was the 125th anniversary of Brazilian independence from Portugal. All are unidentified.

title: Unidentified Man at Crossing the Equator Ceremony, USS Missouri
Scopenote: An unidentified man is dressed up like a pirate during a ceremony held aboard the USS Missouri to mark the ship's crossing the equator. This ship was en route from Rio de Janeiro, Brazil to Norfolk, Virginia during President Harry S. Truman's visit to Brazil. All others are unidentified.

title: Unidentified Man at Crossing the Equator Ceremony, USS Missouri
Scopenote: An unidentified man is dressed up like a policeman during a ceremony to mark the USS Missouri crossing the equator. The ceremony occurred en route from Rio de Janeiro, Brazil to Norfolk, Virginia during President Harry S. Truman's visit to Brazil. All others are unidentified.

title: Crossing the Equator Ceremony Aboard USS Missouri
Scopenote: Sailors and other on board participate in a ceremony to mark the USS Missouri's crossing of the equator en route from Rio de Janeiro, Brazil to Norfolk, Virginia following President Harry S. Truman's visit to Brazil. All are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman, crossing the equator ceremony, USS Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center), with crowd of unidentified men during a crossing the equator ceremony on board the USS Missouri. President Truman traveled on board the USS Missouri en route from Rio de Janeiro, Brazil to Norfolk, Virginia following his visit to Brazil. Standing behind and to the left of President Truman is Admiral William Leahy. All others are unidentified.

title: Unidentified Man at Crossing the Equator Ceremony, USS Missouri
Scopenote: An unidentified man dressed as a clergyman during a ceremony held to mark the USS Missouri crossing the equator. The ceremony took place en route from Rio de Janeiro, Brazil to Norfolk, Virginia during President Harry S. Truman's visit to Brazil. All others are unidentified.

title: Unidentified Men Dressed Up for Crossing the Equator Ceremony, USS Missouri
Scopenote: Two unidentified men dressed as King Neptune and Queen Amphitrite during the crossing the equator ceremony on board the USS Missouri. The ceremony took place as the ship traveled Rio de Janeiro, Brazil to Norfolk, Virginia during President Harry S. Truman's visit to Brazil. All are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman, Crossing the Equator Ceremony, USS Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, marked) participates in a ceremony to observe the USS Missouri's crossing of the equator. The ceremony too place as he traveled Rio de Janeiro, Brazil to Norfolk, Virginia after his visit to Brazil. Standing next to President Truman on the left is Captain James Foskett. Standing in the naval uniform below and to the right of President Truman is Admiral William Leahy. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Reviews Sailors, USS Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman reviews assembled unidentified sailors on board the USS Missouri as he returns to the United States from Brazil. The naval officer standing next to President Truman is Captain Robert Dennison, the Commanding Officer of the USS Missouri.

title: President Harry S. Truman Reviews Sailors on Board the USS Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (walking down center) reviews sailors on board the USS Missouri. President Truman is on board the USS Missouri as he returns to the United States from a official visit to Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. All others are unidentified.

title: Exterior of the First Presbyterian Church, Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: A street view of the exterior of First Presbyterian Church in Independence, Missouri, where Harry S. Truman first met Bess Wallace.   Donor: Louise T. Rixey.

title: Front of the Truman Home, Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: A street view of the exterior of the home of President Harry S. Truman and First Lady Bess W. Truman, located at 219 North Delaware Street, Independence, Missouri. This view is directly in front of the house, taken from Delaware Street.  Donor: Louise T. Rixey.

title: Exterior of the Truman Home
Scopenote: A street view of the exterior of the home of President Harry S. Truman and First Lady Bess W. Truman, located at 219 North Delaware Street, Independence, Missouri.   Donor: Louise T. Rixey.

title: Homes Along Delaware Street, Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: A view of some of the homes along Delaware Street in Independence, Missouri, near the home of President Harry S. Truman and First Lady Bess W. Truman.   Donor: Louise T. Rixey.

title: Exterior of Truman-Wallace Home
Scopenote: A street view of the exterior of the home of President Harry S. Truman and First Lady Bess W. Truman, located at 219 North Delaware Street, Independence, Missouri.   Donor: Louise T. Rixey.

title: Exterior of the Truman Home
Scopenote: A street view of the exterior of the home of President Harry S. Truman and First Lady Bess W. Truman, located at 219 North Delaware Street, Independence, Missouri.   Donor: Louise T. Rixey.

title: Exterior of the Truman Home
Scopenote: A street view of the exterior of the home of President Harry S. Truman and First Lady Bess W. Truman, located at 219 North Delaware Street, Independence, Missouri. This photo shows the corner of the house at Delaware and Van Horn (now Truman) Roads.  Donor: Louise T. Rixey.

title: Exterior of the Truman Home, Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: A street view of the exterior of the home of President Harry S. Truman and First Lady Bess W. Truman, located at 219 North Delaware Street, Independence, Missouri. This photo shows the corner of the house at Delaware and Van Horn (now Truman) Roads. The man walking on the sidewalk is unidentified.  Donor: Louise T. Rixey.

title: Crowd of People Wait to See President Harry S.  Truman
Scopenote: A crowd of unidentified men wait behind a fence to see President Harry S. Truman during his visit to Nebraska.

title: Secretary of the Navy John L. Sullivan Attends Event
Scopenote: Secretary of the Navy John L. Sullivan (second from left) and his family attend an unknown event. Military officers are saluting, and Secretary Sullivan holds his hat over his heart. Front row, left to right: unidentified officer, Secretary Sullivan, unidentified officer, Patricia Sullivan, Charles Sullivan, Deborah Sullivan, and Priscilla (Mrs. John L.) Sullivan.

title: Oregon Trail Monument, Independence, MO
Scopenote: A monument marking the beginning of the Oregon Trail stands on the grounds of the Jackson County Courthouse in Independence, Missouri.   Donor: Louise T. Rixey.

title: Signs Welcoming President Truman
Scopenote: This is a picture of signs welcoming President Harry S. Truman to Omaha, Nebraska. These are probably in the Hotel Fontenelle, where President Truman and members of his party spent the night.

title: Oregon Trail Monument, Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: A monument marking the beginning of the Oregon Trail stands on the grounds of the Jackson County Courthouse in Independence, Missouri.   Donor: Louise T. Rixey.

title: Oregon Trail Monument at the Jackson County Courthouse
Scopenote: A monument marking the beginning of the Oregon Trail stands on the grounds of the Jackson County Courthouse in Independence, Missouri.   Donor: Louise T. Rixey.

title: Oregon Trail Monument, Independence, MO
Scopenote: A monument marking the beginning of the Oregon Trail stands on the grounds of the Jackson County Courthouse in Independence, Missouri.   Donor: Louise T. Rixey.

title: Senior Officers Salute the President on His Arrival
Scopenote: Senior officers salute President Harry S. Truman on his arrival in Key West, Florida. From left: Captain Cecil Adell, Captain O. A. Smith, Captain H. M. Cooper, Captain J. R. Ruhsenberger, Captain M. E. A. Gouin, Captain A. G. W. McFadden, Captain L. R. Daspit, Captain W. A. Saunders, all of the United States Navy.

title: The "Scared Cow" Arrives at Boca Chica, Key West, Florida
Scopenote: The Presidential airplane, the "Sacred Cow" arrives at Boca Chica Naval Airfield, Florida, at the start of President Harry S. Truman's vacation to Florida, Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, and Cuba. All people are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Arrives in Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman arrives at Boca Chica Naval Air Station in Key West, Florida, the location of the "Little White House" for a vacation.

title: President Harry S. Truman Addresses Crowd
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at the podium) addresses a crowd at the San Juan, Puerto Rico Naval Air Station. Standing behind Truman, left to right, are: Colonel Robert B. Landry, Secretary of the Interior Julius A. Krug, Governor of Puerto Rico Jesus A. Pinero, President of the Puerto Rico Senate Luis Munoz Marin, Vice Admiral Daniel E. Barbey, Major General Harry H. Vaughan, and Captain Robert L. Dennison. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Tours Sub Base
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman tours the submarine base in Key West, Florida. From left: Eben Ayers, President Harry S. Truman, and Captain Robert Dennison. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: The USS Williamsburg at Frederiksted, St. Croix, Virgin Islands
Scopenote: The USS Williamsburg at Frederiksted, St. Croix, Virgin Islands. President Harry S. Truman visited the Virgin Islands for a vacation.

title: The USS Greenwich Bay
Scopenote: The USS Greenwich Bay is at anchor in Frederiksted, St. Croix, Virgin Islands. This ship was part of the group of ships that traveled with President Harry S. Truman to the Virgin Islands.

title: Southard Street Gate, United States Naval Submarine Base, Key West, Florida
Scopenote: Sailors "man the rail" in anticipation of President Harry S. Truman's arrival at the Southard Street Gate, United States Naval Submarine Base in Key West, Florida. President Truman spent his vacation in Key West. All those in this photo are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Poses With Three Children
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses with three young children during his visit to the submarine base in Key West, Florida. From left, Curtis Hingson, son of LCDR and Mrs. J.M. Hingson, Sandra Jean Smith and Ray Smith, Jr., children of LCDR and Mrs. Ray Smith.

title: Man Casually Lounges In Chair on Boat
Scopenote: An unknown man casually lounges in a chair while on a boat.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks Aboard Boat
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks (center) stands on a boat with other men. All others are unidentified.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks with Unknown Men
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks (second from right) stands with four other unknown men outside of a building.

title: Admiral Lewis Parks with Civilians and Officers
Scopenote: Admiral Lewis Parks (left) is standing with seven unidentified civilians and officers aboard a docked United States ship.  Location is unknown. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: USS Midway Christening
Scopenote: Captain Lewis Parks (second from left) and others attend an event at the USS Midway. Also present is Secretary of the Navy John L. Sullivan (front row, eleventh from right). All others are unidentified.

title: Two Unknown Men on Small Boat
Scopenote: Two unknown men talk to each other while aboard a small boat.

title: President Harry S. Truman Walks To His Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman walks with a large group back to his train to leave Chicago, Illinois during his non-political train tour of northwest, west, and southwest United States. Illinois Senator Scott W. Lucas is behind, left of President Truman. Chicago Mayor Martin Kennelly is on the right. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Awards General Carl Spaatz with Medal
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, left) presents the Distinguished Service Medal (3rd Oak Leaf Cluster) to General Carl Spaatz (foreground, center), United States Air Force, for exceptionally notorious and distinguished service as Chief of Staff of the United States Air Force. Standing from left to right behind the President and General Spaatz are: General Robert Landry, unidentified military officer, Secretary of the Navy John L. Sullivan, Mrs. Spaatz and family, Secretary of Air Force Stuart Symington, Admiral William D. Leahy, General Hoyt S. Vandenberg, and General Omar N. Bradley. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Awards Medal to General Carl Spaatz
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, left) awards the Distinguished Service Medal (3rd Oak Leaf Cluster) to General Carl Spaatz, United States Air Force (foreground, center). Left to right: Mrs. Spaatz and family, Secretary of the Air Force Stuart Symington, Admiral William D. Leahy, General Hoyt S. Vandenberg, and General Omar N. Bradley. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Greets Marines
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, in civilian clothes) shakes hands with Marines who guarded the Little White House in Key West, Florida. All others are unidentified.

title: The Little White House
Scopenote: The exterior of the Little White House in Key West, Florida. President Harry S. Truman vacationed here during his presidency.

title: President Harry S. Truman Watches Rowing Race
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands aboard the Lenore, at Annapolis, Maryland, and watches a rowing race between Navy and Cornell University. From left: General Wallace Graham (in background), Colonel Robert Landry, President Harry S. Truman, Charles Ross, Admiral Denfeld, and Secretary of the Navy John Sullivan. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Watches Rowing Race
Scopenote: Aboard the Lenore, in Annapolis, Maryland, President Harry S. Truman watches the Navy vs. Cornell University rowing races. From left, President Harry S. Truman, Charles Ross, Admiral James Holloway, Commander Donald MacDonald, Secretary of the Navy John L. Sullivan, Lieutenant Moore, Colonel Robert Landry, and General Wallace Graham. All others are unidentified.

title: Signs Welcoming President Truman to Nebraska
Scopenote: This is a picture of signs welcoming President Harry S. Truman to Omaha, Nebraska. These are probably in the Hotel Fontenelle, where President Truman and members of his party spent the night.

title: President Harry S. Truman Greets Senator Scott Lucas and Mayor Martin Kennelly
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) shakes hands with Chicago, Illinois Mayor, Martin H. Kennelly (right) with Illinois Senator, Scott W. Lucas (left) standing behind him. President Truman is on the first stop of his "non-political" Presidential train trip to the Northwest, West, and Southwest United States. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Governor Val Peterson
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, in the white suit and armband, stands with Mary Jane Truman (left), Nebraska Governor Val Peterson (directly to the right of President Truman), and another unidentified man while attending the 35th Division Reunion Parade in Omaha, Nebraska. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Omaha, Nebraska
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) stands with Mary Jane Truman (left) and Ed McKim (right) during his visit to Omaha, Nebraska, to speak to the 35th Division reunion. Standing in the background behind President Truman is Administrative Assistant Charles Murphy. Others are unidentified.

title: Senator Butler and Senator Wherry Exit a Plane
Scopenote: The Nebraska Senatorial delegation, Senator Hugh Butler (at the foot of the stairs) and Senator Kenneth Wherry (behind) exit a military airplane. Others in the photo are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Rides in Car with Mary Jane Truman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman holds his hat while riding in the back of a car with his sister, Mary Jane Truman, during a visit to Omaha, Nebraska. Also in the back of the car is Eddie McKim (right), a World War I buddy of Mr. Truman's. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Walks to Podium
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) walks to the podium to speak to attendees of the 35th Division Reunion in Omaha, Nebraska. Standing at the podium with President Truman is his World War I buddy, Eddie McKim (left). Also present is General Robert Landry (background, right). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits Boys Town
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) visits Boys Town, Nebraska. With him is the Acting Director of Boys Town, Reverend Edmond C. Walsh (right). Standing in the background behind President Truman is General Harry Vaughan. Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Gets into a Car
Scopenote: Mary Jane Truman sits in a car while President Harry S. Truman enters. Ed McKim, in a dark suit, stands behind the President. President Truman is in Omaha, Nebraska to speak to the reunion of the 35th Division. Others in the photo are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Shakes Hands with Unidentified Man
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, third from left) shakes hands with an unidentified man at a railroad station in Omaha, Nebraska. Mary Jane Truman (second from left) and another unidentified man look on. Other people in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Walks with 35th Division in Omaha Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman walks at the head of the 35th Division during their reunion parade in Omaha, Nebraska.  He is in the white suit and armband, holding his hat. Walking beside him is his fellow member from Battery D during World War II, Frank Spina. The military officers walking behind President Truman are, from left to right: Rear Admiral Robert Dennison, General Robert Landry, and General Wallace Graham. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman at the World War II Memorial Park Dedication
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, left) is attending the dedication of the World War II Memorial Park in Omaha, Nebraska. All others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits Boys Town
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) visits Boys Town, Nebraska. With him is the Acting Director of Boys Town, Reverend Edmond C. Walsh (right). Standing in the background behind President Truman is General Harry Vaughan. Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman at Train Station in Omaha, Nebraska
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from the left) is standing near a train in a station in Omaha, Nebraska with his sister Mary Jane Truman (second from left), his World War I comrade Ed McKim (foreground, right), and an unidentified man. Standing in the background between President Truman and Mr. McKim is Charles Murphy. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Rides in a Car in Omaha, Nebraska
