Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated, left) rides in the back of an open car with Mayor of Omaha Glenn Cunningham (center), and Nebraska Governor Val Peterson (right). Others standing in the background are unidentified.

title: Unidentified Group Underneath a Plane
Scopenote: An unidentified group gathers as one man exits a plane. This photo was taken during President Harry S. Truman's visit to Omaha, Nebraska to speak to the reunion of the 35th Division.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Mary Jane Truman in Omaha
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands with Mary Jane Truman, Ed McKim, and an unidentified man and woman during Mr. Truman's visit to Omaha, Nebraska.  From left to right: unidentified woman and man, Mary Jane Truman, President Truman, Ed McKim. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Unidentified Man Speaks at World War II Memorial Park
Scopenote: An unidentified man speaks at World War II Memorial Park dedication ceremony in Omaha, Nebraska. President Harry S. Truman stands in front of the fountain with his back to the camera (right). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits Boys Town
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman  (third from left) shakes hands with Eddie Dunn, the student mayor of Boys Town, Nebraska, while Reverend Edmond Walsh (left), looks on. Standing in the background between President Truman and Mr. Dunn in Charles Ross, Mr. Truman's Press Secretary. Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends World War II Memorial Park Dedication
Scopenote: President Harry. S. Truman (foreground, in two-tone shoes) attends the dedication of the World War II Memorial Park in Omaha, Nebraska. The man standing next to President Truman is unidentified. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Walks with 35th Division Parade in Omaha, Nebraska
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, right) enjoys a laugh with former World War I comrade Frank Spina (foreground, left, holding flag) as they walk at the head of the 35th Division Reunion parade in Omaha, Nebraska. Others walking behind Truman are unidentified.

title: Senator Hugh Butler and Senator Kenneth Wherry
Scopenote: The Nebraska Senatorial delegation, Senator Hugh Butler (at the foot of the stairs) and Senator Kenneth Wherry (behind) exit a military airplane. Others in the photo are unidentified.

title: Lieutenant General Alfred Gruenther Kisses a Woman
Scopenote: Lieutenant General Alfred Gruenther kisses an unidentified woman as he disembarks a plane. His wife looks on.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends World War II Memorial Park Dedication
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is attending the dedication of the World War II Memorial Park in Omaha, Nebraska. Seated in the front row from left to right are: Mary Jane Truman, unidentified woman, two unidentified men, Mayor Glenn Cunningham of Omaha, Governor of Nebraska Val Peterson, President Truman, and an unidentified man. Seated behind the unidentified man on the right is Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman at the World War II Memorial Park in Omaha
Scopenote: President Harry. S. Truman (foreground, in two-tone shoes) attends the dedication of the World War II Memorial Park in Omaha, Nebraska. The man standing next to President Truman is unidentified. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits World War II Memorial Park in Omaha
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, left) attends the dedication ceremony for the World War II Memorial Park in Omaha, Nebraska. Standing behind him, mostly obscured, is Mayor of Omaha Glenn Cunningham. Standing behind and to the right of President Truman, saluting, are Rear Admiral Robert Dennison and General Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Walking in 35th Division Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman walks at the head of the 35th Division Reunion parade in Omaha, Nebraska.  President Truman is wearing a white suit and an armband. Walking next to President Truman and carrying the banner is fellow Battery D member Frank Spina. Walking behind President Truman are, from left to right: unidentified officer; Major General Harry Vaughan; unidentified civilian; Rear Admiral Robert Dennison; General Robert Landry; General Wallace Graham (partly obscured by Mr. Truman's hat). All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman Stands with Mary Jane Truman and Group
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, left) talks with a group of people during his visit to Omaha, Nebraska. Standing across from President Truman in the dark dress and hat is his sister, Mary Jane Truman. Standing behind President Truman is his Military Aide, General Harry Vaughan. All others are unidentified.

title: Lieutenant General Alfred Gruenther with Two Women
Scopenote: Lieutenant General Alfred Gruenther, center, stands with his wife (right) and an unidentified woman (left).

title: Mary Jane Truman with Unidentified Men
Scopenote: Mary Jane Truman (front row, left) attends the 35th Division Reunion with her brother, President Harry S. Truman (not pictured). Also present is Rear Admiral Robert Dennison, Naval Aide to the President (second row, left), and Press Secretary Charles Ross (second row, right). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits Boys Town
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) holds a certificate during his visit to Boys Town, Nebraska. He is with Eddie Dunn, the student mayor of Boys Town (second from right)  Reverend Edmond Walsh, the Acting Director of Boys Town (right), and Pat Norton (left). Standing in the background on the right is President Truman's Press Secretary, Charles Ross. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits Boys Town
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (fourth from right) stands with a group of unidentified choir boys and Reverend Edmond C. Walsh (in black) while visiting Boys Town in Omaha, Nebraska.

title: President Harry S. Truman at the World War II Memorial Park in Omaha
Scopenote: President Harry. S. Truman (foreground, in two-tone shoes) attends the dedication of the World War II Memorial Park in Omaha, Nebraska. Standing next to President Truman is Robert H. Storz. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Walks to the World War II Memorial Park in Omaha
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, left) walks to the dedication of the World War II Memorial Park in Omaha, Nebraska. Walking behind President Truman and the unidentified man next to him is Mayor of Omaha Glenn Cunningham (left) and Ed McKim (right). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits Boys Town
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) places a wreath during his visit to Boys Town, Nebraska. With him is the Acting Director of Boys Town, Reverend Edmond C. Walsh (right). Standing in the background behind President Truman is General Harry Vaughan. Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Sits in Car at Omaha, Nebraska Train Station
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (back seat, right) sits in a car in at an Omaha, Nebraska train station during his non-political tour of the United States. Seated in the back seat of the car with him are his sister, Mary Jane Truman (center), and his World War I comrade, Eddie McKim (left). All others are unidentified.

title: Boys Welcoming President Harry S. Truman to Boys Town
Scopenote: A large group of unidentified boys are holding signs as they welcome President Harry S. Truman to Boys Town, Nebraska.

title: President Truman Walks with 35th Division in Omaha Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, with his hat removed, walks at the head of the 35th Division parade during  the Division Reunion gathering in Omaha, Nebraska. Also present are Frank Spina (extreme left, with head turned back to the President), Ed McKim (walking slightly behind Truman with his arm outstretched), General Harry Vaughan (behind McKim), Admiral Robert Dennison (second row, right), and General Wallace Graham (third row, right). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Rides in Car
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, lifting his hat in the air on the left, rides in the back of an open car with his sister, Mary Jane Truman and his World War I comrade, Eddie McKim (right), during a visit to Omaha, Nebraska. President Truman is in Omaha to speak the Reunion of the 35th Division. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Boys Welcome President Harry S. Truman to Boys Town
Scopenote: A large group of unidentified boys are holding signs as they welcome President Harry S. Truman to Boys Town, Nebraska.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits Boys Town
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) looks at a document as he stands with Pat Norton (left) and Reverend Edmond Walsh (Right), during President Truman's visit to Boys Town, Nebraska. President Truman's Press Secretary, Charles Ross, is in the background, standing behind and to the right of Reverend Walsh. Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman at World War II Memorial Park
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, left) lays a wreath at the dedication ceremony for the World War II Memorial Park in Omaha, Nebraska. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman's Train Stops in Kearney, Nebraska
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman's train stopped in Kearney, Nebraska for one hour so that Truman and his party could attend church. All those pictured are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Meets Parents of Wilma Coates
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing in car) meets the parents of Wilma Coates in Carey, Idaho. Wilma was killed by a hedge hopping plane. Standing behind them is General Harry Vaughan. Others are unidentified. (see also 64-406)

title: President Harry S. Truman visits the Naval Ordinance Depot in Arco, Idaho
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman visits the Naval Ordnance Depot in Arco, Idaho during his tour of western United States. Standing beside the car, from left to right are: General Wallace Graham, Captain Robert Dennison, Captain C.H. Roper, President Truman, and Colonel Robert Landry.  All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Stands in Car in Idaho Falls, Idaho
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands in the back of a convertible holding a T-shirt reading "Treasure Mountain, Camp of the Tetons" presented to him by someone in the crowd. He is in Idaho Falls, Idaho during a part of his western tour of the United States. Standing beside the car, behind President Truman, is General Harry Vaughan. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Fishes in Idaho
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman fishes at Sun Valley, Idaho with the manager of the main lodge and Joseph Burgy, Director of Sports and Recreation at Sun Valley (in white ball cap). President Truman stayed overnight on his western tour of the United States. (See also, 2012-197)

title: President Harry S. Truman's Motorcade in Idaho Falls, Idaho
Scopenote: A crowd gathers along the motorcade route for President Harry S. Truman during his visit in Idaho Falls, Idaho. President Truman was visiting the western United States. All in this photo are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Addresses Crowd at Arco, Idaho
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands in front of the Recreation Hall in Arco, Idaho addressing a crowd during his Western tour of the United States. Military Aide General Harry Vaughan can be seen on lower steps of the building in his uniform. All others are unidentified. (see also 59-207)

title: President Harry S. Truman Boarding Governor Mon Wallgren's Yacht
Scopenote: At Bremerton, Washington, President Harry S. Truman (right, walking down path) boards the yacht of Washington Governor Monrad Wallgren. This is during President Truman's tour of the western United States. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman's Motorcade Arrives at Bremerton, Washington Naval Hospital
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman's motorcade arrives at the Naval Hospital located in Bremerton, Washington. Patients, nurses, and sailors greet the President (seated in the back seat of the lead car). This is during President Truman's visit of the western United States. All others are unidentified.

title: Large Crowds Gather in Seattle, Washington Waiting for President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Large crowds are gathered in Seattle, Washington awaiting President Harry S. Truman to make a speech. He is seated in the light gray suit. This is a part of President Truman's tour of the western United States. All others are unidentified.

title: View of Flood Damage in Vanport, Oregon
Scopenote: During President Harry S. Truman's tour of the western United States, he visited Vanport, Oregon to view damage along the Columbia River. This is an aerial view of the damaged area.

title: The Presidential Train in Winslow, Arizona
Scopenote: The presidential train at the station in Winslow, Arizona. The train carried President Harry S. Truman and members of his party around western United States. All those pictured are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Greets President Romulo Gallegos
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at podium, right) greets President Romulo Gallegos (at podium, left) of the United States of Venezuela upon his arrival at Washington National Airport. Standing behind the podium are Captain Robert Dennison (in white) and General Harry Vaughan (beside Dennison). Photographers (right) take pictures of President Gallegos as he addresses the reporters. Behind them is the presidential plane, the Independence. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Greets President Romulo Gallegos of Venezuela
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, right) greets President Romulo Gallegos (front row, left) of the United States of Venezuela upon his arrival at Washington National Airport. General Harry Vaughan and Captain Robert L. Dennison are right of President Truman. All others are unidentified.

title: Ivy W. Duggan Gives Check to Edward Bartelt
Scopenote: Ivy W. Duggan (left) gives a check to Edward F. Bartelt, Fiscal Assistant Secretary of the Treasury, as a dividend on the stock held by the Government in the Federal Farm Mortgage Corporation.

title: Joint Army-Navy Operation Game
Scopenote: Military officers are sitting at the CAMID III Joint Army-Navy Operation game at US Amphibious Base in Little Creek, Virginia. In the center, from left to right: unidentified woman; Admiral William Fechteler; Admiral James Holloway, Lieutenant General Maxwell Taylor, and unidentified. All others are unidentified.

title: Admiral Lewis Parks at Naval Demonstration
Scopenote: Admiral Lewis Parks (center) is seated with an unidentified officer (left) and a civilian (right) at a naval event. All others are unidentified. Photograph is from an album entitled "Submarine Pictures for Sub Base New London, CT."

title: President Harry S. Truman at U.S. Naval Academy
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman reviews the brigade of midshipmen as they pass into the Naval Academy chapel. Front row, left to right: Admiral William Leahy, President Truman, and Admiral James Holloway. Second row, left to right: Colonel Robert Landry and Captain Robert Dennison. Third row, left to right: Major General Harry Vaughan, General Wallace Graham, and two unidentified naval officers. Top row, left to right: Press Secretary Charles Ross, Clark Clifford, and unidentified naval officer. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits Naval Academy
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meets Midshipman John Paul Jones before chapel service at the United States Naval Academy. Left to right: General Harry Vaughan, Colonel Robert Landry, unidentified man, Admiral William Leahy, President Harry S. Truman, unidentified man, Admiral James Holloway, and Midshipman John Paul Jones. All others are unidentified.

title: White House Press Secretary Charles G. Ross with the Press
Scopenote: White House Press Secretary Charles G. Ross (right, in white collared shirt) meeting with unidentified members of the press at the Naval Mine Depot, Yorktown, Virginia. Mr. Ross and the press were traveling with President Harry S. Truman on his Chesapeake vacation cruise.

title: President Harry S. Truman Aboard USS Williamsburg
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman holds a press and radio broadcast aboard the USS Williamsburg. President Harry S. Truman is seated fifth from left in the first row. Second row from left, unknown cameraman, Captain Robert Dennison, White House Press Secretary Charles G. Ross, General Wallace H. Graham, Dr. John Steelman, Mr. William Hassett, Lieutenant Moore, and Commander Donald McDonald. All other men in photograph are unidentified.

title: Ceremony for the Presentation of the Order of Military Merit
Scopenote: Ceremonies for the presentation of the Order of Military Merit at military university, Escuela Politecnica, Guatemala City, Guatemala. From left: General Harry Vaughan, Colonel Louis Renfrow, Colonel Robert Landry, Colonel Cornelius Mara, and Colonel Brause.

title: Lieutenant Colonel Francisco Arana Presents Honor to Colonel Robert Landry and Others
Scopenote: Lieutenant Colonel Francisco Arana, Chief of the Armed Forced in Guatemala (right), presents the Order of Military Merit to (from left to right) Colonel Robert Landry, Colonel Cornelius Mara, and Colonel Brause at the military university, Escuela Politecnica in Guatemala City, Guatemala.

title: 75th Anniversary Ceremonies at Escuela Politecnica in Guatemala City, Guatemala
Scopenote: A 75th anniversary parade takes place at Escuela Politecnica, a military university in Guatemala City, Guatemala. All are unidentified.

title: Colonel Robert Landry, General Harry Vaughan Visit with Guatemalan President Juan Jose Arevalo
Scopenote: As part of the 75th Anniversary ceremonies held at military university Escuela Politecnica in Guatemala City, Guatemala, United States Colonel Robert Landry and General Harry Vaughan (forward facing) visit with Guatemalan President, His Excellency Senor Juan Jose Arevalo (left) and Colonel Bercian of the Guatemalan military. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Holds Press Conference
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, standing) holds a press conference while on vacation in Key West, Florida. Seated on the far left, next to the sailor taking notes, is White House Press Secretary Charles Ross.  Standing in the background are, from left to right: Stanley Woodward, Admiral Robert Dennison, Mon Wallgren, Admiral William Leahy, General Robert Landry, Stuart Symington, Clark Clifford, and David Niles. All others are unidentified.

title: The Presidential Party, Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and members of his staff and vacation party pose for a photograph on the lawn of the Little White House, Key West, Florida. Front row (left to right), William Hassett, Vice President-Elect Alben Barkley, President Harry S. Truman, Admiral William Leahy, and John Steelman. Second row (left to right), Donald Dawson, Eben Ayers, General Robert Landry, General Harry Vaughan, Leslie Biffle, Clark Clifford, Stanley Woodward, General Wallace Graham, Admiral Robert Dennison, William Bray and Jonathan Daniels.

title: President Harry S. Truman and President Carlos Prio Socarras of Cuba
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and President Carlos Prio Socarras of Cuba (right) shake hands on the speaker's platform after President Prio Socarras's arrival at Washington National Airport.

title: President Harry S. Truman and President Carlos Prio Socarras of Cuba
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) stands with President Carlos Prio Socarras of Cuba (center) on a speaker's platform at National Airport in Washington D.C. The other man is unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Greets Cuban President Carlos Prio Socarras
Scopenote: Accompanied by President Harry S. Truman (second from left), Dr. Carlos Prio Socarras, President of Cuba (third from left) inspects the Guard of Honor at National Airport in Washington, D.C., following his arrival from Havana. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Greets President Carlos Prio Socarras of Cuba
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, in grey coat) greets President Carlos Prio Socarras of Cuba and his official party at National Airport in Washington D.C. Others are unidentified.

title: President Carlos Prio Socarras of Cuba Arrives at Washington National Airport
Scopenote: Dr. Carlos Prio Socarras, President of Cuba and his party arrive at Washington National Airport in Washington D.C. on the presidential airplane, the Independence. All are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Greets Cuban President Carlos Prio Socarras
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing on the ground at the stairs) welcomes Cuban President Carlos Prio Socarras as he disembarks from the presidential plane Independence at Washington National Airport. He is in Washington, D.C. for a state visit. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and President Carlos Prio Socarras of Cuba
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and President Carlos Prio Socarras of Cuba (left) sit in the backseat of a car upon President Prio Socarras' arrival in Washington, D.C., at National Airport.

title: Cuban President Carlos Prio Socarras and Major General Hobart Gay
Scopenote: Cuban President Carlos Prio Socarras (left) and Major General Hobart Gay (right) stand at attention during the National Anthems of Cuba and America at Arlington National Cemetery in front of the Memorial to the battleship Maine. Soldiers in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Cuban President Carlos Prio Socarras at Reception
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, President Carlos Prio Socarras of Cuba, First Lady Bess W. Truman, and Mrs. Guillermo Belt, wife of the Cuban Ambassador, are standing in a receiving line a reception given in President Prio Socarras' honor at the Cuban Embassy in Washington, D.C.

title: General Genovevo Perez Damara Greets Dr. John Steelman
Scopenote: General Genovevo Perez Damara, Chief of Staff of the Cuban Army (foreground, left), greets Dr. John Steelman (foreground, right) at a reception at the Cuban Embassy in honor of President Carols Prio Socarras' visit to the United States. All others are unidentified.

title: National Press Club Luncheon for President Carlos Prio Socarras of Cuba
Scopenote: From left to right, President Carlos Prio Socarras, Mr. Joseph Short, President of the National Press Club, and Mr. Robert Butler, U.S. Ambassador to Cuba attend a luncheon given in honor of President Prio Socarras at the National Press Club.

title: President Harry S. Truman and President Carlos Prio Socarras of Cuba
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and President Carlos Prio Socarras of Cuba (right) at the reception at the Cuban Embassy in honor of President Prio Socarras' visit to the United States. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman, President Carlos Prio Socarras, and Cuban Ambassador Guillermo Belt at Reception
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shakes hands with Cuban Ambassador Guillermo Belt (right) at a reception at the Cuban Embassy. Also present is Cuban President Carlos Prio Socarras (center). In the background mostly obscured by the Ambassador, is First Lady Bess W. Truman.

title: Dave Brown, Mr. Christenberry, and General Robert Landry
Scopenote: Mr. Brown, Mr. Christenberry, and General Robert Landry seated at a table during an luncheon event.

title: Indoor Swimming Pool at Unknown Location
Scopenote: Indoor swimming pool in at the Quitandinha Hotel in Brazil.

title: Large Lobby with Globe Feature
Scopenote: Three unknown men stand in a lobby area in what is likely the Quitandinha Hotel in Brazil. There is a large globe feature with the wording "Exposicao" printed on it.

title: President Harry S. Truman Inaugural Gala
Scopenote: From left to right, First Lady Bess Truman, Miss Margaret Truman, Mrs. Marian Frances Truitt (daughter of Alben Barkley), Vice President Alben Barkley, and President Harry S. Truman attend the Inaugural Gala at the National Guard Armory, Washington, D.C.

title: State of Missouri's Float Passes Presidential Viewing Stands
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman's home state of Missouri's float passes by the Presidential viewing stands during the Inaugural Parade. All are unidentified.

title: State of Kentucky's Float Passes Presidential Viewing Stands
Scopenote: Vice President Alben Barkley's home state of Kentucky's float passes by the Presidential viewing stands at the Inaugural Parade. All are unidentified.

title: The Inauguration of President Harry S. Truman, 1949
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center foreground, right) takes the oath of office and is sworn in as President by Chief Justice of the Supreme Court, Fred Vinson (center foreground, left).  Also present are Margaret Truman (behind railing, fourth from the left) and First Lady Bess W. Truman (behind railing, fifth from left). All others are unidentified.

title: Military Tank Passes the Presidential Viewing Stand at Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: An Army tank passes President Harry S. Truman's viewing stand during the Inaugural Parade. President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley are visible in the center of the stands. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Family in Box at Inaugural Ball
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and members of his party attend the Inaugural Ball, and are seated in their box. Seated along the front row, from left to right: President Truman, First Lady Bess W. Truman, Margaret Truman, David Wallace, Marian Wallace, Mary Jane Truman, and Christine Wallace. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley Watch Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, left) and Vice President Alben Barkley (center, right) watch the Inaugural Parade from the viewing stands. Also present, seated in the first row, left to right, are: unidentified woman, First Lady Bess W. Truman, Marian Barkley Truitt, General Harry Vaughan, General Robert Landry, and Admiral Robert Dennison. Seated behind Mrs. Truman is Margaret Truman. Seated in the third row, second from the left is General Omar Bradley. Seated in the second row, in between General Vaughan and General Landry is Democratic National Committee Chairman J. Howard McGrath. Also present are two African-American gentlemen, who are unidentified. All others are unidentified.

title: Inaugural Parade for President Harry S. Truman, 1949
Scopenote: The Inaugural Parade for President Harry S. Truman held in Washington D.C., moves down Pennsylvania Avenue. The United States Capitol Building can be seen in the distance.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley at Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley watch the Inaugural Parade from the viewing stand. Seated next to Mr. Barkley are General Harry Vaughan and General Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Leads Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley wave to crowds during the Inaugural Parade from their car. All others are unidentified.

title: Military Marches Past Presidential Viewing Stand at Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Soldiers march past President Harry S. Truman's viewing stand at the Inaugural Parade. President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley are standing in the center of the box. All others are unidentified.

title: B-36 Planes Fly Over Carswell Air Force Base
Scopenote: B-36 planes pass over in review at Carswell Air Force Base in Fort Worth, Texas for the 7th Anniversary of the 8th Air Force. All persons standing on the ground are unidentified.

title: Members of the Air Force at 7th Anniversary of 8th Air Force
Scopenote: Members of the United States Air Force are standing on the back of a vehicle during a review at Carswell Air Force Base in Fort Worth, Texas. They are there to celebrate the 7th anniversary of the 8th Air Force. From left to right: General Roger M. Ramey, General Carl Spaatz, General Ira Eaker, General Curtis LeMay, General William Kepner, General Clements McMullen, General Robert Landry, Colonel Towle, and Colonel Roberts.

title: General Carl Spaatz Decorates Members of 8th Air Force
Scopenote: General Carl Spaatz (foreground, center, back to camera) decorates members of the 8th Air Force as part of the 7th Anniversary celebration at Carswell Air Force Base in Fort Worth, Texas. All others are unidentified.

title: 7th Anniversary Dinner of the 8th Air Force
Scopenote: 7th Anniversary dinner for the 8th Air Force at Carswell Air Force Base, Fort Worth, Texas. Seated at table, far left, General Robert Landry, General Curtis LeMay, General Carl Spaatz, Mr. Amon Carter, General Ira Eaker, General Roger Ramey, General McMullin, and General William Kepner.

title: Frank Pace Sworn in as Director of the Bureau of the Budget
Scopenote: Frank Pace (left) is sworn in as Director of the Bureau of the Budget. On the right is outgoing Director of the Bureau of the Budget, James E. Webb. The man in the center is unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Arrives at Lincoln Day Ceremonies
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman arrives at the Lincoln Memorial for the Lincoln Day Ceremony. Left: Admiral Reginald Belknap, Commander in Chief of the Military Order of the Loyal Legion, Admiral Robert Dennison, President Truman, General Robert Landry, and Colonel Crawford, officer in charge of the Lincoln Day Ceremonies.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends Air Progress Demonstration
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends Air Progress Demonstration at Andrews Air Force Base. From left: Colonel David Schilling, General Hoyt Vandenberg, President Harry S. Truman, Admiral Robert Dennison (in background), and General Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and General Dwight D. Eisenhower at Andrews Air Force Base
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and General Dwight D. Eisenhower at Andrews Air Force Base for an Air Progress Demonstration.

title: Airplanes at Andrews Air Force Base
Scopenote: Military aircraft as part of the ground display at the Air Progress Demonstration at Andrews Air Force Base.

title: Airplanes Fly Overhead at Andrews Air Force Base
Scopenote: Airplanes fly over a crowd gathered at Andrews Air Force Base for an Air Progress Demonstration. All are unidentified. President Harry S. Truman and members of his staff and Cabinet attended this demonstration.

title: President Harry S. Truman at Andrews Air Force Base
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, with binoculars) walks past a fleet of Greyhound buses. Walking beside him are General Robert Landry (second from left) and Colonel David Schilling (third from left). Walking in the row behind President Truman are Secretary of the Air Force Stuart Symington and Admiral Robert Dennison. All others are unidentified.

title: Air Progress Demonstration at Andrews Air Force Base
Scopenote: An airplane sits on the tarmac at the Air Progress Demonstration at Andrews Air Force Base. President Truman and members of his staff and Cabinet attended this event. All are unidentified.

title: Harry S. Truman Attends Air Progress Demonstration
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends Air Progress Demonstration at Andrews Air Force Base and looks up at planes through his binoculars. Standing in the background on the right is Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson. Seated in the background on the right is Secretary of the Army Kenneth Royall. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits Andrews Air Force Base
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman visits Andrews Air Force Base to attend the Air Progress Demonstration. From left: General Robert Landry, General Laurence Kuter, President Harry S. Truman, and Secretary of the Air Force Stuart Symington.

title: President Harry S. Truman Arrives at Andrews Air Force Base
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman arrives at Andrews Air Force Base for the Air Progress Demonstration. Pictured from left: General Laurence Kuter, President Truman, General Harry Vaughan, Secretary of the Air Force Symington, and General Hoyt Vandenberg. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits Andrews Air Force Base
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman visits Andrews Air Force Base to attend the Air Progress Demonstration. From left: General Lawrence Kuter, President Harry S. Truman, General Harry Vaughan, Secretary of the Air Force Stuart Symington, General Robert Landry, Colonel David Schilling, and General Hoyt Vandenberg. All others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Inspects the Flying Wing
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman descends a ladder from a hatch of a Northrop YB-49 after inspecting the six jet flying wing at a ground display of Air Force fighters and bombers at Andrews Air Force Base during the Air Progress Demonstration. Left is General Robert Landry, the President's Air Force aide. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman at Air Progress Demonstration
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, with binoculars) visits Andrews Air Force Base for an Air Progress Demonstration. Walking on President Truman's left are: General Hoyt Vandenberg (behind Landry), General Robert Landry, and Colonel David Schilling. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Watches Planes Fly Over
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman looks through his binoculars at airplanes flying overhead during the Air Progress Demonstration at Andrews Air Force Base. Standing up is General Hoyt Vandenberg. Seated behind President Truman, in the military hat is General Omar Bradley. All others are unidentified.

title: General Dwight D. Eisenhower attends Andrews Air Force Base Demonstration
Scopenote: Andrews Air Force Base hosts an Air Progress Demonstration. Far left: General Lyman Lemnitzer, General Dwight D. Eisenhower, Secretary of Defense James Forrestal, Secretary of the Air Force Stuart Symington, and Colonel Wertenbacker. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman at Andrews Air Force Base
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, with binoculars) attends the Air Progress Demonstration at Andrews Air Force Base. He is followed by unknown reporters. With President Truman is General Robert Landry (far right), and Admiral  Robert Dennison (behind Landry).

title: Military Band Performs at Air Progress Demonstration
Scopenote: A military band performs at Andrews Air Force Base at the Air Progress Demonstration. All are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends Air Progress Demonstration
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends the Air Progress Demonstration at Andrews Air Force Base. In the front row, from left to right: Colonel David Schilling, President Harry S. Truman, and General Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman on Ladder of Northrop YB-49
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman descends a ladder from a hatch of a Northrop YB-49 after inspecting the six jet flying wing at a ground display of Air Force fighters and bombers at Andrews Air Force Base during the Air Progress Demonstration. Left is General Robert Landry, the President's Air Force aide. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman on Plane Ladder
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman ascends a ladder from a hatch of a Northrop YB-49 after inspecting the six jet flying wing at a ground display of Air Force fighters and bombers at Andrews Air Force Base during the Air Progress Demonstration.  Standing behind President Truman is his Air Force Aide, General Robert Landry. Others are unidentified.

title: General Robert Landry Assists President Harry S. Truman From Plane
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman descends a ladder from a hatch of a Northrop YB-49 after inspecting the six jet flying wing at a ground display of Air Force fighters and bombers at Andrews Air Force Base during the Air Progress Demonstration. Left is General Robert Landry, the President's Air Force aide.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits Andrews Air Force Base
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman visits Andrews Air Force Base for the Air Progress Demonstration. Pictured from left: General Laurence Kuter, the President, Secretary of the Air Force Stuart Symington, and Colonel David  Schilling. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits Andrews Air Force Base
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman visits Andrews Air Force Base to attend the Air Progress Demonstration. From left, first row: Secretary of the Army Kenneth Royall, President Truman, General Hoyt Vandenberg (in the background), General Robert Landry, Admiral Robert Dennison (in the background), and Colonel David Schilling. All others are unknown.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits Andrews Air Force Base
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman visits Andrews Air Force Base to attend the Air Progress Demonstration. From left: Colonel David Schilling, President Truman, and General Robert Landry. Standing in the background between President Truman and General Landry is Secretary of the Air Force Stuart Symington. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Calls Out to a Crew Member Aboard a C-117 Aircraft
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, at the rear loading platform of a C-117 transport, calls out to a crew member at the front end of the cargo area. Colonel Dave Schilling (left) and General Robert Landry (right) are behind him. From the Air Progress Demonstration at Andrews Air Force Base. Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Greets Air Force Officer
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, in civilian clothes) greets Air Force members during his visit to Andrews Air Force Base for the Air Progress Demonstration. Walking behind him is General Robert Landry (foreground, left). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits Andrews Air Force Base
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman visits Andrews Air Force Base for an Air Progress Demonstration. Front row, left: Secretary of War Kenneth Royall, President Truman, General Robert Landry, and Colonel David Schilling. Walking behind Colonel Schilling is Admiral Robert Dennison. All others are unidentified.

title: Cabinet Officers at Andrews Air Force Base
Scopenote: From left to right, Secretary of the Army Kenneth Royall, Secretary of Navy John Sullivan, and Attorney General Tom Clark chat at the Air Progress Demonstration at Andrews Air Force Base. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits Andrews Air Force Base
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman visits Andrews Air Force Base for an Air Progress Demonstration. From left: General Laurence Kuter, General Robert Landry, President Truman, General Harry Vaughan, Secretary Stuart Symington, and General Hoyt Vandenberg .All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Greets Airman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with an unknown airman during his visit to Andrews Air Force Base to attend the Air Progress Demonstration. From left: Colonel David Schilling, Admiral Robert Dennison, President Truman, and General Robert Landry.

title: The Northrop YB-49 Flying Wing and B-36 Fly Over White House
Scopenote: The Northrop YB-49, also called the Flying Wing (top right corner) and the B-36 fly over the White House in Washington, D.C.

title: President Harry S. Truman Holds Press Conference at Little White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing, center) holds a press conference on the lawn of the Little White House in Key West, Florida. Standing behind President Truman are, from left to right: John Steelman, Admiral William Leahy, William Bray, General Robert Landry, General Wallace Graham, Eben Ayers, Press Secretary Charles Ross, and Admiral Robert Dennison. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman on Lawn of Little White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman chats with Elmer Davis on the lawn on the Little White House in Key West, Florida, after his vacation press conference. Standing behind President Truman are, from left to right, Press Secretary Charles Ross, and unidentified man, William Bray, an unidentified man (partly obscured), and Admiral Robert Dennison (wearing sunglasses). All others are unidentified.

title: General Robert Landry Holds Up Fish
Scopenote: General Robert Landry holds up a fish he caught while on vacation in Key West, Florida with President Harry S. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman Interviews the Press
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman interviews members of the press upon their arrival to Boca Chica, Florida. President Truman is third from right (with his hand on his hat). Standing behind President Truman is Admiral William Leahy (in uniform). All others are unknown.

title: President Harry S. Truman Talks to the Press
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman talks with the press at Washington National Airport just before he embarks for a vacation in Key West, Florida. Standing hear the car is Truman's Air Force Aide, General Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Talk to the Press
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, wearing hat) talks to the press at Washington National Airport before he embarks for Key West, Florida for a vacation. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Interviews the Press
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman interviews the press upon their arrival at Boca Chica, Florida. President Truman is center, fourth from left. Standing behind him, in uniform, is Admiral William Leahy. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives Honorary Degree
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) receives the honorary degree in "Doctorate of Humanities" from Rollins College, Winter Park, Florida. He attended the graduation ceremonies while on vacation in Key West. Dr. Hamilton Holt, President of the College, is handing President Truman his degree. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman at the Charles O. Andrews Causeway Dedication
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is about the cut the ribbon at the Charles O. Andrews Causeway dedication in Orlando, Florida. President Truman participated in this ceremony while on a vacation in Key West. Among those present are Mrs. Charles O. Andrews (second from right) and Charles O. Andrews, Jr. (front row, third from left). All others are unidentified.

title: Rollins College, Winter Park, Florida
Scopenote: Knowles Memorial Chapel at Rollins College in Winter Park, Florida. President Harry S. Truman visited Rollins College during his vacation in Key West, Florida.

title: President Harry S. Truman at Stone-Laying Ceremony at Rollins College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) participates in the stone-laying ceremony at the Rollins College Walk of Fame at Rollins College, Winter Park, Florida. Standing beside him is Rollins College President Dr. Hamilton Holt. All others are unidentified. President Truman attended the ceremony while on vacation in Key West.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Dr. Hamilton Holt at Rollins College
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) walks with Dr. Hamilton Holt (right), President of Rollins College during the graduation ceremony at Rollins College in Winter Park, Florida. President Truman visited in the university during his vacation in Key West. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Guests Arrive at Boca Chica Airport
Scopenote: From left to right, Assistant Press Secretary Eben Ayers, General Harry Vaughan, Chief Justice Fred Vinson, and Congressman George Smathers (in background, near steps) arrive in Boca Chica, Florida to join the rest of President Harry S. Truman's vacation party in Key West. Standing on the right is General Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Presidential Party at Little White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman seated with his presidential party at the Little White House in Key West, Florida. Front row from left: Dr. John Steelman, Chief Justice Fred Vinson, President Truman, Admiral William Leahy, Correspondence Secretary William Hassett. Back row, from left: William Bray, General Robert Landry, Admiral Robert Dennison, Chief of Protocol Stanley Woodward, Press Secretary Charles Ross, General Harry Vaughan, General Wallace Graham, Assistant Press Secretary Eben Ayers.

title: President Harry S. Truman Greets Guests at the Little White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman greets General George Marshall and William Pawley upon their arrival at the Little White House in Key West, Florida. From left to right: Admiral William Leahy, Chief Justice Fred Vinson, President Truman, General Marshall, and Mr. Pawley. The photographers are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Delivers Diplomas to Naval Graduating Class
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman delivers diplomas to the members of the graduating class of Fleet Sonar School, United States Naval Base, Key West, Florida. President Truman is standing at the center of the stage shaking hands with graduate. All other are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Poses with Photographers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) and six unidentified members of the "One More Club," the White House Photographers, pose on the lawn at the Little White House in Key West, Florida, during President Truman's vacation visit.

title: Dinner Party at Copacabana Palace in Rio de Janeiro
Scopenote: Guests attend a dinner party at the Copacabana Palace in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Seated on the right side of the main table, sixth from the end, is Brigadier General Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.
Institutional Creator: Carvalho Fotografo, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

title: General Robert Landry Attends Dinner in Rio de Janeiro
Scopenote: General Robert Landry (third from the left) attends a dinner in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil at the Copacabana Palace. All others were unidentified.
Institutional Creator: Carvalho Fotografo, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

title: General Robert Landry Receives Medal from Brazilian President
Scopenote: General Robert Landry (center) receives Ordem do Merito Aeronautico (Grande Oficial) Medal from Brazilian President Eurico Gaspar Dutra (left) in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Others in the photograph are unidentified.

title: Major Smith Receives Award from Brazilian President
Scopenote: Major Smith receives an award from Brazilian President Eurico Gaspar Dutra (second from left) in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Pictured in the right row, from back: General Robert Landry, Colonel Francis Williams, Major Smith, and Captain Christensen. Others are unidentified.

title: General Robert Landry Shakes Hands with Brazilian President
Scopenote: General Robert Landry (right) shakes hands with Brazilian President Eurico Gaspar Dutra (second from left) after receiving Odem do Merito Aeronautico (Grande Oficial) medal in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Other military officers are unidentified.

title: Brigadier General Reuben Hood and General Robert Landry in Brazil
Scopenote: From left to right, Brigadier General Reuben Hood, Brigadeiro Ararigbola, General Robert Landry, and the Brazilian Minister of Defense in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. The photo is autographed by both Brazilian officials.

title: Brigadier General Reuben Hood and General Robert Landry in Brazil
Scopenote: From left to right, Brigadeiro Ararigbola, General Robert Landry, the Brazilian Minister of Defense, and Brigadier General Reuben Hood in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. The photo is autographed by both Brazilian officials.

title: Colonel Francis Williams Receives Award from Brazilian President
Scopenote: Colonel Francis Williams receives an award from Brazilian President Eurico Gaspar Dutra (second from left) in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Right side from back: General Robert Landry, Colonel Francis Williams, and Major Smith. Others are unidentified.

title: Captain Christensen Receives Award from Brazilian President
Scopenote: Captain Christensen receives an award from Brazilian President Eurico Gaspar Dutra (second from left) in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Also pictured, end of row: General Robert Landry, Colonel Francis Williams, Major Smith, and Captain Christensen. Others are unidentified.

title: Secretary Julius Krug and General Robert Landry in New Orleans
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug (left) and General Robert Landry (right) exit their aircraft at the airport in New Orleans, Louisiana for the Tarpon Rodeo. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits the Naval Gun Factory
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman greets Admiral Frank Fahrion at the Naval Gun Factory in Washington, D.C. From left: Admiral Frank Fahrion, Secretary of Navy Francis Matthews, General Robert Landry, President Harry S. Truman, and General Harry Vaughan. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman in St. Paul, Minnesota
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman visits the Hotel Lowry in St. Paul, Minnesota for the Truman Day Dinner. From left: General Robert Landry, Secret Service Agent James Rowley, President Truman, General Harry Vaughan, Admiral Robert Dennison, and General Wallace Graham. Behind General Vaughan is Press Secretary Charles Ross. Behind Ross and General Graham is Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Beach in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: An aerial view of Truman Beach in Key West, Florida, where President Harry S. Truman vacations.

title: Margaret Truman Plays Volleyball in Key West
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (fourth from left) plays volleyball with other members of President Harry S. Truman's vacation party at Truman Beach in Key West, Florida. On the left is General Harry Vaughan. All other players are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Walking in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is walking from the Little White House toward Truman Beach in Key West, Florida. He is followed by Margaret Truman (directly behind him), General Harry Vaughan (directly behind Margaret), Admiral Robert Dennison (beside Truman), Chief of Protocol Stanley Woodward (behind Dennison), Colonel Cornelius Mara, and others who are unidentified.

title: The Truman Family in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: First Lady Bess W. Truman, President Harry S. Truman, and their daughter Margaret Truman pose for a photo on the lawn of the Little White House in Key West, Florida. They are in Key West on vacation.

title: Charles Ross and President Harry S. Truman in Press Headquarters in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: Press Secretary Charles Ross (standing, left) and President Harry S. Truman (seated, left) at the Press Headquarters at President Truman's vacation trip to Key West, Florida. All others are unidentified.

title: General Robert Landry in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: General Robert Landry casually lounges on a chair for a photograph on the lawn of the Little White House in Key West, Florida. He is in Key West where he joined President Harry S. Truman on vacation.

title: General Harry Vaughan in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: General Harry Vaughan casually poses for a photograph on the lawn of the Little White House in Key West, Florida. He is in Key West where he joined President Harry S. Truman on vacation.

title: George Elsey at Little White House in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: George Elsey, military adviser to President Harry S. Truman, stands on the lawn at the Little White House in Key West, Florida. He is in Key West where he joined President Harry S. Truman on vacation.

title: David Stowe at the Little White House in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: David Stowe, administrative assistant to President Harry S. Truman, is sitting in a chair on the lawn at the Little White House in Key West, Florida. He is in Key West where he joined President Harry S. Truman on vacation.

title: William Hassett at the Little White House, Key West, Florida
Scopenote: William Hassett, correspondence secretary, is seated on a bench in the lawn of the Little White House in Key West, Florida. He is in Key West where he joined President Harry S. Truman on vacation.

title: The Presidential Party in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is seated with his vacation party that went to the Little White House in Key West, Florida. Front row, left to right: Philleo Nash and Russell Andrews. Middle row, left to right: Matthew Connelly, John Steelman, President Harry S. Truman, William Hassett, Charles Ross. Back row, left to right: William Hopkins, David Stowe, General Wallace Graham, General Harry Vaughan, Clark Clifford, Admiral Robert Dennison, General Robert Landry, and George Elsey.

title: USS Manchester Seaman Sews on a United Nations Flag
Scopenote: Seaman G. D. Beck puts finishing touches on a hand made United Nations flag.  The USS Manchester joined the United Nations Task Force 77 in Incheon, Korea.

title: The USS Salem (CA 139) On Duty During Korean War
Scopenote: This is a photograph of the USS Salem (CA 139) on duty during the Korean War.

title: The USS Manchester Underway Somewhere Near Korea
Scopenote: Photograph of the USS Manchester underway somewhere near Korea.

title: Rosita Tzu
Scopenote: This is a photograph of Rosita Tzu of Formosa.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks Poses with Keelung, Taiwan Officials
Scopenote: Lewis Parks, Captain of the USS Manchester, poses for a photo with officials from Keelung, Taiwan. Left to right, Colonel Charles C. Chang, Colonel Para-troopers; Major General J.P. Chiang, Deputy Commander Keelung Fortress Command (for Major General P. Tan, Commander of Coast Defenses); Mr. R.S. Hsu, Keelung Harbor Bureau Director; Captain Lewis S. Parks, United States Navy; Mr. K.Y. Hsieh, Mayor of Keelung, Taiwan; Major General S. W. Ch'en, Port Commander.

title: Officers of USS Manchester
Scopenote: Four officers of the USS Manchester pose for photo. From left: unknown officer; Rear Admiral Allan Smith, Captain Lewis S. Parks, unknown officer.

title: Mr. K.Y. Hsieh, Mayor of Keelung, Taiwan Aboard USS Manchester
Scopenote: Mr. K.Y. Hsieh, Major of Keelung, Taiwan inspects sailors and Marines while on board the USS Manchester. All others are unidentified.

title: Nationalist Navy Officer Salutes for the Camera
Scopenote: A member of the Nationalist Navy, Commander Chao Kai-Chien, salutes while on board the USS Manchester in Taipei, Taiwan. Others are unidentified.

title: Burial at Sea of Lieutenant Raymond Miller
Scopenote: Unidentified sailors and marines attend a burial at sea of helicopter pilot Lieutenant Raymond Miller aboard the USS Manchester. Miller was buried at the Sea of Japan. A sailor can be seen playing "Taps" on a trumpet or bugle.

title: Actress Monica Lewis
Scopenote: Professional portrait of Hollywood actress Monica Lewis.

title: Scene at Washington National Airport
Scopenote: Stereo slide of a scene at Washington National Airport. In background is the airport building. People have gathered around the base of the airplane. The second side of the stereo slide is missing from the original. Original slide label: "1950 Scene at Wash Nat airport on leaving for Tehren [Tehran]."

title: Captain Lewis Smith Parks, USS Manchester
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks, United States Navy, Commanding Officer of the USS Manchester poses for a photo.

title: Twenty-One Gun Salute For Lieutenant Raymond Miller
Scopenote: Unidentified marines fire a twenty-one gun salute at the funeral service and burial at sea aboard the USS Manchester for Lieutenant Raymond Miller, a helicopter pilot.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks and Friends
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks (front row, left) poses with six unknown men all wearing dress shirts, ties, and hats.

title: The United Nations Flag Flies at Full Mast Over the USS Manchester
Scopenote: A United Nations flag that was hand made by the quartermasters on the USS Manchester flies at full mast off Sonjin, Korea. The Manchester joined the United Nations Task Force 77 at Inchon.

title: Dyeing a Handmade United Nations Flag
Scopenote: Seaman H. N. Dressler is shown dyeing a handmade United Nations flag.  The USS Manchester joined the United Nations Task Force 77 in Inchon, Korea.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends Military Review
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman inspects the rifle of an unidentified Marine during a visit to the U. S. Marine Base at Quantico, Virginia. From left to right: General Harry Vaughan (background); unidentified Marine; unidentified; Admiral Robert Dennison; General Robert Landry; President Truman. All others are unidentified.

title: Officers of Nationalist Navy Pose with Captain Lewis Parks and Commander Tommy Fleck
Scopenote: Officers of the Nationalist Chinese Navy visit the USS Manchester while at port in Taipei, Taiwan. From left, Rear Admiral Liu Kwang Kai, Captain Lewis Parks of the United States Navy, Commander Chao Kai-Chien, Commander Tommy Fleck of the US Navy, and an unknown officer.

title: Captain Lewis Parks
Scopenote: Captain Lewis Smith Parks aboard the USS Manchester.

title: Burial at Sea of Lieutenant Raymond Miller
Scopenote: Unidentified sailors attend the funeral service and burial at sea aboard the USS Manchester for Lieutenant Raymond Miller, helicopter pilot. He was buried at the Sea of Japan.

title: Two People Seated on Couch at London Hotel
Scopenote: Stereo slide of a man and woman seated on a couch. Original slide label: "London 1950 Claridge Hotel Rowena & Scotty Scott-Farnie."

title: Crowd Gathers at Washington National Airport
Scopenote: A stereo slide of a crowd of people gathering around an airplane. Slide is labeled "Washington National Airport leaving for Tehren [Tehran]." In the background a building is pictured, there are two cars, and a staircase for an airplane along with unidentified people.

title: Three Air Force Pilots
Scopenote: Three United States Air Force pilots stand underneath an airplane while wearing flight jumpsuits and helmets. Center, General Robert Landry of the United States Air Force shakes hands with an unknown pilot. Third pilot, far right is unknown.

title: USS Manchester's Helicopter Taking Off
Scopenote: The USS Manchester's helicopter, nicknamed "Clementine," takes off from the Manchester's deck.

title: Aboard USS Manchester
Scopenote: View from deck looking up at cannon and upper deck of USS Manchester.

title: Quartermasters R. L. Stirzinger and G. L. Beck Raise the United Nations Flag
Scopenote: Quartermasters R. L. Stirzinger and G. L. Beck raise the United Nations flag they made over the USS Manchester. The Manchester joined the United Nations Task Force 77 at Inchon, Korea.

title: USS Manchester Quartermasters Display the United Nations Flag They Made
Scopenote: USS Manchester Quartermasters R. L. Stirzinger and G. L. Beck display the United Nations flag that they made by hand.  The Manchester joined the United Nations Task Force 77 in Inchon, Korea.

title: Officers of the Nationalist Navy Visit USS Manchester
Scopenote: Officers of the Nationalist Navy visit the USS Manchester while located in Taipei, Taiwan. Captain Lewis S. Parks is second from left. All others are unidentified.

title: Rear Admiral Allan E. Smith
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Allan E. Smith, United States Navy, Commander of the United Nations Blockading and Escort Forces, holds a fabric banner with Taiwanese writing. It is presumed the banner was given to Smith during a Taiwanese delegation's visit to the USS Manchester while ported in Keelung Harbor, Taiwan.

title: Sunset Over Ocean from USS Manchester
Scopenote: The sun sets over the horizon with the guns of the USS Manchester in the foreground.

title: Bow of the USS Manchester
Scopenote: View of the bow of the USS Manchester as it approaches land.

title: Unknown Man Shakes Hands with Sailor
Scopenote: An unknown man wearing a suit shakes hands with a sailor who is eating a meal aboard a ship. All are unidentified.

title: Photograph of the USS Manchester
Scopenote: Photograph of the USS Manchester.

title: A Reconnaissance Photograph of Kangnung, Korea
Scopenote: A reconnaissance photograph taken by pilot Lieutenant Gill and Marine spotter 1st Lieutenant Ken Henry of Kangnung, Korea after a blizzard. The photograph is part of an album entitled "Pictures by R. Admiral Lewis Parks.  USS Manchester."

title: Photograph of Kangnung, Korea After Blizzard
Scopenote: A reconnaissance photograph taken by pilot Lieutenant Gill and Marine spotter 1st Lieutenant Ken Henry of Kangnung, Korea after a blizzard. The photograph is part of an album entitled "Pictures by R. Admiral Lewis Parks.  USS Manchester."

title: President Harry S. Truman and Bess Truman Attend Lincoln Memorial
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and First Lady Bess Truman attend a memorial service for President Abraham Lincoln at the Lincoln Memorial in Washington, D.C. Left: General Grant, Bess Truman, President Harry S. Truman, Admiral Reginald Belknap.

title: General Harry Vaughan, Leonce Legendre, and General Robert Landry
Scopenote: General Harry Vaughan, Leonce Legendre, and General Robert Landry at the dinner in honor of members of Congress who served in the Armed Forces, sponsored by the Veterans of Foreign Wars at the Statler Hotel in Washington, D.C.

title: General Robert Landry Poses with Group
Scopenote: General Robert Landry, second from left, poses with a group of people. From left, Jack Abramson, General Robert Landry, General Willard Wyman, Miss McCray, Bob Alton, Jimmy Stewart, Admiral Walter DeLany, and unidentified.

title: The USS Williamsburg
Scopenote: The USS Williamsburg, President Harry S. Truman's yacht, en route to Key West, Florida for President Truman's vacation.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Commander Donald MacDonald
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) with Commander Donald MacDonald aboard the USS Williamsburg. They were en route to Key West, Florida. Commander MacDonald is the commanding officer of the USS Williamsburg, President Truman's yacht.

title: The Crew of the USS Williamsburg with President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: The crew of the USS Williamsburg pose for a photo with President Harry S. Truman (center, in civilian clothes) on their way to Key West, Florida. Crew members are not identified.

title: Margaret Truman Addresses Group in Sioux City
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (sole figure facing the camera) addresses a small group in Sioux City, Iowa.

title: President Harry S. Truman with in Key West with Staff Members
Scopenote: From left to right, President Harry S. Truman laughs with William Hassett, General Robert Landry, and Margaret Truman in Key West, Florida. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Volleyball Game on Truman Beach, Key West
Scopenote: Margaret Truman, fifth from right, plays volleyball on Truman Beach in Key West, Florida with other people who joined the vacation party of her father, President Harry S. Truman. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Inspects the Marine Guard
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, in civilian clothes) inspects the Marine Guard in Key West, Florida with his aides and Captain Cecil Adell. Captain Adell is third from the left. Fourth from the left is Admiral Robert Dennison (mostly obscured). On the far left is General Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

title: The Constellation Arrives in Washington, D.C
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman's plane, the Constellation, arrives to a crowd to greet him upon his return to Washington, D.C. from a vacation in Key West, Florida.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Margaret Truman Board the Constellation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Margaret Truman board the airplane Constellation at Boca Chica, Florida, for return to Washington, D.C. They are returning to Washington after a vacation in Key West. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman at Washington Senators Opening Day
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends the opening day of the baseball season at a Washington Senators game. Front row, left to right: Admiral Robert Dennison, Margaret Truman, First Lady Bess Truman, President Harry S. Truman, and General Robert Landry. All others in photograph are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Throws First Pitch
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman throws out the first pitch at Griffith Stadium on the opening day of baseball season. Front row, from left to right: Admiral Robert Dennison, Margaret Truman, First Lady Bess W. Truman, Harry S. Truman, Robert Landry, Philadelphia Athletics owner Connie Mack, and Vice President Alben Barkley. Behind Vice President Barkley is Washington Senators Manager Bucky Harris. Between Mr. Mack and Mr. Barkley is Washington Senators owner Clark Griffith. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Throws Out the First Pitch
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman throws out the first pitch at a baseball game between the Washington Senators and Philadelphia Athletics. In the front row, from left to right: Margaret Truman, First Lady Bess W. Truman, President Truman, General Robert Landry, Connie Mack, Vice President Alben Barkley, and Washington Senators manager Bucky Harris. Seated near the center, partly obscured by President Truman is Press Secretary Charles Ross. Standing a few rows directly behind President Truman is Colonel Cornelius Mara (in uniform). All others are unidentified.

title: A Damaged North Korean Sampan is Brought Aboard the USS Manchester
Scopenote: Sailors assist in bringing a damaged North Korean sampan on board the USS Manchester. The North Koreans unsuccessfully attempted to mine the USS Manchester in Wonsan Harbor off the coast of Korea. All are unidentified. The photograph was in an album entitled "The story of the North Korean small boat flotilla who attempted to mine us in on [sic] a dark foggy night R. Adm. Lewis S. Parks. USS Manchester."

title: Prime Minister of Pakistan Liaquat Ali Khan Arrives in Iceland
Scopenote: The Prime Minister of Pakistan, Liaquat Ali Khan, arrives in Iceland en route to the United States. He is followed by his wife, Begum Liaquat Ali Khan. All others in photo are unidentified.

title: Prime Minister of Pakistan Liaquat Ali Khan Arrives in Iceland
Scopenote: The Prime Minister of Pakistan, Liaquat Ali Khan, arrives in Iceland with his wife, Begum Ali Khan. Pictured, from left: Unknown man, Liaquat Ali Khan, Begum Ali Khan (mostly obscured), General Robert Landry, and General Harry Vaughan. All others are unidentified. In the background is President Harry S. Truman's airplane, the Independence.

title: President Harry S. Truman On Trip Across Nebraska
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) walks underneath an umbrella during a visit to Lincoln, Nebraska.  All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Governor Val Peterson in Lincoln, Nebraska
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) shakes hands with an unidentified man (left) during a trip to Lincoln, Nebraska. Standing between President Truman and the unidentified man is Nebraska Governor Val Peterson.  The other men holding umbrellas are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman During Trip Across Nebraska
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) stands with three unidentified men during a trip to Lincoln, Nebraska.

title: President Harry S. Truman on a Trip Across Nebraska
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands under an umbrella (second from right) during a visit to Lincoln, Nebraska, during a tour of western and northwestern states. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Speaks from the Rear Platform of the Train in Nebraska
Scopenote: A crowd gathers at the rear platform of the train to listen to President Truman (at the podium) during his trip through Nebraska. All others standing on the ground are unidentified.

title: Unidentified Group with Stetson Hat Box
Scopenote: An unidentified group of men exchanges a Stetson hat box during President Harry S. Truman's visit to Lincoln, Nebraska.

title: President Harry S. Truman  During Trip Across Nebraska
Scopenote: From left to right, First Lady Bess W. Truman, President Harry S. Truman, and Margaret Truman stand on the rear platform of their train during a trip across Nebraska to visit western and northwestern states. All others on the platform are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Speaks During Trip Across Nebraska
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaks from the podium on the rear platform of his train during a trip across Nebraska to visit western and northwestern states. All others on the platform are unidentified.

title: Unidentified Group with Stetson Hat Box
Scopenote: An unidentified group of men poses with a Stetson hat box during President Harry S. Truman's visit to Lincoln, Nebraska.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Bess Truman on Trip Across Nebraska
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) stands with First Lady Bess Truman (center) and an unidentified man (right) on the rear platform of their train during a trip across Nebraska.

title: President Harry S. Truman Stands on Rear Platform During Trip Across Nebraska
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (background, left) stands on the rear platform of his train with an unidentified woman and First Lady Bess Truman (on right) during his trip across Nebraska.

title: President Harry S. Truman Addresses a Crowd in Lincoln
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, at the podium on the left of the picture, addresses a crowd in Lincoln, Nebraska. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman on Rear Platform During Trip Across Nebraska
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) stands on the rear platform of his train during a trip across Nebraska.  An unidentified man is speaking at the microphone, and another unidentified man is also on the platform.

title: President Harry S. Truman On a Trip Across Nebraska
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman walks underneath an umbrella in a dark rain coat during a trip across Nebraska. Others in the photo are unidentified.

title: Democratic Women's Club Welcomes President Harry S. Truman to Lincoln
Scopenote: A large group of unidentified women of the Democratic Women's Club welcomes President Harry S.  Truman to Lincoln, Nebraska. Some unidentified boys and girls are also present.

title: President Harry S. Truman on the Train in Nebraska
Scopenote: A crowd listens as President Harry S. Truman speaks from the rear platform of a train during the President's trip across Nebraska. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Lincoln
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) shakes hands with an unidentified man (left) during a trip to Lincoln, Nebraska. Standing between President Truman and the unidentified man is Nebraska Governor Val Peterson.  The other men in the picture are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends Military Review
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman inspects troops during a military review at the U. S. Marine Base in Quantico, Virginia. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends Military Review
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, in civilian clothes) shakes hands with unidentified military officers during a visit to the U. S. Marine Base at Quantico, Virginia. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman at the Dedication of Friendship International Airport, Baltimore, Maryland
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman addresses the crowd at the dedication ceremony for Friendship International Airport (now Baltimore-Washington International Airport). Second from left, General Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends Friendship Airport Dedication
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends Friendship International Airport Dedication in Baltimore, Maryland. From left to right: President Harry S. Truman; Baltimore, Maryland Mayor Thomas D'Alesandro; unidentified. Standing in the second row behind the man in the bow tie is General Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman at the Dedication of Friendship International Airport, Baltimore, Maryland
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends the dedication of Friendship International Airport, now Baltimore-Maryland International Airport. Standing in the front row, from left to right, are: Maryland Senator Millard Tydings, Maryland Governor William Preston Lane, President Harry S. Truman, Baltimore Mayor Thomas D'Alesandro, Jr., and Miss Maryland (Jean Crowe). All others in photograph are unidentified.

title: Captain Charles Warren Wilkins Bids Farewell to the Crew of the USS Manchester
Scopenote: Captain Charles Warren Wilkins (center, standing behind podium) bids farewell to the crew of the USS Manchester while Captain Lewis Parks (left), the new captain, and Commander Frank A. Dingfelder (left) look on. Others are unidentified.

title: Captain Lewis Parks Poses in Front of the USS Manchester's Plaque
Scopenote: Captain Lewis Parks (left) poses in front of the USS Manchester's plaque with an unidentified officer.

title: Captain Lewis Parks Cuts Cake at Celebration to Assume Command of the USS Manchester
Scopenote: Commander Frank A. Dingfelder (left), Captain Charles Warren Wilkins (second from right) and an unidentified officer (far right) watch as Captain Lewis Parks cuts and serves cake. The occasion was Parks' assuming command of the USS Manchester from Captain Wilkins.

title: Cake Welcoming Captain Lewis Parks to the USS Manchester
Scopenote: This is a photograph of the cake made to say farewell to Captain Charles Warren Wilkins and welcome Captain Lewis Parks to the USS Manchester.

title: Captain Lewis Parks Poses with Captain Charles Wilkins
Scopenote: Captain Lewis Parks (left) and Captain Charles Warren Wilkins (second from left) pose with two unidentified members of the USS Manchester crew. They are standing behind a table with a cake on it. The occasion was a celebration of Captain Parks' assuming command of the Manchester.

title: The "Meatball" Pennant is Raised Over the USS Manchester
Scopenote: Two seamen, R. L. Neave (left) and E. F. Hibsh raise the "meatball pennant" over the USS Manchester.  The pennant indicates that the Manchester was the winner of the Battle Efficiency award for 1949-1950.

title: USS Manchester at Pearl Harbor
Scopenote: This is a photograph of the USS Manchester while under repair at Pearl Harbor after a fire broke out in her fireroom. Photograph from album entitled "USS Manchester."

title: Hoisting a Flag on the Signal Bridge of the USS Manchester
Scopenote: Seaman R. L. Stirzinger hoists a flag on the signal bridge of the USS Manchester.

title: USS Manchester at Pearl Harbor
Scopenote: Photograph of the USS Manchester while under repair at Pearl Harbor after a fire broke out in her fireroom.  Photograph from album entitled "USS Manchester."

title: USS Manchester In Pearl Harbor
Scopenote: Photograph of the USS Manchester while under repair at Pearl Harbor after a fire broke out in her fireroom.  Photograph from album entitled "USS Manchester."

title: A Photograph of the "E" on the USS Manchester
Scopenote: Photograph taken by Captain Lewis Parks of the "E" painted on the USS Manchester in recognition of having won the Battle Efficiency Pennant.  Note on back of photograph reads: "I took this shot to show the 'E'."

title: The USS Manchester Under Repair at Pearl Harbor
Scopenote: Photograph of the USS Manchester while under repair at Pearl Harbor after a fire broke out in her fireroom. Photograph from album entitled "USS Manchester."

title: Captain Lewis Parks and Seaman Wayne R. Byerly Admire the USS Manchester's Battle Efficiency Pennant
Scopenote: Captain Lewis Parks (right) and seaman Wayne R. Byerly (left) admire the Battle Efficiency Pennant presented each year to the battleship or cruiser with the best record in the Pacific area.  The USS Manchester received the 1949-1950 award for service prior to Captain Lewis assuming command.

title: Seaman Carlos H. Smith Is Lowered to the Deck of the USS Manchester
Scopenote: Seaman Carlos H. Smith is shown being lowered from a helicopter to the deck of the USS Manchester where he was treated for a toothache. The photograph is part of an album entitled "Pictures by R. Admiral Lewis Parks.  USS Manchester."

title: USS Manchester Underway After Completing Repairs
Scopenote: This is a photograph of the USS Manchester underway after completing repairs caused by a fire in her fireroom. Photograph from album entitled "USS Manchester."

title: USS Manchester Underway After Completing Repairs
Scopenote: This is a photograph of the USS Manchester underway after completing repairs caused by a fire in her fireroom. Photograph from album entitled "USS Manchester."

title: USS Manchester Underway After Completing Repairs
Scopenote: This is a photograph of the USS Manchester underway after completing repairs caused by a fire in her fireroom. Photograph from album entitled "USS Manchester."

title: USS Manchester Underway After Completing Repairs
Scopenote: This is a photograph of the USS Manchester underway after completing repairs caused by a fire in her fireroom. Photograph from album entitled "USS Manchester."

title: USS Manchester Underway After Completing Repairs
Scopenote: This is a photograph of the USS Manchester underway after completing repairs caused by a fire in her fireroom. Photograph from album entitled "USS Manchester."

title: A View of Fankochi Point, Korea
Scopenote: A view of Fankochi Point, Korea showing a mine factory under fire by TF77 planes and the USS  Manchester on September 27, 1950.  T

title: View of Fankochi Point, Korea During Battle
Scopenote: A photograph of Fankochi Point, Korea under attack by the USS Manchester.

title: Seaman Carlos H. Smith is Lowered from a Helicopter to the Deck of the USS Manchester
Scopenote: Seaman Carlos H. Smith is lowered from a helicopter to the deck of the USS Manchester where he was treated for a toothache. The photograph is part of an album entitled "Pictures by R. Admiral Lewis Parks.  USS Manchester."

title: Seaman Carlos H. Smith is Lowered to the Deck of the USS Manchester
Scopenote: Seaman Carlos H. Smith is lowered from a helicopter to the deck of the USS Manchester where he was treated for a bad tooth. Original caption: In a short time, the "egg-beater" was lowering its patient-passenger to the decks of the cruiser Manchester where the mailman's stricken molar was treated by Dr. F. W.
