Cook in the ship's fully-equipped dental lab. By noon the next day, the air taxi returned to the Manchester and delivered a relieved mailman Smith back to his grateful shipmates on the Higbee.

title: United States Navy Seaman Carlos H. Smith Suffers from a Toothache
Scopenote: United States Navy seaman Carlos H. Smith suffering with a toothache waits to be transported from the USS Higbee to the USS Manchester for treatment. The commanding officer of the Higbee (unidentified) stands to the left of seaman Smith. These photographs were part of an album entitled "Pictures by R. Admiral Lewis Parks. USS Manchester."

title: United States Navy Helicopter Lifts Seaman Carlos Smith Aboard for Transport to the USS Manchester
Scopenote: Seaman Carlos H. Smith can be seen just as he is assisted into the helicopter by an unidentified person. The helicopter transported him to the USS Manchester to have his toothache treated. The photograph was part of an album entitled "Pictures by R. Admiral Lewis Parks. USS Manchester."

title: Seaman Carlos H. Smith is Released from Line That Lowered Him to the Deck of the USS Manchester
Scopenote: Seaman Carlos H. Smith (center) is assisted by two unidentified corpsmen as he reaches the deck of the USS Manchester. Smith was transported by helicopter to the Manchester for treatment of a toothache. Original caption: Safe on deck, Smith looks up at the Navy plane as the crewman begins to retrieve his harness apparatus. Waiting for escort Smith to the cruiser's completely equipped dental lab, Lieutenant Frank W. Cook, ship's dental officer, helps the patient unhook.

title: Seaman Carlos H. Smith Is Lowered from the Helicopter to the Deck of the USS Manchester
Scopenote: Seaman Carlos H. Smith can be seen as he exits the helicopter and is lowered to the deck of the USS Manchester where he was treated for a toothache. The photograph is part of an album entitled "Pictures by R. Admiral Lewis Parks.  USS Manchester."

title: Wake Island Building
Scopenote: One of the buildings on Wake Island, where President Harry S. Truman and his advisers met with General Douglas MacArthur regarding the conduct of the Korean War.

title: Mrs. Matthew B. Ridgway and Commander William C. Hughes Tour the USS Manchester
Scopenote: Mary Anthony Ridgway ("Penny"), wife of General Matthew B. Ridgway, is escorted on a tour of the USS Manchester by Commander William C. Hughes, its Executive Officer. In the background is Mrs. Aso, daughter of Japan's Premier Yoshida. The Manchester was on a stopover at Yokosuka, Japan enroute to Korea.

title: General Robert Landry En Route to Wake Island
Scopenote: From left, General Robert Eaton, General Robert Landry, and Lieutenant Colonel John Myers at Lockheed Airport in Burbank, California en route to Wake Island.

title: President Harry S. Truman at the Pearl Harbor Officers Club
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing, right) speaks to guests at a luncheon at the Pearl Harbor Officers Club in Hawaii. All others are unidentified.

title: Press Secretary Charles Ross Makes Announcement in Hawaii
Scopenote: Press Secretary Charles Ross (standing, left)  informs members of the press that the conference between Harry S. Truman and General Douglas MacArthur would be held at Wake Island. The press conference took place during President Harry S. Truman's layover in Hawaii. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman at Hickam Field, Honolulu, Hawaii
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman accepts honors at Hickam Field en route to meeting with General Douglas MacArthur at Wake Island. Front row, left: Admiral Arthur Radford, President Harry S. Truman, and Colonel Manning Tillery. Second row, left: Mayor of Honolulu John H. Wilson and  Governor of Hawaii Ingram M. Stainback. Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Admiral Arthur Radford in Backseat of Car
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Admiral Arthur Radford (right) arrive at the Pearl Harbor Officer's Club in Hawaii. President Truman is in Hawaii en route to Wake Island to meet with General Douglas MacArthur regarding the progress of the Korean War. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: The Civil Aeronautics Administration Air Terminal at Wake Island
Scopenote: View of the Civil Aeronautics Administration Air Terminal at Wake Island.

title: General Robert Landry and Admiral Richard Cruzen Greet General Douglas MacArthur
Scopenote: General Robert Landry (left) and Admiral Richard Cruzen (second from left) greet General Douglas MacArthur (center) on their arrival to Wake Island for President Harry S. Truman's meeting with MacArthur. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and General Omar Bradley at Nuuanu Pali Lookout
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and General Omar Bradley, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff (left), at Nuuanu Pali Lookout, Oahu, Hawaii during President Truman's layover before heading to Wake Island.

title: President Harry S. Truman and General Omar Bradley at Nu'uanu Pali Lookout, Oahu, Hawaii
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) looks through binoculars next to Admiral Arthur Radford (right) at Nu'uanu Pali Lookout, Oahu, Hawaii. Secret Service agent Jerry Behn is in the background, left.

title: General Robert Landry Visits The Greenbrier for Golf
Scopenote: General Robert Landry visits the Greenbrier resort in White Sulphur Springs, West Virginia. From left, Mr. Stuart, Mr. Lang, and General Landry sit on a bench during a game of golf.

title: President Harry S. Truman at the Army-Navy Football Game
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends the Army-Navy football game at Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Photograph of an Unidentified Naval Officer
Scopenote: This is a photograph of two unidentified naval officers, one of whose faces has been cut out from the photo.

title: Sunset Behind a United States Ship
Scopenote: Photograph of an unidentified United States ship on the horizon as the sun sets.  The photograph was taken from the USS Manchester whose guns are in the foreground.

title: Sunset Behind a United States Ship
Scopenote: This is a photograph of an unidentified United States ship on the horizon as the sun sets.  The photograph was taken from the USS Manchester whose guns are in the foreground.

title: Storing Powder on Board the USS Manchester
Scopenote: Six unidentified sailors are on the forward brow of the USS Manchester, passing five inch powder. The ship was located in Yokosuka, Japan.

title: Wounded Man Coming Aboard USS Manchester
Scopenote: A wounded man comes aboard the USS Manchester  from the USS Bass, with the help from crewmen, in Wonsan Harbor, Korea. All are unidentified.

title: USS Manchester Guns Over Wonson, Korea
Scopenote: The guns of the USS Manchester point towards Wonson, Korea as it fires upon a fuel dump

title: Thai Sailors Arrive Via Helicopter to USS Manchester
Scopenote: Thai sailors are coming aboard the USS Manchester by rescue helicopter, UP 27. All are unidentified.

title: USS Manchester Comes Alongside Ammunition Reloading Ship
Scopenote: The USS Manchester comes alongside ab ammunition ship in the Wonsan Harbor to rearm. Captain Lewis Parks can be seen on the third from top level by the door. Others are unidentified.

title: USS Manchester's Helicopter Goes Through a Final Check-up
Scopenote: USS Manchester's helicopter "Clementine" is on board the Manchester a few minutes before taking off for duty with the Inchon, Korean invasion forces. Clementine receives her final "make-ready". All people are unidentified.

title: Street View of Hong Kong During Korean War
Scopenote: A street view looking down a road lined with shops in Hong Kong during the Korean War.

title: Sterling Fisher with Captain Lewis S. Parks
Scopenote: Sterling Fisher, general manager of the Far East, Reader's Digest comes aboard the USS Manchester. He is shaking hands with Captain Lewis S. Parks. Others are unidentified.

title: Inscribed Photo to Captain Lewis Parks from Rear Admiral Allan E. Smith
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks, right, stands next to Rear Admiral US Navy Allan E. Smith, Commander of the United Nations Blockading and Escort Forces. The photo was taken off the Korean Coast. The photograph is inscribed: To Captain Lewis Parks USN/With an appreciation of your combat efficiency and effectiveness in Command Task Group 95 and in fighting the enemy night and day during February - March - April - May 1951 in Wonsan, Korea. / Allan E. Smith, Rear Admiral US Navy Commander United Nations Blockading and Escort Forces.

title: USS Bass Alongside USS Manchester To Transport Wounded
Scopenote: The destroyer, USS Bass, was hit by Wonsan shore batteries in Wonsan Harbor, Korea. There were ten causalities. Those that were seriously injured were transferred to USS Manchester for treatment. Image shows the USS Bass alongside USS Manchester as injured are hoisted to Manchester in gurney baskets. All are unidentified.

title: Remains of Fortifications on Sin Do Island, Korea
Scopenote: Remains of North Korean and Russian fortifications on Sin Do Island are covered in snow after United States and Republic of Korean forces swept the island. Sin Do Island is located in Wonsan Harbor, Korea.

title: Night Rocket Attack in Wonsan Harbor, Korea
Scopenote: Rockets from the USS Manchester fire upon a fort on the shore of Wonsan Harbor, Korea. Original caption: In a surprise night rocket attack with two LSMR's we attempt to destroy the enemy gun emplacements on the reverse slope of Kalma Gak - our most troublesome fort.

title: Lieutenant William DuCoing Inspects Machinery
Scopenote: Lieutenant William DuCoing from the USS Manchester inspects the remains of machinery left behind by North Korean and Russian military forces on Sin Do Island, Wonsan Harbor, Korea.

title: Captain Lewis Parks
Scopenote: Captain Lewis Parks stands outside with binoculars in his hands. Original caption: It's Cold in Korea!

title: USS Manchester in Wonsan Harbor, Korea
Scopenote: USS Manchester, with blackened cannons, sits in Wonsan Harbor, Korea. Original caption: Wonsan - temperature 8 degrees F.

title: Injured Men Brought Abroad USS Manchester By Helicopter
Scopenote: Injured men are brought aboard the USS Manchester from a helicopter in stretcher cases. All are unidentified.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks Addresses Crew of USS Manchester
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks stands behind a microphone on a podium looking out. He addressed his crew members of the USS Manchester informing the crew that they are "short-timers". All others are unidentified.

title: John, Georgiana, and Kate Parks with Beth Gregory
Scopenote: John, Georgiana, and Kate Parks with Beth Gregory wait for Captain Lewis Parks to descend from USS Manchester in Pearl Harbor, Hawaii. John Parks was the brother of Captain Lewis Parks.

title: USS Manchester at Pearl Harbor, Hawaii
Scopenote: The USS Manchester arrives at Pearl Harbor, Hawaii after a ten month tour to Korea during the Korean War.

title: Captain Lewis Parks Attends Dinner Party at Yokosuka, Japan
Scopenote: Men and women are seated around a table at a dinner party at Yokosuka, Japan. From left: Louise Ambrose, Homer Ambrose, unknown woman, Captain Lewis S. Parks of the USS Manchester, Bill Hughes, and Faith Salden. Parks was on leave from the USS Manchester.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks with Private Hanson
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks of the USS Manchester, right, stands next to Marine Orderly Private Hanson aboard the Manchester.

title: USS Manchester Crew Members Reenlist at Yokosuka, Japan
Scopenote: USS Manchester crew members reenlist beneath the large cannons on deck with Captain Lewis S. Parks presiding. All others are unidentified.

title: Tuna Boats in Misaki, Japan
Scopenote: Tuna boats unload their daily catch at the port markets in Misaki, Japan. All people are unidentified.

title: Captain Lewis Parks Prepares to Leave the USS Manchester
Scopenote: Captain Lewis Parks, right, stands by a car as he prepares to leave the USS Manchester at Yokosuka, Japan to visit Horace Bristol, a professional photographer's summer home.

title: Ship in Wonsan Harbor, Korea
Scopenote: A United States Navy ship is in Wonsan Harbor, Korea.

title: Captain Lewis Parks Receives Flowers From Republic of Korea Commanders
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks (fourth from left) of the USS Manchester, along with Dr. Frank Virgilio and a Marine orderly, accepts flowers from the Republic of Korea Army and Marine commanders ashore in Korea. All others are unidentified.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks at Atami, Japan
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks stands for a photograph at Atami, Japan during leave from the USS Manchester. The ocean is in the background.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks Presented a Knot Board
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks is presented a knot board from the USS Manchester boatswain gang while in harbor at Yokosuka, Japan. All others are unidentified.

title: Joe Fromm Relaxes at Horace Bristol's Home
Scopenote: Joseph Fromm sits by a fireplace on a ledge and drinks a beer at Horace Bristol's home in Yokosuka, Japan.

title: Captain Lewis Parks Attends Dinner Party in Yokosuka, Japan
Scopenote: Men and women attend a dinner party at Yokosuka, Japan. From left: Louise Ambrose, Homer Ambrose, unknown woman, Captain Lewis S. Parks of the USS Manchester, Bill Hughes, and Faith Salden. Parks was on leave from the USS Manchester.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks Dances With Zelda Parks
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks of the United States Navy, Commander of the USS Manchester, dances with his wife, Zelda Parks during a party aboard the USS Manchester upon its arrival in Long Beach California. An unknown singer stands on the stage.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks at Event
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks (standing, left) attends an event and talks to an unknown man. All others are unidentified.

title: USS Manchester and USS Ashtabula Refuel and Pass Mail
Scopenote: The USS Manchester refuels next to the USS Ashtabula, a fleet oiler as mail is also passed to the USS Manchester. The Manchester was a part of the Task Force 77 during the Korean War.

title: USS Manchester Fires Main Batteries in the Kansong Area
Scopenote: Original caption: The Cruiser USS Manchester's main batteries let go with a full salvo of high explosives aimed at enemy installations in the Kansong area. During a heavy three day bombardment the draft of the ship with decreased by six inches due to firing over 3,000 rounds of high capacity projectiles from its main and secondary batteries.

title: Unloading Ammunition from USS Mount McKinley to USS Manchester
Scopenote: Ammunition from the USS Mount McKinley is unloaded onto the USS Manchester in Wonson Harbor, Korea. All on board are unidentified.

title: At Main Plot Aboard USS Manchester
Scopenote: Crew members of the USS Manchester work with headsets in the Main Plot. From left to right: D. W. Doe, R. R. Jefferson, J. D. Berlin, P. W. Chapman, T. G. Manus, and Lieutenant W. W. Johns.

title: Corpsmen Carrying Wounded Siamese from Helicopter
Scopenote: Corpsmen carry a wounded Thai soldier on a stretcher from a helicopter aboard the USS Manchester. All are unidentified.

title: USS Manchester at Sea
Scopenote: This is a side view of the USS Manchester (CL-83), a Cleveland-class light cruiser of the United States Navy at sea during the Korean War.

title: USS Ashtabula Refuels USS Manchester
Scopenote: This is a photo of the USS Ashtabula (AO-51), a Cimarron-class fleet oiler of the United States Navy, as seen from USS Manchester during refueling.

title: Lieutenant Charles Jones Returns to the USS Manchester
Scopenote: Lieutenant Charles Jones returns to the USS Manchester after his helicopter was shot down during a rescue mission. Here, he is seen on a high-line from the destroyer Hamner.

title: USS Manchester and USS Paricutin
Scopenote: USS Manchester restocks its ammunition alongside the USS Paricutin, an ammunition supply ship in Wonsan Harbor, Korea.

title: USS Manchester Cannons Fire
Scopenote: USS Manchester cannons fire at night in Wonsan Harbor, Korea.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks stands aboard the USS Manchester.

title: USS Manchester in Wonsan Harbor, Korea
Scopenote: This is a photograph of the bow of the USS Manchester and Hwangt'o Do Island in the distance. USS Manchester Marines took the island on March 4, 1951.

title: The Mayor of Keelung Formosa, Taiwan and Captain Lewis S. Parks
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks of the USS Manchester raises his glass to the Mayor of Keelung Formosa, Taiwan during a toast at a reception. Others are unidentified.

title: USS Manchester's Helicopter Prepares for Take Off
Scopenote: The USS Manchester's helicopter, nicknamed "Clementine", prepares to take off from the Manchester's deck. Crew members, all unknown, stand around the helicopter preparing it for its next journey.

title: Crew Members of USS Manchester Prepare Helicopter For Take Off
Scopenote: Crew members of the USS Manchester prepare the helicopter, nicknamed "Clementine" for take off. All crew members pictured are unknown.

title: Crew Member Prepares USS Manchester's Helicopter For Take Off
Scopenote: An unidentified crew member ducks below the blades of the USS Manchester's helicopter, nicknamed "Clementine", as it prepares to take off from the deck of the Manchester.

title: View of Wonsan, Korea from USS Manchester
Scopenote: View of Wonsan, Korea from the USS Manchester during the Korean War.

title: USS Manchester's Guns Point Towards Communist Korea
Scopenote: The USS Manchester's guns point in the direction of Communist Korea.

title: Man and Woman Under Umbrella at Atami, Japan
Scopenote: An unknown man and woman stand under an umbrella at Atami, Japan.

title: Georgiana Parks in Hawaii
Scopenote: Georgiana Parks stands outside of her home in Honolulu, Hawaii. She is the niece of Captain Lewis S. Parks of the USS Manchester.

title: Republic of Korea Commanders Present Flowers to Captain Lewis Parks
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks of the USS Manchester accepts a large bouquet of flowers from Republic of Korea Army and Marine commanders ashore in Korea. All others are unidentified.

title: USS Manchester Arrives at Pearl Harbor
Scopenote: The USS Manchester arrives at naval base at Pearl Harbor, Hawaii. The crew is greeted with crowds of people and entertainers on the dock area. Cars can be seen on the right.

title: Home in Atami, Japan
Scopenote: Six unidentified women in traditional Japanese clothing gather in a porch of a home in Atami, Japan. A cherry blossom tree and the ocean are in the background.

title: Cartoon Drawling from USS Manchester
Scopenote: Cartoon drawling found in Captain Lewis S. Parks scrapbook. The cartoon depicts a ship bombing it's relief ship. Text reads "Pilot house to signal bridge - You realize that was our relief"

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks at Event
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks attends an event. Pictured centered, he speaks to an unknown man. Parks' wife, Zelda is to his left. Two other unknown women are seated with their backs to the camera.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks at Event
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks (standing, left) attends a function and talks to an unknown man. All others are unidentified.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks with Two Unknown Women
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks poses for a photo with two unknown young women.

title: Staff and Faculty of the National War College
Scopenote: Staff and facility of the National War College of 1951-1952 in Washington, D.C. Captain Lewis S. Parks is pictured second row, fourth from left. Others are unidentified.

title: Staff and Faculty of The National War College
Scopenote: The 1951-1952 staff and faculty of the National War College in Washington, D.C. Front row, left to right: Edward H. Buehrig; Joseph D. Coppock; Edward Page, Jr.; Rear Admiral Emmet P. Forrestel; Lieutenant General Harold R. Bull; Major General John M. Weikert; John W. Masland; Easton C. Rothwell; Arthur H. Steiner. Second row, left to right: Colonel John F. Bird; Colonel Charles M. McCarthy; Colonel Richard H. Lee; Captain Lewis Parks; Vinton Chapin; Colonel Benjamin S. Kelsey; Colonel Arthur J. Pierce; Colonel Harry O. Paxson; Captain Glenn R. Hartwig. Third row, left to right: Major Eston T. White; Colonel Roger V. Williams; Captain Patrick Henry; Captain Fred J. Archibald; Colonel Frank H. Wirsig; Lieutenant Ray Entwistle; Colonel John H. Hinrichs; Major Bernard J. Bushue; Colonel John K. Brown; Captain Harry F. Lowman, Jr.; Colonel George E. Lynch; William H. Gaskins; and Captain John A. Scott.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks at Table with Guests
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks (third from right) is at a dining table with five unknown guests.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks at Table with Guests
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks, third from right, is at a dining table with five unknown guests.

title: Two Unknown Naval Officers and Woman
Scopenote: Two unknown naval officers are around a table with an unknown woman holding a pen at an open book.

title: Sunset Behind an American Ship
Scopenote: Photograph of an unidentified United States ship on the horizon as the sun sets.  The photograph was taken from the USS Manchester whose guns are in the foreground.

title: Sunset Behind a United States Ship
Scopenote: This is a photograph of an unidentified United States ship on the horizon as the sun sets.  The photograph was taken from the USS Manchester whose guns are in the foreground.

title: Sunset Behind a United States Ship
Scopenote: This is a photograph of an unidentified United States ship on the horizon as the sun sets.  The photograph was taken from the USS Manchester whose guns are in the foreground.

title: Commander F. D. Virgilio Performs an Operation
Scopenote: Commander F. D. Virgilio MC, United States Navy, performs an operation under combat conditions during the Korean War. All others are unidentified.

title: Ammunition Stacks and Canon on USS Manchester
Scopenote: Stacks of ammunition shells are placed near the cannon of the USS Manchester that are pointed towards Wonson Harbor, Korea.

title: J.J. Hankins Repairs Ship Services Telephone
Scopenote: United States Navy sailor J.J. Hankins repairs a ship services telephone while aboard the USS Manchester.

title: R. Kobar Recovers from Injury
Scopenote: United States Navy sailor R. Kobar recovers in the sickbay of the USS Manchester from a 6" recoil injury. He is holding a cigarette in his hand.

title: Transferring Wounded Men from USS Bass to USS Manchester
Scopenote: The USS Bass docked alongside the USS Manchester in Wonsan Harbor, Korea to transfer injured men from the Bass to the Manchester. Crew members of each ship stand alongside to assist. John D. Bryan, United States Navy, is hoisted up to the Manchester in a stretcher basket. All others are unidentified.

title: Republic of Korea Marines and United States Marines Pose for Photograph
Scopenote: Republic of Korea marines and United States Marines from the USS Manchester pose for a photograph on Sinde Island in Wonsan, North Korea. All are unidentified.

title: Transferring Wounded from USS Buck to USS Manchester
Scopenote: Crew members help transfer wounded men from the USS Buck to the USS Manchester in Wonsan Harbor, Korea. Injured men were hoisted to the Manchester using a pulley system and stretcher basket. All are unidentified.

title: Shore Bombardment at Chongjin, Korea by USS Manchester
Scopenote: This is a photograph of the view from USS Manchester of a shore bombardment at Chongjin, Korea during the Korean War.

title: Transferring Wounded from USS Bass to USS Manchester
Scopenote: Crew members transfer injured men from the USS Bass to the USS Manchester in Wonsan Harbor, Korea. Injured were lifted with a pulley system and stretcher basket. All are unidentified.

title: Transferring Wounded from USS Buck to USS Manchester
Scopenote: Crew members help transfer wounded from the USS Buck to the USS Manchester in Wonsan Harbor, Korea. Injured men were hoisted to the Manchester using a pulley system and stretcher basket. All are unidentified.

title: Captain Lewis Parks
Scopenote: Captain Lewis Parks stands in the wheel house of the USS Manchester. He was Commander of Task Force 72 during the Korean War.

title: Sailor Watches Helicopter Approach USS Manchester
Scopenote: An unidentified sailor stands on a railing looking up into the sky as a helicopter flies over the USS Manchester.

title: Petty Officers on Deck of USS Manchester
Scopenote: Petty officers receive their certificates during a ceremony on the deck of the USS Manchester. A cease fire was held long enough for the ceremony to take place in Wonsan Harbor, Korea. All are unidentified.

title: USS Manchester Main Battery Fires Cannons
Scopenote: USS Manchester main battery fires its cannons, destroying Communist installations in Korea.

title: Main Battery of the USS Manchester Points Towards Wonsan, Korea
Scopenote: View of the bridge and main battery of the USS Manchester in Wonsan Harbor, Korea. The main battery is pointed in the direction of Wonsan. Note the blackened cannons.

title: New Petty Officers Receive Certificates
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks  (left, at microphone) presents new petty officers with certificates while they hold a cease fire in Wonsan Harbor, Korea. All others are unidentified.

title: Close Up of Main Battery Cannons of USS Manchester
Scopenote: A close up of the main battery cannons of the USS Manchester while in Wonsan Harbor, Korea shows the black smoke stains on the cannons.

title: Batteries of the USS Manchester
Scopenote: The main batteries and the bridge of the USS Manchester are ready for action while in Wonsan Harbor, Korea.

title: USS Manchester in Wonsan Harbor, Korea
Scopenote: USS Manchester is near Wonsan Harbor, Korea.

title: Night Rocket Attack in Wonsan Harbor, Korea
Scopenote: Rockets from the USS Manchester fire upon a fort on the shore of Wonsan Harbor, Korea. Original caption: In a surprise night rocket attack with two LSMR's we attempt to destroy the enemy gun emplacements on the reverse slope of Kalma Gak - our most troublesome fort.

title: USS Manchester Secondary Battery Fires on Enemy
Scopenote: Original caption: USS Manchester secondary battery takes the enemy under fire.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks Attends Reception in Taiwan
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks of the USS Manchester attends a reception hosted by the Mayor of Keelung Formosa, Taiwan. The Mayor is second from right, Captain Parks is fourth from right. All others pictured are unknown.

title: Crew Members Unload Injured From Helicopter Aboard USS Manchester
Scopenote: Crew members unload injured men in gurney baskets from a helicopter aboard the USS Manchester. All are unidentified.

title: USS Manchester Helicopter Visits Enoshima, Japan
Scopenote: The USS Manchester's helicopter, nicknamed the "Clementine" visits Enoshima, Japan. A crowd of unidentified onlookers gather around the helicopter.

title: Stretcher Cases Unloaded From Helicopter Aboard USS Manchester
Scopenote: Stretcher cases carrying injured men are unloaded on the deck of the USS Manchester. They were carried to the Manchester by its helicopter. All are unidentified.

title: USS Manchester Helicopter at Atami, Japan
Scopenote: The USS Manchester's helicopter is parked in a field at Atami, Japan. Several Japanese onlookers, many of them children, gather around the helicopter.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks Addresses Crew of USS Manchester
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks stands behind a microphone on a podium. He addressed his crew members of the USS Manchester informing the crew that they are "short-timers". All others are unidentified.

title: Naval Officer Cuts Cake
Scopenote: An unidentified naval officer cuts a cake.

title: USS Manchester Helicopter at Atami, Japan
Scopenote: The USS Manchester's helicopter, nicknamed the "Clementine," is parked in a clearing at Atami, Japan. Curious Japanese onlookers gather around the helicopter.

title: Captain Lewis Parks Attends Dinner Party in Yokosuka, Japan
Scopenote: Men and women are seated around a table at a dinner party at Yokosuka, Japan. From left: Captain Lewis S. Parks of the USS Manchester, Louise Ambrose and Homer Ambrose. Three others pictured are unknown.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks at the Bridge of the USS Manchester
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks stands at the bridge of the USS Manchester and holds binoculars in his hands.

title: USS Manchester Docks at Pearl Harbor
Scopenote: The crew of the USS Manchester, dressed in white uniforms, docks at Pearl Harbor after ten month tour of eastern Korea. A crowd is ready on the ground to greet them. All are unidentified.

title: USS Manchester's Helicopter Surrounded By People
Scopenote: The USS Manchester's helicopter is parked at Misaki, Japan. Curious onlookers surround the helicopter. All are unidentified.

title: Captain Lewis Parks Visits Republic of Korea Commanders
Scopenote: Captain Lewis Parks of the USS Manchester goes ashore with Dr. Frank Virgilio and a Marine orderly to meet with Republic of Korea Army and Marine Commanders. Captain Lewis Parks is third from left. All others are unidentified.

title: Pulling A Fishing Boat Out of the Yokosuka, Japan Harbor
Scopenote: Three people use a wooden wench to pull a fishing boat out of the harbor in Yokosuka, Japan. Two women look at the camera and smile.  The man has his back to the camera. Original caption: One way of hauling out a fishing boat - Misaki.

title: USS Manchester Helicopter Lands in Misaki, Japan
Scopenote: The USS Manchester's helicopter lands in Misaki, Japan. Several Japanese onlookers gather around the helicopter. All are unidentified.

title: The Crew of the USS Manchester Celebrate 28,000th Round
Scopenote: Captain Lewis Parks, left, poses next to a cake to celebrate the crew of Turret 2 firing the 28,000 round aboard the USS Manchester. All others pictured are unknown.

title: Candid Photo of Horace Bristol
Scopenote: Candid photograph of photographer Horace Bristol while he sleeps, presumably at his home in Japan while Captain Lewis S. Parks visited. Original caption: Horace at Ease.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks and Zelda Parks
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks of the United States Navy, Commander of the USS  Manchester, pins a corsage on his wife, Zelda Parks.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks at Table with Guests
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks (third from right) is at a dining table with five unknown guests.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks in Group Photograph
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks (front row, left), wearing his naval uniform, poses with a group of men and women in a photograph. All others are unidentified.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks at Event
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks, left, talks with an unknown man during an event.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks and Secretary Dan Kimball
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks (second from left) talks with Secretary of the Navy Dan Kimball (third from left) and two unidentified officers.

title: Deck of Ship at Sea
Scopenote: Unknown deck of ship headed out to sea. Another unknown ship is in the distance.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks at Gathering
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks, third from right (mostly obscured), stands in a group of men at a gathering. All others are unidentified.

title: USS Manchester Fires on Wonson Harbor, Korea
Scopenote: This is an aerial view of the USS Manchester as it is firing on Wonson Harbor, Korea. Two large smoke plumes rise from the area of the cannon locations.

title: USS Mount Katmai Unloading Ammunition onto USS Manchester
Scopenote: Sailors aboard the USS Mount Katmai are unloading ammunition onto USS Manchester in Wonson Harbor, Korea. All are unidentified.

title: Lieutenant Miller Drops from UP 23 Helicopter to USS Manchester
Scopenote: Lieutenant Miller is dropped down from UP 23 helicopter to the USS Manchester while in Task Force 77. Other people in the photo are unidentified.

title: Helicopter Prepares for Rescue Mission On USS Manchester
Scopenote: Sailors refuel a helicopter on the deck of the USS Manchester making ready to rescue downed pilots in Korea. All people are unidentified.

title: USS Manchester Fires Counter Battery in Kansong Area
Scopenote: USS Manchester main batteries let go with a full salvo of high explosives aimed at enemy installations in the Kansong area.

title: Officers and Men Viewing Radar
Scopenote: Officers and men are viewing a radar screen aboard the USS Manchester. From left to right: T. R. Wade; Sam Spahr, United States Marine Corps; M. E. Johnson; Lieutenant A. W. Slifer; and Lieutenant W. W. Johns. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: USS Manchester Refueling from USS Ashtabula
Scopenote: The USS Manchester refuels alongside the USS Ashtabula (AO-51) in Wonsan Harbor, Korea. Ashtabula was a Cimarron-class fleet oiler of the United States Navy.

title: Lieutenant Charles Jones Poses with Helicopter "Clementine"
Scopenote: Lieutenant Charles Johnes poses with USS Manchester's helicopter, "Clementine" at rest at Kimpo Air Base during the Korean War.

title: USS Zellars Alongside USS Manchester
Scopenote: The USS Zellars DD-727 (left) is pulled up alongside the USS Manchester during refueling in Wonsan Harbor, Korea.

title: Transferring Wounded from USS Bass to USS Manchester
Scopenote: Crew members assist in transferring wounded men from the USS Bass to the USS Manchester. Wounded were hoisted up to the Manchester with a pulley system and stretcher basket. All are unidentified.

title: Transferring Wounded from USS Bass to USS Manchester
Scopenote: The USS Bass docked next to the USS Manchester in Wonsan Harbor in Korea to transfer wounded men from the Bass to the Manchester. All are unidentified.

title: Mr. K.Y. Hsieh, Mayor of Keelung, Taiwan, Aboard USS Manchester
Scopenote: The mayor of Keelung, Taiwan, Mr. K.Y. Hsieh, inspects troops aboard the USS Manchester.

title: Crew Members of USS Manchester Sort Ammunition
Scopenote: Crew members of the USS Manchester sort a new supply of ammunition on the deck from the USS Paricutin. All are unidentified.

title: Wonsan, Korea Burns in Distance
Scopenote: This photograph taken from the deck of the USS Manchester shows blackened cannons after bombardment of the shoreline of Wonsan, Korea.

title: Captain Lewis Parks and Commander William Hughes
Scopenote: Captain Lewis Parks and Commander William C. Hughes stand in the bridge of the USS Manchester in Wonsan Harbor, Korea.

title: USS Manchester Blackened Cannons Facing Wonsan, Korea
Scopenote: USS Manchester's blacked cannons face a destroyed fuel dump in Wonsan, Korea after bombardment. Original caption: Our Bombardment destroys a fuel dump in Wonsan. This photo made 5 column front page spread on the March 15, 1951 Los Angeles Examiner and also used by papers all over the U.S.A.

title: Helicopter Leaves USS Manchester in Wonsan Harbor, Korea
Scopenote: The USS Manchester's helicopter, nicknamed Clementine, leaves to search for mines placed in the channel as the Manchester returns to Wonsan, Korea.

title: Reception By the Mayor at Keelung Formosa, Taiwan
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks of the USS Manchester attends a reception hosted by the mayor at Keelung Formosa, Taiwan. Captain Parks is fifth from right. All others pictured are unknown.

title: Reception By the Mayor of Keelung Formosa, Taiwan
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks of the USS Manchester attends a reception hosted by the Mayor of Keelung Formosa, Taiwan. Captain Parks is third from right. All others pictured are unknown.

title: Enoshima, Japan
Scopenote: A street view from Enoshima, Japan as Japanese women walk the streets in traditional kimonos towards a torii. This image was taken during United States naval officer leave from the USS Manchester during Korean War.

title: Captain Lewis Parks Presents Letter of Commendation
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks (right) presents a Letter of Commendation to an unknown sailor aboard the USS Manchester while at port in Sasebo, Japan. All others are unidentified.

title: USS Manchester Helicopter Prepares to Take Off
Scopenote: The USS Manchester's helicopter, nicknamed "Clementine", prepares to take off from the Manchester's deck. Crew members stand back as it prepares to lift off. All are unidentified.

title: Final Moments Before Helicopter Take Off From USS Manchester
Scopenote: The USS Manchester's helicopter, nicknamed "Clementine", prepares to take off from the Manchester's deck. Crew members stand back as it prepares to lift off. All are unidentified.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks at Atami, Japan
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks of the USS Manchester stands beside a sculpture while on leave at Atami, Japan.

title: Captain Lewis Parks Greets Judge John Parks
Scopenote: Captain Lewis Parks (right) shakes hands with this brother, Judge John Parks while in Pearl Harbor, Hawaii. Captain Parks and many other sailors are wearing leis. Crew members dressed in dress white uniforms gather behind Parks. Kate Parks is also pictured. Others are unidentified.

title: USS Manchester Helicopter At Atami, Japan
Scopenote: The USS Manchester's helicopter, nicknamed the "Clementine," is parked in a field at Atami, Japan. Local Japanese onlookers gather around the helicopter.

title: Captain Lewis Parks Attends Dinner Party at Yokosuka, Japan
Scopenote: People are seated around a table at a dinner party at Yokosuka, Japan. From left: Louise Ambrose, Homer Ambrose, unknown woman, Captain Lewis S. Parks of the USS Manchester, Bill Hughes, and Faith Salden. Parks was on leave from the USS Manchester.

title: Captain Lewis Parks Arrives in Pearl Harbor
Scopenote: Captain Lewis Parks, seen walking towards the USS Manchester while docked in Pearl Harbor. The ship had just arrived at port and was greeted by entertainers and crowds. Cars can be seen in the distance.

title: Joseph Fromm Relaxes at Horace Bristol's Home in Japan
Scopenote: Joseph Fromm, Far East Editor of U.S. News and World Report Magazine, sits near the fireplace at Horace Bristol's home in Yokosuka, Japan during Captain Lewis Park's visit while on leave from the USS Manchester. He is holding a drink in his hand.

title: USS Manchester Docks at Pearl Harbor
Scopenote: The USS Manchester docks at Pearl Harbor, Hawaii after a ten month tour of the eastern Korean waters. Pictured from the USS Manchester are people waiting for the ship to arrive. A small group of baton twirlers are standing with the crowd.

title: USS Manchester's Helicopter Returns
Scopenote: The USS Manchester's helicopter approaches the ship preparing to land.

title: Hula Dancers Entertain USS Manchester Crew
Scopenote: Three female hula dancers entertain the USS Manchester crew while in Pearl Harbor, Hawaii. All are unidentified.

title: Boy Scout Troop Tours USS Manchester
Scopenote: Upon the USS Manchester's arrival in Long Beach, California a Boy Scout troop tours the ship. All are unidentified.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks and Three Unknown Men
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks, left, wearing Naval dress uniform, sits with three unknown men around him.

title: Plaque from United States Submarine School in New London, Connecticut
Scopenote: A plaque from the United States Submarine School in New London, Connecticut shows Lewis S. Parks listed at the December 1929 Honor Student. A small arrow stamped on the photo points to his name.

title: Sunset Behind a United States Ship
Scopenote: This is a photograph of an unidentified United States ship on the horizon as the sun sets.  The photograph was taken from the USS Manchester whose guns are in the foreground.

title: Sunset Behind a United States Ship
Scopenote: Photograph of an unidentified United States ship on the horizon as the sun sets.  The photograph was taken from the USS Manchester whose guns are in the foreground.

title: Sailors Carrying Powder on Board the USS Manchester
Scopenote: Unidentified sailors are carrying five inch powder to magazine in mount 51 aboard the USS Manchester. The ship was in Yokosuka, Japan.

title: Foundation Construction of the White House During the Truman Renovation
Scopenote: Stereo slide shows the construction during the Truman Renovation at the south side of the White House. Scaffolding can be seen along the south side of the White House.

title: Helicopters Fly Tandem When Returning to USS Manchester
Scopenote: Two United States Navy helicopters fly in tandem when returning from a rescue mission off the coast of Yangyang, Korea to the USS Manchester.

title: Bullet Hole in Helicopter
Scopenote: An unknown man points to a bullet hold found in a helicopter used by the USS Manchester.

title: USS Manchester Fires Main Batteries in Kansong Area
Scopenote: Aerial view of USS Manchester. Her main batteries let go with a full salvo of high explosives aimed at enemy installations in the Kansong area.

title: Captain Lewis Smith Parks
Scopenote: Captain Lewis Smith Parks, commanding officer of the USS Manchester, stands with binoculars looking out over the sea. Captain Parks autographed this photo.

title: Ammunition Transfer from USS Deal to USS Manchester
Scopenote: The USS Deal, a Navy cargo ship, covered in ice, loads ammunition aboard the USS Manchester. All people in the photo are unidentified.

title: Wounded Men Transferred from USS Bass to USS Manchester
Scopenote: The USS Bass docked next to the USS Manchester in Wonsan Harbor in Korea to transfer wounded men from the Bass to the Manchester. Crew members used a pulley system to raise a man in a stretcher basket. All are unidentified.

title: USS Manchester's Helicopter Clementine at Kimpo Air Base
Scopenote: USS Manchester's helicopter rests at Kimpo Air Base just outside of Seoul, Korea during the Korean War. All people are unidentified.

title: Transferring Wounded From USS Bass to USS Manchester
Scopenote: Crew members help transfer wounded men from the USS Bass to the USS Manchester in Wonsan Harbor, Korea. Injured men were hoisted to the Manchester using a pulley system and stretcher basket. All are unidentified.

title: Captain Lewis Parks with Commander W. C. Hughes
Scopenote: Captain Lewis Parks (left) is standing next to Commander W. C. Hughes, executive officer of the USS Manchester during the Korean War.

title: Men Carrying Five Inch Powder Up the Forward Brow
Scopenote: Crew members of the USS Manchester carry five inch powder up the forward brow in Yokosuka, Japan.

title: Rigging Fuel Lines on USS Manchester
Scopenote: Unidentified sailors from Task Force 77 are rigging fuel lines aboard the USS Manchester on port quarterdeck.

title: Bridge of the USS Manchester
Scopenote: This is a photograph of the bridge of the USS Manchester, as seen from the deck.

title: Artillery Remains on Sin Do Island, Korea
Scopenote: Remains of artillery belonging to Russian and North Korean forces and fortifications on Sin Do Island in Wonsan Harbor, Korea are investigated by United Nations forces.

title: Crew Celebrates 21,0000th Round with Captain Lewis S. Parks
Scopenote: The crew of Turret 1 aboard the USS Manchester fire the 21,000th round and celebrate with a cake. Captain Lewis S. Parks, far left, joins the crew members. All others are unidentified.

title: Rear Admiral Allan Smith and Captain Lewis Parks
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Allan E. Smith (left), Commander Task Force 95, transfers from USS Forest Royal in Wonsan Harbor, Korea for a visit aboard the USS Manchester. He his talking with Captain Lewis Parks (right), commanding officer of the Manchester.

title: USS Manchester Battery
Scopenote: USS Manchester's cannons are blackened after the bombardment of Wonsan, Korea.

title: Train Car Hitch
Scopenote: This is a photograph of what appears to be a hitch to a train car, possibly a small mining cart, likely on Sin Do Island, Korea.

title: Captain Lewis Parks
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks, Commanding Officer of the USS Manchester and Commander Task Group 95.2

title: Wonsan, Korea Burns After Bombardment
Scopenote: Wonsan, Korea burns after bombardment by the cannons of the USS Manchester. This image was taken from USS Manchester's deck.

title: USS Manchester's Helicopter On Deck
Scopenote: The USS Manchester's helicopter, nicknamed "Clementine", prepares to take off from the deck of the Manchester. All people in the photo are unidentified.

title: USS Manchester's Helicopter Prepares to Take Off
Scopenote: The USS Manchester's helicopter, nicknamed "Clementine", prepares to take off from the Manchester's deck. All crew members on deck are unidentified.

title: USS Manchester Crew Unloads Injured From Helicopter
Scopenote: Crew members of the USS Manchester help unload gurney baskets with injured men from the helicopter. All are unidentified.

title: Presenting Letters of Commendation
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks (second from left), aboard the USS Manchester, presents letters of commendation to three sailors while ported at Sasebo, Japan. All others are unidentified.

title: Dinner Party at Yokosuka, Japan with Captain Lewis Parks
Scopenote: Men and women are seated at a table at a dinner party at Yokosuka, Japan. From left, Louise Ambrose, Homer Ambrose, unknown woman, Captain Lewis S. Parks of the USS Manchester, Bill Hughes, and Faith Salden. Parks was on leave from the USS Manchester.

title: Captain Lewis Parks Attends Dinner Party at Yokosuka, Japan
Scopenote: Men and women are seated around a table at a dinner party at Yokosuka, Japan. From left: Louise Ambrose, Homer Ambrose, unknown woman, Captain Lewis S. Parks of the USS Manchester, Bill Hughes, and Faith Salden. Parks was on leave from the USS Manchester.

title: View of Korea from USS Manchester
Scopenote: View of Korea from the USS Manchester with its guns pointed to shore. Image was taken from bridge area of the Manchester.

title: Man and Woman Under Umbrella at Atami, Japan
Scopenote: An unknown man and woman stand under an umbrella at Atami, Japan.

title: Japanese Women Aboard the USS Manchester
Scopenote: Seven unknown Japanese women in traditional kimonos stand underneath the blistered guns aboard the USS Manchester with members of the Manchester crew in Yokosuka, Japan. All sailors are unidentified.

title: Captain Lewis S. Park and Zelda Parks at Dinner
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks (second from right) and Zelda Parks (right) attend a buffet dinner aboard the USS Manchester upon its arrival in Long Beach, California. The couple behind Captain and Mrs. Parks is unknown.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks at Table with Guests
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks, third from right, is at a dining table with five unknown guests.

title: Muzzle Flashes from USS Manchester
Scopenote: Muzzle flashes of the guns of the USS Manchester can be seen as the ship fires on enemy installations along the coast of Korea.

title: Smoke Over Wonsan Harbor, Korea
Scopenote: Aerial view of Wonsan Harbor, Korea as smoke rolls across the water from cannon fire from battleships attacking the shore, including the USS Manchester.

title: Aerial View of Wonsan Area Under Fire
Scopenote: Original caption: Troop billeting area in the Wonsan area that was under fire by the big guns of the USS Manchester in Wonsan Harbor. Troops are still visible in this aerial photo taken from the USS Manchester's helicopter.

title: Aerial View of USS Manchester Hidden in Cloud of Smoke
Scopenote: Original caption: The USS Manchester is almost hidden from view as a full salvo is fired from its main battery. This rapid rate of fire soon blistered the pain on the gun barrels and left the docks littered with empty shell casings. The USS Manchester's big guns hit enemy installations around the Kosang area with devastating results, completely neutralizing the area.

title: Muzzle Flashes from USS Manchester
Scopenote: Muzzle flashes of the guns of the USS Manchester can be seen as the ship fires on enemy installations along the coast of Korea.

title: Thai Sailors Stand Guard on Beach in Korea
Scopenote: Two Thai sailors stand guard on a beach behind a trench as the United States helicopter UP 27 from the USS Manchester arrives to rescue stranded sailors. The Thai sailors were in need of rescue when their ship, the HMTS Prasae ran aground during a snow storm off the western coast of Korea.

title: United States Navy Helicopter UP 27 on Rescue Mission
Scopenote: United States Navy helicopter UP 27 takes off after retrieving Thai sailors stranded on a beach. The ship from Thailand, the HMTS Prasae ran aground during a snow storm off the west coast of Korea during United Nations exercises. The USS Manchester led the rescue mission of the stranded sailors.

title: USS Manchester Fires at Korean Shoreline
Scopenote: USS Manchester continues to fire at shore batteries in Wonsan Harbor, Korea while the USS St. Paul maneuvers to avoid being hit. This photograph was taken from USS Manchester's helicopter.

title: Aerial View of USS Manchester in Cloud of Smoke
Scopenote: Original caption: Clouds of smoke hang over the USS Manchester as its rapid firing main and secondary batteries blast enemy installations along the Eastern coast of Korea. The picture was taken at the peak of a three day bombardment in which over 3,000 rounds of high capacity projectiles were fired from the ships heavy batteries.

title: USS Manchester Fires on Kalma Gak Peninsula, Korea
Scopenote: The guns of the USS Manchester fire upon Communist forces on Kalma Gak Peninsula, Korea during the Korean War.

title: Muzzle Flashes from USS Manchester
Scopenote: Original caption: Resembling smoke rings but much more deadlier are these muzzle flashes as the USS Manchester lets go with a salvo from its main and secondary batteries. The picture was taken from the Manchester's helicopter as it returned from a fire control mission over the target area of Kosang in Korea. The action took place on the last of a three day bombardment of enemy installations along the east coast of Korea.

title: USS Manchester Fires Broadside at Night
Scopenote: USS Manchester fires at night from her main battery guns in Wonsan Harbor, Korea.

title: Soldiers Huddled on Beach Waiting for Rescue
Scopenote: Thai sailors gather around one wounded United States sailor who sits on the beach huddled in a blanket. The sailors await rescue from US Navy helicopters after the ship from Thailand, the HMTS Prasae ran aground off the western coast of Korea during United Nations exercises.

title: Aerial View of HMTS Prasae
Scopenote: An aerial view of the frigate from Thailand, the HMTS Prasae that ran aground off the western coast of North Korea during a snowstorm. Image was taken from the rescue helicopter sent from the USS Manchester. Original caption: HMTS Prasae as seen from Manchester copter. UN ships firing air bursts.

title: Thai Sailors Rescued by Navy Helicopter
Scopenote: Thai sailors are stranded on the western coast of Korea after their ship, the HMTS Prasae ran aground during a snow storm. At a snow covered beach, the United States Navy helicopter UP 27 arrives to rescue the sailors.

title: Thai Frigate HMTS Prasae Aground on Korea Coast
Scopenote: The frigate from Thailand, the HMTS Prasae, ran aground during a snow storm off the western coast of North Korea. In the background the USS Sanderling and other United Nations ships are present.

title: USS Manchester Fires Broadside at Night
Scopenote: The USS Manchester fires at Wonsan Harbor, Korea during the night from the broadside from her main battery guns.

title: Sailors Stand Guard During Rescue
Scopenote: Three unidentified Thai crewmen of the ship HMTS Prasae stand guard during rescue operations. The Prasae, part of a United Nations operation,  went aground on a Korean beach during a blizzard.  Rescue operations were conducted by the USS Manchester using a helicopter borrowed from the USS Philippine Sea after the Manchester's helicopter crashed.

title: United States Sailors Assist Grounded Sailors from HMTS Prasae
Scopenote: Two unidentified United States sailors unwrap blankets brought to stranded sailors from Thailand.  In the background, their ship, the HMTS Prasae can be seen where she grounded on the Korean coast during a blizzard. The Prasae was part of a United Nations operation when she ran aground. Gunfire from the USS Manchester protected the stranded sailors and rescuers from enemy troops.

title: Sailors Forced to Abandon Grounded Ship
Scopenote: A Thai sailor can be seen leaping to shore after his ship, the HMTS Prasae, was grounded during a blizzard.  The Prasae was part of a United Nations operation when she ran aground on the west coast of Korea.

title: Snow Covered Beach in Korea
Scopenote: Snow covers a beach in Korea during evacuation of Thailand troops from the grounded HMTS Prasae in enemy territory.

title: HMTS Prasae Grounded Off North Korean Coast
Scopenote: During a blizzard night the Thailand Corvette Prasae grounded on North Korea's eastern coast in enemy territory about 200 yards offshore.

title: HMTS Prasae Grounded Off North Korean Coast
Scopenote: During a blizzard night the Thailand Corvette Prasae grounded on North Korea's eastern coast in enemy territory about 200 yards offshore.

title: Lieutenant Taylor Guards USS Manchester Helicopter
Scopenote: Under enemy fire, unidentified troops and crew members from the USS Manchester use their ship's helicopter to rescue crew from the HMTS Prasae, which ran aground off the coast of Korea during a blizzard. Lieutenant Taylor is in the foreground, guarding the helicopter.

title: Soldiers Stand Guard During Rescue
Scopenote: A crewman from the grounded Thailand ship HMTS Prasae stands guard as the helicopter from the USS Manchester shuttles the stranded sailors to safety. The Prasae, part of a United Nations operation, ran aground during a blizzard. This took place in Korea.

title: Helicopter Rescues Stranded Sailors from HMTS Prasae
Scopenote: A helicopter from the USS Philippine Sea, piloted by Chief Aviation Pilot D. W. Thorin, lands on the snowy beach to effect rescue of the crew of the Thailand ship HMTS Prasae.  The Prasae, which was part of a United Nations operation,  grounded during a snow storm.  The rescue team was surrounded by enemy troops during the operation but was protected by gunfire from the USS Manchester.

title: Radioman "Kelly" Havard Assists Stranded Siamese Sailors
Scopenote: Radioman "Kelly" Havard (far right) helps distribute foul weather gear to stranded Thai sailors from the HMTS Prasae. The gear was delivered by a helicopter from the USS Philippine Sea, seen in the background, piloted by Chief Aviator D. W. Thorin. All others are unidentified.

title: A Side View of the HMTS Prasae Run Aground on Korean Coast
Scopenote: A side view of the HMTS Prasae (ship) after she ran aground on the Korean coast during a United Nations operation.  Original caption: Side of HMTS Prasae with Siamese sailor on fantail jamming 20 mm gun.

title: The West Coast of Korea From the Ship HMTS Prasae
Scopenote: A view of the west coast of Korea where the Thailand ship HMTS Prasae was grounded during a blizzard.  The Prasae was participating in a United Nations operation when she ran aground.

title: HMTS Prasae Grounded Off North Korean Coast
Scopenote: During a blizzard night the Thailand Corvette Prasae grounded on North Korea's eastern coast in enemy territory about 200 yards offshore.

title: Troops from USS Manchester Protect the Beach
Scopenote: Troops from the USS Manchester were brought ashore to help in the evacuation of stranded sailors from the HMTS Prasae that ran aground during a blizzard off the coast of Korea under enemy occupation. Above the two unidentified troops that are laying on the beach are two visible shell bursts.

title: A Helicopter Lands on the Deck of the USS Manchester During Rescue Mission
Scopenote: A helicopter returns to the USS Manchester with rescued crewmen from the Thailand ship HMTS Prasae, that went aground during a blizzard. All of this took place during a United Nations exercise in Korea.

title: United States Medic Inspects Wounded Crewman from Grounded HMTS Prasae
Scopenote: Two unidentified United States medics (center) inspect wounded Thai sailors in preparation for transport by helicopter to the USS Manchester. The Thai sailors were from the HMTS Prasae that ran aground on the Korean coast during a blizzard. The Prasae was participating in a United Nations operation. All are unidentified.

title: Sailors Wait for Rescue
Scopenote: Crewmen from the Thai ship HMTS Prasae stand guard while awaiting rescue after their ship ran aground on the Korean coast during a blizzard. The Prasae was taking part in a United Nations operation.

title: HMTS Prasae Grounded on Korean Coast During United Nations Operations Off Korea
Scopenote: This is a front view of the HMTS Prasae, a Thai ship that was grounded on the Korean coast during a blizzard. The Prasae was participating in a United Nations operation when she ran aground. In the background can be seen the USS Comstock and USS Saderling, also United Nations ships.

title: Thai Sailors Inspect the Grounded HMTS Prasae
Scopenote: A group of unidentified Thai sailors make a close inspection of the ship HMTS Prasae after it grounded on the Korean coast during a United Nations operation.

title: A Siamese Sailors Boards the Rescue Helicopter
Scopenote: An unidentified Thai sailor from the HMTS Prasae boards the rescue helicopter.  The helicopter, which had been borrowed from the USS Philippine Sea after the USS Manchester's helicopter crashed, was piloted by Chief Aviation Pilot D. W. Thorin who can be seen inside the helicopter facing the camera.  The HMTS Prasae ran aground off the coast of Korea while conducting a United Nations operation.

title: United States Navy Helicopter Picks Up Stranded Thai Sailors
Scopenote: Thai sailors move to board a United States Navy helicopter sent to rescue them after their ship, the HMTS Prasae, ran aground on the Korean coast.  The helicopter, which had been borrowed from the USS Philippine Sea after the USS Manchester's helicopter crashed,  was piloted by Chief Aviation Pilot D. W. Thorin who can be seen inside the helicopter.

title: Two Shell Bursts Visible on Beach
Scopenote: During personnel evacuations on a beach in Korea, enemy shell bursts are visible. The USS Manchester aided in the evacuation of stranded Thailand sailors from the HMTS Prasae that ran aground during a blizzard.

title: Thailand's Prasae Grounded of North Korea
Scopenote: Original caption: During a blizzard night the Thailand Corvette Prasae grounded on North Korea's eastern coast in enemy territory about 200 yards offshore. Sister ship Bangpakong lost man overboard attempting to pass a salvage line by boat.

title: HMTS Prasae Grounded Off North Korean Coast
Scopenote: During a blizzard night the Thailand Corvette Prasae grounded on North Korea's eastern coast in enemy territory about 200 yards offshore.

title: HMTS Prasae Grounded Off North Korean Coast
Scopenote: During a blizzard night the Thailand Corvette Prasae grounded on North Korea's eastern coast in enemy territory about 200 yards offshore.

title: HMTS Prasae Grounded Off North Korean Coast
Scopenote: During a blizzard night the Thailand Corvette Prasae grounded on North Korea's eastern coast in enemy territory about 200 yards offshore.

title: USS Manchester Helicopter On Rescue Mission
Scopenote: The USS Manchester's helicopter approaches the North Korean coast to rescue stranded crew members of the HMTS Prasae that ran aground off the North Korean coastline in enemy territory during a blizzard. All are unidentified.

title: HMTS Prasae Grounded Off North Korean Coast
Scopenote: During a blizzard night the Thailand Corvette Prasae grounded on North Korea's eastern coast in enemy territory about 200 yards offshore.

title: USS Manchester's Helicopter Aides in Rescue of Troops
Scopenote: The HMTS Prasae ran aground off the coast of Korea in enemy territory. Crew members from the Prasae sit huddled on the beach awaiting rescue from the USS Manchester helicopter. A large milk can of soup was brought to shore to feed the stranded men. All are unidentified.

title: HMTS Prasae Grounded Off North Korean Coast
Scopenote: During a blizzard night the Thailand Corvette Prasae grounded on North Korea's eastern coast in enemy territory about 200 yards offshore. Sailor in the foreground is unidentified.

title: USS Manchester Helicopter Lands on Korean Beach During Rescue Mission
Scopenote: Under enemy fire, unidentified troops and crew members from the USS Manchester use their ship's helicopter to rescue crew from the HMTS Prasae, which ran aground off the coast of Korea during a blizzard.

title: The Grounded HMTS Prasae in Korea
Scopenote: The Thailand ship Corvette HMTS Prasae, seen from the rear, shows its relationship to the beach where it was grounded. Sailors involved in the rescue mission are seen in the left of the photograph. The ship ran aground in Korea during an United Nations military exercise and the crewmen were rescued by the United States Navy.

title: Thailand Corvette Prasae Grounded of North Korean Coastline
Scopenote: Original caption: During a blizzard night the Thailand Corvette Prasae grounded on North Korea's eastern coast in enemy territory about 200 yards offshore. Sister ship Bangpakong lost man overboard attempting to pass a salvage line by boat.

title: USS Manchester Helicopter Approaches on Rescue Mission
Scopenote: The USS Manchester's helicopter approaches the North Korean coast to rescue stranded crew members of the HMTS Prasae that ran aground off the North Korean coastline in enemy territory during a blizzard.  The pilot of the helicopter was Chief Aviation Pilot D. W. Thorin.

title: USS Manchester's Helicopter Arrives to Rescue Stranded Soldiers on Korean Beach
Scopenote: The HMTS Prasae ran aground off the coast of Korea in enemy territory. Crew members from the Prasae sit huddled on the beach awaiting rescue from the USS Manchester helicopter. All are unidentified.

title: Attending to the Wounded on Shore
Scopenote: Dr. Meyers of the USS Manchester attends to the wounded on the shore after the Thailand Corvette HMTS Prasae ran aground off the North Korean coast during a blizzard. All others are unidentified.

title: USS Manchester Helicopter During Rescue Mission in Korea
Scopenote: Under enemy fire, unidentified troops and crew members from the USS Manchester use their ship's helicopter to rescue crew from the HMTS Prasae, which ran aground off the coast of Korea during a blizzard.

title: USS Manchester's Helicopter Lands on Beach During Rescue Mission
Scopenote: Under enemy fire, unidentified troops and crew members from the USS Manchester use their ship's helicopter to rescue crew from the HMTS Prasae, which ran aground off the coast of Korea during a blizzard. They landed the helicopter on a snow-covered beach.

title: HMTS Prasae Grounded On Beach at Kisamun Dan, Korea
Scopenote: HMTS Prasae, a Thailand Corvette, ran aground during a blizzard at Kisamun Dan, Korea. An evacuation effort to save 111 sailors was carried out by the crew of the USS Manchester. The Prasae was set further onto the beach and was destroyed by ship gunfire to prevent North Korean forces from taking control of it.

title: Sailor Stands Guard During Rescue Attempt in Korea
Scopenote: A crewman from the grounded Thailand ship HMTS Prasae stands guard as the helicopter from the USS Manchester shuttles the stranded sailors to safety. The Prasae, part of a United Nations operation, ran aground on the Korean coast during a blizzard.

title: Ship HMTS Prasae Grounded on Korean Coast
Scopenote: The Thailand Corvette HMTS Prasae as seen from the rear shows its relationship to the beach where it was grounded.  Sailors involved in the rescue mission are seen in the left of the photograph. The Prasae ran aground while participating in a United Nations operation.

title: HMTS Prasae Grounded Off North Korean Coast
Scopenote: During a blizzard night the Thailand Corvette Prasae grounded on North Korea's eastern coast in enemy territory about 200 yards offshore.

title: HMTS Prasae Grounded Off North Korean Coast
Scopenote: During a blizzard night the Thailand Corvette Prasae grounded on North Korea's eastern coast in enemy territory about 200 yards offshore.

title: USS Manchester's Helicopter Evacuates Stranded Troops
Scopenote: The USS Manchester helicopter brings supplies and helps evacuate troops from the Thai ship HMTS Prasae that ran aground in enemy territory off the coast of Korea during a blizzard. Original caption: Several hundred enemy troops visible at times but gunfire from ships kept them 2000 to 3000 yards away during evacuation of personnel.

title: USS Manchester Guards Grounded HMTS Prasae
Scopenote: The USS Manchester guards the grounded HMTS Prasae  with destroyers and other ships while rescue efforts take place in enemy territory on shore.

title: Evacuees from HMTS Prasae Aboard USS Manchester
Scopenote: Seventeen of the 111 evacuees from the Thailand corvette, HMTS Prasae, wear US Navy issued dungarees while aboard the USS Manchester. Their ship had run aground on the Korean coastline in enemy territory during a blizzard. All pictured are unidentified.

title: USS Manchester Helicopter Prepares to Rescue Thai Sailor from Korean Beach
Scopenote: The USS Manchester's helicopter prepares to rescue a Thai sailor from a beach at Kisamun Dan, Korea. A rescue mission was launched after the HMTS Prasae, a Thailand Corvette, ran aground on Korea's Eastern Coast during a blizzard. All troops are unidentified.

title: Two Crew Members Await Rescue on Korean Beach
Scopenote: Under enemy fire, unidentified troops and crew members from the run aground HMTS Prasae take shelter on the beach while they await rescue from the USS Manchester helicopter. A rescue mission was launched after the HTMS Prasae, a Thailand Corvette ran aground on Korea's Eastern Coast during a blizzard.

title: Three Thailand Crew Members of the Prasae Wait For Rescue
Scopenote: Under enemy fire, unidentified crew members from the run aground HMTS Prasae take shelter on the beach while they await rescue from the USS Manchester helicopter. A rescue mission was launched after the HTMS Prasae, a Thailand Corvette ran aground on Korea's Eastern Coast during a blizzard.

title: Lieutenant Taylor of USS Manchester Guards Helicopter
Scopenote: Lieutenant Taylor of the USS Manchester guards the helicopter from Communist forces on a Korean beach. Under enemy fire, troops and crew members from the run aground HMTS Prasae take shelter on the beach while they await rescue from the USS Manchester helicopter. The Manchester's helicopter, nicknamed the Clementine, lands on the snow covered beach at Kisamun Dan, Korea. A rescue mission was launched after the HTMS Prasae, a Thailand Corvette ran aground on Korea's Eastern Coast during a blizzard.

title: Sailors Await Rescue by USS Manchester Helicopter
Scopenote: Under enemy fire, unidentified troops and crew members from the run aground HMTS Prasae take shelter on the beach while they await rescue from the USS Manchester helicopter. A rescue mission was launched after the HTMS Prasae, a Thailand Corvette, ran aground on Korea's Eastern Coast during a blizzard.

title: USS Manchester's Helicopter on Snow Covered Beach in Korea
Scopenote: Under enemy fire, troops and crew members from the run aground HMTS Prasae take shelter on the beach while they await rescue from the USS Manchester helicopter. The Manchester's helicopter, nicknamed the Clementine, lands on the snow covered beach at Kisamun Dan, Korea. Photo was taken aboard the Prasae. A rescue mission was launched after the HTMS Prasae, a Thailand Corvette ran aground on Korea's Eastern Coast during a blizzard.

title: Siamese Crew Members of the Stranded HMTS Prasae Fire on Enemy Combatants
Scopenote: Under enemy fire, unidentified troops and crew members from the run aground HMTS Prasae take shelter on the beach while they await rescue from the USS Manchester helicopter. A rescue mission was launched after the HTMS Prasae, a Thailand Corvette, ran aground on Korea's Eastern Coast during a blizzard. United States Navy Lieutenant DuCoing took photographs and witnessed several enemy soldiers killed while on this beach.

title: Troops Dug Into Trench at Kisamun Dan, Korea
Scopenote: Under enemy fire, troops and crew members from the run aground HMTS Prasae take shelter on the beach while they await rescue from the USS Manchester helicopter. A rescue mission was launched after the HTMS Prasae, a Thailand Corvette ran aground on Korea's Eastern Coast during a blizzard. All are unidentified.

title: Last Crew Members of HMTS Prasae Are Evacuated by USS Manchester Helicopter
Scopenote: The USS Manchester's helicopter, nicknamed the Clementine, lands on the snow covered beach at Kisamun Dan, Korea. A rescue mission was launched after the HTMS Prasae, a Thailand Corvette, ran aground on Korea's Eastern Coast during a blizzard. Original caption: With the temperature at 12 degrees below zero, the last of Commander Vudhichae's crew are evacuated.

title: USS Manchester Helicopter Lands On Beach During Rescue Mission
Scopenote: The USS Manchester's helicopter, nicknamed the Clementine, lands on the snow covered beach at Kisamun Dan, Korea. A rescue mission was launched after the HTMS Prasae, a Thailand Corvette, ran aground on Korea's Eastern Coast during a blizzard. Troops in the photo are unidentified.

title: USS Manchester's Helicopter Lands on Snow Covered Beach in Korea
Scopenote: The USS Manchester's helicopter, nicknamed the Clementine, lands on the snow covered beach at Kisamun Dan, Korea. Photo was taken aboard the Prasae. A rescue mission was launched after the HTMS Prasae, a Thailand Corvette, ran aground on Korea's Eastern Coast during a blizzard.

title: Close Up of USS Manchester Helicopter On Rescue Mission
Scopenote: The USS Manchester's helicopter lands on the snow covered beach at Kisamun Dan, Korea. A rescue mission was launched after the HMTS Prasae, a Thailand Corvette, ran aground on Korea's Eastern Coast during a blizzard.

title: USS Manchester Helicopter Approaches Beach in Korea
Scopenote: The USS Manchester helicopter, nicknamed the Clementine, approaches the beach on the coast of Korea. A rescue mission was launched after the HTMS Prasae, a Thailand Corvette, ran aground on Korea's Eastern Coast during a blizzard.

title: Troops Take Shelter at Kisamun Dan, Korea on Beach
Scopenote: Under enemy fire, unidentified troops and crew members from the run aground HMTS Prasae take shelter on the beach while they await rescue from the USS Manchester helicopter. A rescue mission was launched after the HTMS Prasae, a Thailand Corvette ran aground on Korea's Eastern Coast during a blizzard.

title: Crew Members of the HMTS Prasae Await Rescue
Scopenote: Under enemy fire, unidentified troops and crew members from the run aground HMTS Prasae take shelter on the beach while they await rescue from the USS Manchester helicopter. A rescue mission was launched after the HTMS Prasae, a Thailand Corvette, ran aground on Korea's Eastern Coast during a blizzard.

title: USS Manchester Helicopter Lands on Snow Covered Beach
Scopenote: The USS Manchester's helicopter, nicknamed the Clementine, lands on the snow covered beach at Kisamun Dan, Korea. Photo was taken aboard the HMTS Prasae. A rescue mission was launched after the HTMS Prasae, a Thailand Corvette, ran aground on Korea's Eastern Coast during a blizzard.

title: USS Manchester Helicopter Lands at Kisamun Dan, Korea on Rescue Mission
Scopenote: The USS Manchester's helicopter, nicknamed the Clementine, lands on the snow covered beach at Kisamun Dan, Korea. A rescue mission was launched after the HMTS Prasae, a Thailand Corvette, ran aground on Korea's Eastern Coast during a blizzard. The HMTS Prasae is in the foreground.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks at Sasebo, Japan
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks poses for a photo at Sasebo, Japan while still aboard the USS Manchester.

title: United States Marines at Sin Do Island, Korea
Scopenote: United States Marines walk along a snow covered path on Sin Do Island, located in Wonsan Harbor, Korea after it was captured.

title: A Cloud of Smoke Drifts From USS Manchester
Scopenote: This is an aerial view of the USS Manchester firing toward the Korean shoreline. Images were taken from Manchester's helicopter by Lieutenant Ken Henry, United States Marine Corps, Spotter.

title: USS Manchester with USS Missouri Further Offshore
Scopenote: The USS Manchester fires on the Korean shore with the USS Missouri further offshore.

title: The Start of the Two Day Bombardment of Kansong and Kosong, Korea
Scopenote: The USS Manchester fires during the start of the two day bombardment of Kansong and Kosong, Korea.

title: Fire Rings From USS Manchester's Cannons
Scopenote: The USS Manchester as it fires its cannons on Korean shoreline in this photo captured by First Lieutenant Ken Henry, United States Marine Corps, from the helicopter of the Manchester. Original caption: In a two page spread in U.S. Camera magazine captioned this photo by 1st Lt Ken Henry USMC "The Years Greatest Amateur Picture." Also used by newspapers all over the United States, such as the St. Louis Star Times 2-13-51.

title: USS Manchester Fires on Korea
Scopenote: The USS Manchester fires upon the coast of Korea during a battle. This photo was taken from a spotter in the USS Manchester's helicopter. Original caption: Message from Captain USS Lind DD703 "You have a nice flame thrower."

title: United States Navy Vessel Photographed From the USS Manchester
Scopenote: An unidentified United States Navy vessel is silhouetted against the horizon in a photograph taken from the USS Manchester with her guns in the foreground.

title: An Oriental Tea House
Scopenote: A group of unidentified people are gathered at an oriental teahouse, probably in Japan. The photograph is part of an album entitled "Pictures by R. Admiral Lewis Parks.  USS Manchester."

title: Photograph of Rear Admiral Lewis Parks Onboard the USS Manchester
Scopenote: Photograph of Rear Admiral Lewis Parks in his cold weather gear at work on the USS Manchester.

title: Hot Springs at Unzen, Japan
Scopenote: Steam billows from the Unzen, Japan hot springs. United States Naval officers, including Captain Lewis S. Parks of the USS Manchester, visited the springs during time off.

title: Captain Lewis S. Parks at Unzen, Japan
Scopenote: Captain Lewis S. Parks, of the USS Manchester, stands at the hot springs at Unzen, Japan during a few days of rest and relaxation.

title: Pacific Sunset From the USS Manchester
Scopenote: This is a photograph of an unidentified United States Navy vessel with the setting sun in background, taken from the USS Manchester with her guns and an unidentified corpsman in the foreground.

title: Pacific Sunset From USS Manchester
Scopenote: This is a photograph of an unidentified United States Navy vessel with the setting sun in background, taken from the USS Manchester with her guns in the foreground. The photograph is part of an album entitled "Pictures by R. Admiral Lewis Parks.  USS Manchester."

title: Pacific Sun Illuminates the Ocean and a United States Navy Vessel
Scopenote: An unidentified United States Naval vessel can An unidentified United States Navy vessel is silhouetted against the horizon in a photograph taken from the USS Manchester with her guns in the foreground.

title: Pacific Sunset with United States Navy Vessel
Scopenote: This is a photograph of an unidentified United States Navy vessel with the setting sun in background, taken from the USS Manchester.

title: Guns of the USS Manchester
Scopenote: A photograph of the guns and other equipment of the USS Manchester.

title: Shells Stacked on USS Manchester's Deck
Scopenote: Ammunition shells are stacked near the cannons of the USS Manchester in Wonsan Harbor, Korea.

title: Japanese Civilians Gather Around USS Manchester Helicopter
Scopenote: Curious Japanese civilians, mostly children, gather around the USS Manchester's helicopter, nicknamed the "Clementine". It was preparing to return to the USS Manchester from Unzen, Japan during an rest and relaxation excursion. All are unidentified.

title: United States Navy Vessel Photographed From the USS Manchester
Scopenote: An unidentified United States Navy vessel is silhouetted against the horizon in a photograph taken from the USS Manchester with her guns in the foreground.

title: USS Manchester Guns Hammer Fankochi, Korea
Scopenote: The USS Manchester's guns shown during a bombardment of the Korean coast line.  The Manchester and Admiral Parks led the task force. The photograph is part of an album entitled "Pictures by R. Admiral Lewis Parks.  USS Manchester."

title: Pacific Sunset From USS Manchester
Scopenote: An unidentified United States Navy vessel is silhouetted against the horizon in a photograph taken from the USS Manchester with her guns in the foreground.

title: United States Navy Vessel Photographed From the USS Manchester
Scopenote: An unidentified United States Navy vessel is silhouetted against the horizon in a photograph taken from the USS Manchester with her guns in the foreground.

title: Two Corpsmen on the USS Manchester
Scopenote: Two unidentified corpsmen are visible aboard the USS Manchester while in the distance can be see two large naval vessels and an unidentified coastline. The photograph is part of an album entitled "Pictures by R. Admiral Lewis Parks.  USS Manchester."

title: Japanese Woman Sells Eggs at Unzen, Japan
Scopenote: An unidentified Japanese woman holds a small basket with eggs that she was selling at Unzen, Japan. She cooked the eggs in the hot springs when visitors came.

title: Captain Lewis Parks Prepares to Leave for R&R
Scopenote: Captain Lewis Parks, seen inside the USS Manchester's helicopter, prepares to leave the USS Manchester for a few days at the hot sulfur baths at Unzen, Japan. Others are unidentified.

title: United States Navy Vessel as Seen From the USS Manchester
Scopenote: An unidentified United States Navy vessel is silhouetted against the horizon in a photograph taken from the USS Manchester with her guns in the foreground.

title: View of a Ship Through a Porthole
Scopenote: A view of a ship taken through the porthole, probably from the USS Manchester.

title: Pacific Sunset with United States Vessel on Horizon
Scopenote: An unidentified United States Navy vessel is silhouetted against the horizon in a photograph taken from the USS Manchester.

title: Unites States Naval Vessel Photographed Through a Porthole
Scopenote: A United States Navy vessel is photographed through a porthole, probably of the USS Manchester.

title: Pacific Sunset From USS Manchester
Scopenote: This is a photograph of an unidentified United States Navy vessel with the setting sun in background, taken from the USS Manchester with her guns in the foreground. The photograph is part of an album entitled "Pictures by R. Admiral Lewis Parks.  USS Manchester."

title: Pacific Sunset From USS Manchester
Scopenote: This is a photograph of an unidentified United States Navy vessel with setting sun in background, taken from the USS Manchester with her guns in the foreground. The photograph is part of an album entitled "Pictures by R. Admiral Lewis Parks.  USS Manchester."
