On the left side of the photo, in the front row, are (from left to right), First Lady Bess W. Truman, Colonel Cornelius Mara, and Margaret Truman. In the background, behind Colonel Mara, is Under Secretary of State James Webb. Behind Mr. Webb, mostly obscured, is Secretary of Defense Robert Lovett. Standing next to Mr. Webb on the right is Secretary of Labor Maurice Tobin. In the background, behind Prince Philip, is Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman, and his wife, Ann Chapman. Behind Mr. Chapman is Attorney General J. Howard McGrath. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Arrives in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman arrives at the U.S. Naval Air Station in Key West, Florida for a vacation. He arrived aboard the Independence. President Harry S. Truman is pictured center in the processional line. Walking down the steps of the air craft is Admiral William Leahy (holding cane) and General Harry Vaughan (on right side of stairs). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Walks with Captain Cecil Adell, General Harry Vaughan, and General Robert Landry
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman walks along the pier with Captain Cecil Adell, General Harry Vaughan, and General Robert Landry during a vacation in Key West, Florida. From left: President Harry S. Truman, Captain Adell, General Vaughan, and General Landry. Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Holds Press Conference in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, center, seated, holds a press conference on the Little White House lawn in Key West, Florida during his vacation. Standing in the background, from left to right: six unidentified men, Admiral Robert Dennison, Admiral William Leahy, Sidney Souers, George Elsey, John Steelman, General Robert Landry, William Hassett, unidentified, Colonel Cornelius Mara, Press Secretary Joseph Short, and Joseph Feeney. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Arrives with Bess Truman  in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: After a day visit back to Washington, D.C., President Harry S. Truman returns to Key West, Florida to resume his vacation. Pictured left: two unidentified men, First Lady Bess Truman, Roberta Vinson, Chief Justice Fred Vinson, and President Harry S. Truman. Standing on the stairs are General Robert Landry and Press Secretary Joseph Short. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Staff Play Volleyball
Scopenote: Members of President Harry S. Truman's staff play volleyball in Key West, Florida during President Truman's vacation. From left to right: William Rigdon, Dallas Halverstadt, General Robert Landry, Richard Neustadt, Dr. Warden, and Ken Hechler.

title: Margaret Truman Plays Volleyball
Scopenote: Margaret Truman, fourth from right, plays volleyball with members of President Harry S. Truman's staff on vacation in Key West, Florida. All others are unidentified.

title: Margaret Truman Playing Volleyball in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: At the center of the sand court, Margaret Truman hits the volleyball during a game in Key West, Florida. She is playing volleyball with other members of President Harry S. Truman's vacation party in Key West. All others are unidentified.

title: Margaret Truman Plays Volleyball in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (near side of net, right) plays volleyball on a beach in Key West, Florida with members of President Harry S. Truman's vacation party. All others are unidentified.

title: Volleyball Game in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: Unidentified members of President Harry S. Truman's vacation party play volleyball on a sand court in Key West, Florida.

title: President Harry S. Truman, Margaret Truman, Captain Cecil Adell, and General Robert Landry
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman walks with Margaret Truman, Captain Cecil Adell, and General Robert Landry during a vacation in Key West, Florida. Others in the background are unidentified. See also photo 64-422.

title: Roger Tubby, Richard Neustadt, General Robert Landry, and General Harry Vaughan
Scopenote: From left to right, Roger Tubby, Richard Neustadt, General Robert Landry, and General Harry Vaughan stand in line getting food in Key West, Florida. They joined their boss, President Harry S. Truman, on vacation in Key West.

title: President Harry S. Truman's Staff in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: From left: Press Secretary Joseph Short, David Noyes, (standing) Dallas Halverstadt, and General Robert Landry in Key West, Florida. They joined their boss, President Harry S. Truman, on vacation in Key West. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is standing outside the Little White House while on vacation in Key West, Florida.

title: 1951 Presidential Vacation Party in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: Members of President Harry S. Truman's vacation party are sitting in the lawn of the Little White House in Key West, Florida. Front Row, left: Harold Enarson, Dr. John Steelman, First Lady Bess W. Truman, President Harry S. Truman, Margaret Truman, William Hassett, Irving Perlmeter. Standing, left: Eben Ayers, David Stowe, General Wallace Graham, General Harry Vaughan, Joseph Short, Admiral Robert Dennison, General Robert Landry, Philleo Nash, and Charles Jackson.

title: Lunch on the Lawn of the Little White House
Scopenote: Members of President Harry S. Truman's vacation party eat lunch on the lawn of the Little White House in Key West, Florida. From left to right: President Harry S. Truman, General Harry Vaughan, General Robert Landry, William Hassett, Irving Perlmeter, and James V. Fitzgerald.

title: Photographers at a Medal of Honor Ceremony
Scopenote: This stereo slide shows press photographers as they take photographs at a Congressional Medal of Honor ceremony presentation at the Rose Garden of the White House. Standing behind the podium on the left is President Harry S. Truman. All others are unidentified.

title: Major General Robert Landry and Secretary Frank Pace
Scopenote: From left, Major General Robert Landry, Secretary of the Army Frank Pace, and an unknown general stand underneath an airplane.

title: Seven Research Aircraft on Tarmac at Edwards Air Force Base
Scopenote: The stable of research aircraft at the Air Force Flight Test Center at Edwards Air Force Base in California. The United States Air Force and the National Advisory Committee for Aeronautics were testing, center: Douglas X-3, clockwise from left: Bell X-1A, Douglas D-558-I, Convair XF-92A, Bell X-5, Douglas D-558-II, and Northrop X-4.

title: Six People Seated at a Dinner Table
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide of unknown people looking at the camera while seated at a long table. There are coffee cups, ashtrays, and a bowl of plums on the table along with centerpieces.

title: Building in Saadabad Complex
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing a building possibly, from the Saadabad Palace Complex in Tehran, Iran. The building is in the background with a water feature in the foreground. Possibly taken during General Robert Landry's trip to Iran.

title: General Robert Landry Poses by Classic Painting
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide of General Robert Landry posing next to a classic painting of a woman.

title: Two Women Stand Outside
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing two unidentified, middle aged women. The woman on the left is wearing a white sundress. The woman on the left is wearing a light blue skirt and suit jacket. The background is a wooded area.

title: Scene of People Waiting at Airport Outside
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing a group of reporters interviewing two different men at an airport. Averell Harriman is standing on the right side in a gray suit and light colored hat. The man in the center in the light suit is unidentified. All others are unidentified.

title: Scenic View of Lake Bled, Slovenia
Scopenote: This is part of a stereo slide of a scenic view of Lake Bled, Slovenia. The image is taken on one side of a lake facing towards the town and mountains in the distance. A white church steeple of St. Martin's can be seen.

title: Scenic View of Roadway
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing a tree-lined roadway leading into the distance, with flowers beds along the side, and a lamppost on the corner.

title: Water Fountains in a Garden
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide possibly from General Robert Landry's European or Iranian trip. Two large water fountain features are situated in a green landscaped garden area.

title: Six Iranian Men at the Golestan Palace Hall of Diamonds
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide of six unidentified Iranian men in suits posing for a photo in the Golestan Palace Hall of Diamonds located in the Saadabad Palace Complex in Tehran, Iran. Image taken during General Robert Landry's visit to Iran.

title: Two Men Outside at Night
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing two unidentified men seated outside in green patio chairs in the evening. The men are wearing suits, one tan the other is light blue. There is a silver candelabra on a green stool. A Persian rug is on the ground under the chairs.

title: Averell Harriman Walks Towards the Camera from Airplane
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing Averell Harriman (wearing a light gray suit) walking towards the cameraman away from the airplane in the background. Foreign military or police officers in uniforms walk closely behind. All others are unidentified.

title: Scene of People Gathered at Airport
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing a group of  people walking from an airport building. It is unknown who the people are or what airport location is.

title: People Gathered Outside Socializing
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing a group of people gathered under a tree either standing or sitting in lawn chairs. All are unidentified.

title: Large Two Story Stone Building
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing a large two story brick building. The image is taken from a road leading up to the building, with a car parked on the left side. Three trees are in the photo with bushes on the right side.

title: Scene of People Gathered Under Commercial Plane
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing unknown people gathered under a wing of a commercial plane. A man is being interviewed by members of the media in the foreground.

title: People Gathered in Front of a Building
Scopenote: This is a stereo slide showing a group of people gathered in front of a building, with a photographer taking their picture in the foreground. All are unidentified.

title: General Robert Landry Poses by Fireplace
Scopenote: Stereo slide of Major General Robert Landry posing in a suit by a fireplace. Slide is labeled "New York City - 1952 Bob."

title: General Robert Landry in New York City
Scopenote: A stereo slide of General Robert Landry seated at a desk in New York City, New York.

title: General Robert Landry at Golestan Palace in Iran
Scopenote: This is one half of a stereo slide of General Robert Landry standing center with four unidentified men. They are likely at the Hall of Diamonds at Golestan Palace in the Saadabad Complex in Tehran, Iran.

title: Man Wearing Hat Surrounded by Reporters
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing a man wearing a white hat and surrounded by reporters and photographers as he approaches his car. All people are unidentified.

title: Scene of Car Parked by Building
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing a car parked beside a building. The car's driver side door is open. The building is tan and is possibly a side entrance. The image may have been taken during General Robert Landry's trip to Iran.

title: People at Banquet Table Pose for Photo
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing unidentified people seated at a dinning table. There appears to be eight people seated. The table is a long rectangular table with a white table cloth. The room is narrow with three archways along the wall. Palm trees are behind the guests.

title: Landscaped Garden
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing a landscaped garden. A tree line is in the distance. There appears to be water fountains in the garden.

title: Large Landscaped Garden
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide of a large landscaped garden, possibly located in Europe.

title: Grand Hotel Toplice in Bled, Slovenia
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide of the Grand Hotel Toplice in Bled, Slovenia. Cars are parked in front of the hotel with its exterior covered in green ivy.

title: Airplane at Airport with Spectators on Tarmac
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing an airplane at an airport. An airplane staircase is docked to the plane. Several people are standing on the tarmac, one appears to be in a foreign military uniform. A logo on the window next to the staircase says "Royal Air Mail."

title: Lakeside Dock with Two Swimming Pools
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing a small boat with people docking. On the large concrete patio dock, a table with an umbrella can be seen. There are two swimming pools connected to the dock in the lake area. All people are unidentified.

title: People Seated at Dining Table
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing unidentified people seated at a dining room table. Five people are seated at the table, a server and two other people stand behind the guests.

title: Members of Media Interview Man
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing a man in a white suit being interviewed by members of the media. It appears that they are at an airport. All people are unidentified.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks at Quonset Point, Rhode Island
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks, far right, arrived at Quonset Point, Rhode Island. Standing in front of him is Secretary of the Navy Dan Kimball. All others are unidentified.

title: Five People Emerge From Building
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide image of three men walking with a woman in a pink dress as they come down stairs from a white building. A man is following behind at the doorway. A man with a camera stands to the left. All people are unidentified.

title: Averell Harriman Interviewed by Reporters
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing Averell Harriman (near center, wearing off-white hat) surrounded by reporters as he tries to get in his car parked behind him.

title: People at Banquet Table Look at Camera
Scopenote: This is half a stereo slide showing unknown people, seven total along the left side of a table look at the camera for a photo.

title: Gold Statue of Man in Corner of Room
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing a gold statue of a man wearing a traditional garment holding out his right arm. The statue sits on a pedestal in the corner of a room by a window. Picture was possibly taken during General Robert Landry's trip to Iran.

title: Scenery in Iran
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide image of two women dressed in traditional dress as they cross a street in Iran. The image is taken from the passenger side of a car, and the hood of the car can be seen in the foreground. Mountains appear in the distance. Image possibly taken during General Robert Landry's trip to Iran.

title: Large Building with Orange Tile Roof and Green Shutters
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing a building with an orange roof, off-white exterior, and green shutters. There is a large wide staircase that leads up to the building. There are unknown people standing at the top of the stairs.

title: Street Scene in Iran
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing a street scene in Tehran, Iran during Robert Landry's Iranian trip.  It was taken from passenger side of a car. Women in traditional dress are walking down one side of the street, with tan brick buildings on that side of the street.

title: Street Scene of City in Iran
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide of a street scene in a city in Iran, possibly Tehran. Unidentified people are walking down the street. The image was taken from the passenger seat of a car.

title: Half Frame Exposure of Airport Scene
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing a half exposed frame of a scene from an airport. A man in a foreign military uniform stands for a photo. A commercial airliner is behind him.

title: Lake Bled, Slovenia
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing Lake Bled, Slovenia. A large cliff and trees are across the lake. A small rowboat carrying three unidentified people is on the right.

title: Scene of People in Yard Socializing
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing a group of people socializing in a casual setting in a yard with pine trees. Faint white lines are painted on the grass. One of the women is holding a pink parasol. All are unidentified.

title: White Palace
Scopenote: This is a stereo slide showing the White Palace at the Saadabad Complex in Tehran, Iran. This was the home of the Shah of Iran during General Robert Landry's visit to Iran.

title: Unidentified Man Speaks at Podium
Scopenote: An unidentified military officer speaks at what appears to be a breakfast or luncheon meeting with other unidentified men present.

title: Medal of Honor Presentation
Scopenote: A stereo slide shows a Congressional Medal of Honor medal ceremony presentation taking place in the Rose Garden of the White House. Near the center with his back to the camera is President Harry S. Truman. All others are unidentified.

title: Exterior View of the White Palace in Iran
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide of the White Palace in Iran, located in Tehran in the Saadabad Complex. Home of the Shah of Iran during General Robert Landry's visit to Iran.

title: A Woman Sits at a Desk with a Man
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing a woman seated behind a small desk. A man sits in the corner of the room next to the desk. Both are unidentified.

title: View of a Garden
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing a garden. There are seven rows of plants in the vertical direction. A tree line is in the background.

title: Two Men Seated at Patio Table
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing two men, both wearing suits, as they relax under a patio table with an umbrella in a landscaped area. On the right is Averell Harriman. The man on the left is unidentified.

title: Scene of People Outside
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing a group of people in a casual setting outside near a tree socializing. All are unidentified. A faint white line can be seen painted on the grass they are standing on.

title: Scenic View of Water Fountains in Garden
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing a grassy garden area with two water features. One is a smaller circle fountain and the other is an oval fountain. There are trees that line the background. The exact location is unknown.

title: Six People Seated at a Table
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide of six unknown people, three men and three women, seated at a table on what appears to be a patio at night.

title: Landscaped Floral Garden with Church Steeple in Distance
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide of a floral garden with a church steeple in the distance. Image possibly taken in Europe.

title: Street View in Tehran, Iran
Scopenote: This is a stereo slide of a building on a street corner at an intersection. The image was taken from the inside of a car. This image was likely taken during General Robert Landry's trip to Iran.

title: White Home
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing a white building, probably an estate, which features circular architectural details. A light green car is parked on the gravel driveway leading up to the house. A landscaped garden is to the left.

title: View from Bled Castle in Slovenia
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing the view from Bled Castle in Slovenia looking over Lake Bled. Three unidentified people are in a small rowboat in the foreground.

title: Double Exposed Negative of Airport Scene
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide that was double exposed and shows scene of people waiting on an airport tarmac for an airplane.

title: Two Men Seated in Ornate Chairs
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing two men wearing suits seated in formal ornate chairs. There is a table that the men are seated at. Image possibly taken during General Robert Landry's Iranian trip. Both men are unidentified.

title: View of Water Fountain in Garden
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing a landscaped garden featuring plants and a water fountain. Two unidentified men are working in the garden. Possibly taken during General Robert Landry's trip to Iran.

title: Scene of People Gathered at Airport
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing people in suits gathered on a tarmac of an unknown airport getting ready to board an airplane. The plane's wing can be seen in the top left corner.

title: A Group of Men Look at a Military Plane
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing a United States Air Force plane parked on a grassy area. Men stand under the wing looking at the plane. A man sits on a bicycle. All are unidentified.

title: Three Women Standing in A Room
Scopenote: This is one half of a stereo slide showing three women standing in a room. A woman in a navy dress with lace collar faces the camera and poses. Another woman wearing a pink dress holds up a bolt of fabric to another woman wearing a red and white plaid dress. There appears to be fabric laying on a table. All are unidentified.

title: Building with Shades Over Windows
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing building with windows that have bamboo shades over them on the outside. The building appears to be a long single story building. A large water feature is out front of the building, and a United States flag is on the flagpole. The building is possibly located in Iran and the picture was taken by General Robert Landry during his Iranian trip.

title: Two Seagulls
Scopenote: Two seagulls with their heads reaching up. Image from Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks' collection of unidentified photographs.

title: Medal of Honor Presentation
Scopenote: A stereo slide shows a Congressional Medal of Honor medal ceremony presentation taking place in the Rose Garden of the White House. Near the podium on the left with his back to the camera is President Harry S. Truman. All others are unidentified.

title: Ivy Duggan and Others at American Bankers Association Convention
Scopenote: From left to right stand Arnold Tschudy, Macdonald G. Newcomb, Ivy W. Duggan, and Jesse W. Tapp gathered in Atlantic City for the American Bankers Association Convention.

title: Major General Robert Landry with Two Military Officials
Scopenote: Major General Robert Landry (right) stands with two military officials that are unidentified.

title: Double Exposed Negative Airport Scene
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide that is double exposed, showing an airport scene of what appears to be a man boarding a plane via the airplane ladder. The other exposure is a view of the plane's door. All people are unidentified.

title: Five People Sit Under Awning Outside
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing five unidentified people sitting under an awning on a porch outside.

title: Man in Gray Suit Stands on Stairs
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing an unidentified man wearing a gray suit as he poses for a photo while standing in the middle of a staircase, possibly at the Saad Abad Complex in Tehran, Iran during General Robert Landry's trip to Iran.

title: Garden with Large Water Fountain
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide that shows a landscaped garden with large water fountain.

title: Men Seated Outside on a Patio
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing six men seated outside on a patio in green painted wood chairs in the evening. The ground beneath the chairs is covered with a Persian rug.

title: Averell Harriman Arrives at Airport
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing Averell Harriman (wearing a light gray suit and light tan hat) as he arrives at an airport. He is walking towards the camera. He is being followed by foreign military or police as they walk away from an airplane in the background. All others are unidentified.

title: Man Shakes Man's Hand in Passing
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing a man wearing a navy suit and hat as walks past a man in a tan suit. They are shaking hands in passing. There is a police officer or military official standing in the background. All are unidentified.

title: Scenic View of Lake Bled, Slovenia
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide of the village Bled, located in Slovenia. Church of St. Martin steeple can be seen on the shoreline. The image was most likely taken from the island located in Lake Bled.

title: Men in Suits Gather to Talk
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing five men, all wearing suits, as they huddle in a circle to talk. They are standing outside in a grassy lawn. The man second from the left is Averell Harriman. All others are unidentified.

title: Room Covered in Persian Rugs
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide of a room, likely from one of the palaces in the Saadabad Complex in Iran. The floors are covered in Persian rugs. Photo was likely taken during General Robert Landry's trip to Iran.

title: Four Men Seated Outside at Night
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing four unidentified men sitting in lawn chairs outside in the evening. A Persian rug is on the ground under the chairs.

title: Three People Sit at Dinner Table
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing three people, one woman and two men, seated at a dining room table. There is a window with curtains in the background. All are unidentified.

title: Saadabad Palace Complex in Iran
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide of the White Palace at the Saadabad Complex in Tehran, Iran. Water fountains can be see in front. Home of the Shah of Iran during General Robert Landry's visit to Iran.

title: People Emerge from Building Onto Stairs
Scopenote: This is a stereo slide of two men standing on a stair case to a porch of what is possibly a large estate. A woman in a pink dress stands in the doorway. A man in a brown suit stands with a camera in the bottom right corner of the image. There are two sphinx statues surrounded by plants along the sides of the stair case. Possibly from General Robert Landry's Iranian trip. All people are unidentified.

title: Two Model Boats in Garden
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide of two model boats that would be used in a large pond are positioned on a sidewalk in a landscaped garden.

title: Large Landscaped Gardens with Water Fountains
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide of a garden scene showing a large grass area with a large water feature with multiple water fountains. A smaller water fountain is in the left corner.

title: Four Men in Gray Suits Stand Outside
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing four unknown men posing for a photograph. They are all wearing light gray suits while they stand outside in a landscaped garden.

title: Group of Foreign Military or Police Gather in Front of Building
Scopenote: This is half of a stereo slide showing a group of men wearing dark blue uniforms gathered in front of a building. Possibly taken during General Robert Landry's Iranian trip.

title: Cuban Ambassador Presents Medals to United States Generals
Scopenote: As part of the celebration of the anniversary of the birth of Cuban National hero, Jose Marti, high military men of the United States were presented with decorations on behalf of the Cuban government. The awards were made by Cuban Ambassador to the United States, Dr. Luis Machado at the Cuban Embassy. Left to right: Brigadier General Robert Landry, Rear Admiral Robert Dennison, General J. Lawton Collins, Dr. Luis Machado, General Wade Hampton Haislip, Major General Harry Vaughan, and Major General Wallace Graham. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Men at the Beach in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: Members of President Harry S. Truman's vacation party relax at "Truman Beach" in Key West, Florida. All are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Congratulates General Robert Landry
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) congratulates General (right) Robert Landry on his promotion to Major General.

title: President Harry S. Truman and General Robert Landry
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman pins a star button to General Robert Landry's shoulder. This was his second star as General. He received the pin during President Truman's vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: President Harry S. Truman Promotes General Robert Landry
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) promotes Robert Landry (right) to Major General.

title: Admiral William Leahy and William Hassett
Scopenote: Admiral William Leahy (left) and William Hassett, Correspondence Secretary (right), joined President Harry S. Truman on vacation in Key West, Florida.

title: President Harry S. Truman Presents Commission to David Stowe
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, right) presents the commission of "Rear End Son" to David Stowe (foreground, left), Administrative Assistant to the President, during the trip to Key West, Florida. Others present (background, left to right): William Hassett, General Harry Vaughan, David Bell, and Admiral William Leahy.

title: David Stowe With His "Rear End Son" Flag
Scopenote: David Stowe, Administrative Assistant to the President, displays his "Rear End Son" flag during a humorous commissioning ceremony while on President Truman's vacation trip to Key West, Florida. From left: David Stowe, David Bell, Admiral William Leahy, President Harry S. Truman, David Lloyd, and Admiral Robert Dennison.

title: Joseph Feeney Reads Order of the Day to David Stowe
Scopenote: Joseph Feeney (right), President Harry S. Truman's Legislative Assistant, reads the Order of the Day, commissioning David Stowe (left) a "Rear End Son" of the "Animal Husbandry Service." Others present (seated left to right): William Hassett, General Harry Vaughan, David Bell, Admiral William Leahy, and President Harry S. Truman. This event took place during President Truman's vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: President Harry S. Truman After Sunday Services in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, with cane) leaves the Chapel after attending Sunday morning services during his vacation trip in Key West, Florida. Among those in the background are David Lloyd, Donald Dawson, and David Stowe (standing on steps, third, fourth, and fifth from the left), and Press Secretary Joseph Short (standing on steps, third from the right). All others are unidentified.

title: Judge Roy Harper and President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Judge Roy Harper of the District Court, St. Louis, Missouri (left) joined President Harry S. Truman (right) on vacation in Key West, Florida. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Presidential Party Visit Truman Beach in Key West
Scopenote: Presidential party members visit the Truman Beach in Key West, Florida during President Harry S. Truman's vacation. The man holding the Life magazine is Donald Dawson. Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Holds Press Conference
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated, second from right) holds a press conference  during his vacation trip to Key West, Florida.  Among those standing in the background are (from right to left): unidentified, David Bell, David Lloyd, unidentified, David Stowe, General Robert Landry, unidentified, William Hassett, two unidentified men, and Admiral Robert Dennison. All others are unidentified.

title: The President's Party Waves Goodbye to Frank McKinney
Scopenote: Frank McKinney departs from the dock at Key West, Florida for Miami, waving goodbye to the Presidential party as he is aboard the "Merry Mac". President Harry S. Truman can be seen on the dock with the cane. Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Holds Press Conference
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated in front of the fireplace) holds a press conference with members of the media during his visit in Key West, Florida. The two men standing behind the unidentified man seated, writing at the desk are Press Secretary Joseph Short (left) and Charles Murphy (right). Standing behind the sofa are (starting third from the left in patterned shirt): Admiral Robert Dennison, William Hassett, General Robert Landry, unidentified, David Lloyd, David Bell, and two unidentified men. All others are unidentified.

title: The Presidential Staff Has Lunch
Scopenote: Members of President Harry S. Truman's vacation party have lunch on the lawn of the Little White House in Key, West, Florida.

title: The Presidential Party at the Beach
Scopenote: Members of President Harry S. Truman's vacation party relax at the beach in Key West, Florida. From left: President Harry S. Truman, Clark Clifford, Donald Dawson, William Hassett (back to camera), Roger Tubby (back to camera), General Harry Vaughan (background, mostly obscured), Joseph Short, and Commander Leo Roberts.

title: William Hassett and General Robert Landry
Scopenote: William Hassett (left) and General Robert Landry (right) have lunch on the Little White House lawn during their visit to Key West, Florida. They visited Key West as part of President Harry S. Truman's vacation party.

title: Exterior of The Little White House
Scopenote: Exterior view of the Little White House in Key West, Florida as it appeared during President Harry S. Truman's 1952 vacation visit.

title: Charles E. Wilson, President Harry S. Truman, and Captain Cecil Adell
Scopenote: From left to right, Charles E. Wilson, President Harry S. Truman, and Captain Cecil Adell go for a walk in Key West, Florida. Mr. Wilson joined President Truman for part of his vacation in Key West. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Charles E. Wilson in Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Charles E. Wilson (right) on the lawn of the Little White House in Key West, Florida. Mr. Wilson visited President Truman during his vacation at Key West.

title: Farms Covered with Heavy Silt
Scopenote: Milk River Valley farmstead yard and fields covered with heavy silt after the Milk River flood.

title: Flooding in Nashua, Montana
Scopenote: Milk River flooding in Nashua, Montana.

title: Flooded Home
Scopenote: Flooded home in Montana caused by the Milk River Flood.

title: Flooded Town
Scopenote: Flooded town in Montana caused by the Milk River Flood.

title: North Havre Neighborhood
Scopenote: North Havre, Montana flooded due to Milk River flood.

title: Flooded Farm Home
Scopenote: Montana farm homes surrounded by water during Milk River Flood.

title: Flooded Train Yard
Scopenote: Flooded train yard in Montana caused by the Milk River Flood.

title: Highway Covered by Water
Scopenote: Highway not far from Dodson, Montana covered by water from the Milk River Flood.

title: Flooded Farm
Scopenote: Arial view of flooded farm in Montana from Milk River flood

title: Frenchman's Creek Dam
Scopenote: Frenchman's Creek Dam overrun during the Milk River Flood. The Montana Conservation Board built the dam.

title: Milk River Flood
Scopenote: Flooded town in Montana caused by the Milk River Flood.

title: Chinook Area
Scopenote: Chinook area during the Milk River flood.

title: Flooded Town Street
Scopenote: Flooded neighborhood in Montana caused by the Milk River Flood.

title: Rural Home Flooding
Scopenote: Rural home in Milk River Valley after flooding.

title: Flooding of Irrigation Ditches
Scopenote: Irrigation ditches in Montana carrying lots of Milk River flood water and silt.

title: Fresno Dam
Scopenote: Fresno Dam brimming full during the Milk River flood.

title: Speakers at Cooperative Conference, Edgewater Park, Mississippi
Scopenote: Speakers at the Cooperative Conference and Annual Stockbroker's Meeting, New Orleans Bank for Cooperatives at the Edgewater Gulf Hotel, Edgewater Park, Mississippi, gather for a photograph. From left to right: Roy L. Thompson, Robert L. Farrington, William G. Wysor, Ivy W. Duggan, and Francis R. Wilcox.

title: Queen Juliana of the Netherlands Arrives in Brunswick, Georgia
Scopenote: Her Majesty, Queen Juliana of the Netherlands, Prince Bernhard, and the crew of the Independence pose for a picture following the arrival in Georgia for the Queen's vacation at Sea Island. From left to right: Sergeant Willard, Major Minton, Colonel Francis Williams, General Robert Landry, Queen Juliana, Prince Bernhard, Sergeant Mitko, Mr. Lucas, Sgt. Borega, Major Christensen, Sgt. Campbell, Sgt. Robinson, Sgt. Hughes, and Sgt. Winslow.

title: General Robert Landry Greets Queen Juliana of the Netherlands
Scopenote: General Robert Landry (foreground, left) greets Queen Juliana of the Netherlands upon her arrival in Brunswick, Georgia. Pictured: General Robert Landry, Major Christensen, and Her Majesty, Queen Juliana of the Netherlands. President Harry S. Truman's airplane, The Independence, is in the background.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends Thomas Jefferson Birthday Ceremony
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) attending the wreath laying ceremonies at the Jefferson Memorial in celebration of Thomas Jefferson's 209th birthday. Descending the stairs of the Memorial are General Harry Vaughan (left) and General Robert Landry (right). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Uses Binoculars
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman uses binoculars to look out the window of his airplane.  The three other men in the picture are unidentified. This photo was taken during an aerial tour of areas effected by the flooding of the Missouri and Mississippi Rivers.

title: President Harry S. Truman at Offutt Air Force Base
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman after his arrival at Offutt Air Force Base in Omaha, Nebraska for conferences regarding the Missouri River Flood.  Front row, left to right: President Truman; General Curtis LeMay. Second row, left to right: General Harry Vaughan; General Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Eats Lunch with Governors
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman sits at lunch with governors from seven states before a conference on flood conditions.  From left to right, they are Governor Norman Brunsdale, North Dakota; Governor William Beardsley, Iowa; Governor Adlai Stevenson, Illinois; General Curtis LeMay of the Air Force; President Truman; Governor Val Peterson, Nebraska; Governor Sigurd Anderson, South Dakota; Governor Elmer Anderson, Minnesota; and Governor Walter Kohler, Wisconsin.

title: Unidentified Military Men
Scopenote: Three unidentified military officers stand while another holds a camera. This photo was probably taken at Offutt Air Force Base in Omaha, Nebraska during President Harry S. Truman's tour of areas damaged by the flooding of the Missouri and Mississippi Rivers.

title: Flood Waters of the Missouri River
Scopenote: This news photo, transmitted by the Associated Press, shows the Missouri River flood waters in the Omaha, Nebraska-Council Bluffs, Iowa area. In the foreground is the Union Pacific Railroad bridge.

title: President Harry S. Truman Speaks About Missouri and Mississippi River Flooding
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaks at a podium during a visit to Omaha, Nebraska to discuss the flooding of the Mississippi and Missouri Rivers. Seated behind him are the Governors of several states effected by the flooding of the rivers. From left to right are: Adlai Stevenson of Illinois; Norman Brunsdale of North Dakota; Val Peterson of Nebraska; and Elmer Anderson of Minnesota (partly obscured). Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Leaves Podium
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing beside podium) leaves the podium after speaking at Offutt Air Base in Nebraska. He spoke during a meeting with Governors of states effected by the flooding of the Mississippi and Missouri Rivers. Standing behind President Truman are Governor Val Peterson of Nebraska; Elmer Anderson of Minnesota; and Sigurd Anderson of South Dakota. Standing on the floor just next to the corner of the stage is Governor William Beardsley of Iowa. All others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Governors
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is in Omaha, Nebraska to meet with Governors of Midwestern states to discuss flooding conditions related to the Missouri and Mississippi Rivers. From left to right: Sigurd Anderson, South Dakota; Elmer Anderson, Minnesota; Walter Kohler, Wisconsin; President Truman; Val Peterson, Nebraska; Norman Brunsdale, North Dakota; Adlai Stevenson, Illinois; and William Beardsley, Iowa.

title: President Harry S. Truman Speaks Regarding Flooding of Mississippi and Missouri Rivers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaks at a podium during a visit to Omaha, Nebraska to discuss the flooding of the Mississippi and Missouri Rivers. Seated behind him are the Governors of several states effected by the flooding of the rivers. From left to right are: Adlai Stevenson of Illinois; Norman Brunsdale of North Dakota; Val Peterson of Nebraska; Elmer Anderson of Minnesota; Sigurd Anderson of South Dakota; Walter Kohler of Wisconsin; and William Beardsley of Iowa (seated on chair on the floor). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Talks with Reporters
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, on the right with his hands behind his back, talks with reporters. His presidential plane, the Independence, is in the background. All others are unidentified. President Truman is traveling to areas damaged by the flooding of the Missouri and Mississippi Rivers.

title: President Harry S. Truman Shakes Hands with Unidentified Man
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shakes hands with an unidentified man while surrounded by members of the press. His presidential plane, the Independence, is in the background. All others are unidentified. President Truman is traveling to areas damaged by the flooding of the Missouri and Mississippi Rivers.

title: Water Nears Top of Levee
Scopenote: Flood water from the Missouri River reaches near the top of a levee in Omaha, Nebraska. Behind the levee is the American Smelting and Refining Company building, well below the present water level.

title: President Harry S. Truman Speaks with Unidentified Man
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) speaks with an unidentified military man in front of an airplane. This photo was taken during President Truman's tour of areas effected by the flooding of the Missouri and Mississippi Rivers.

title: President Harry S. Truman at a Luncheon in Omaha, Nebraska
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman sits between Governor Val Peterson of Nebraska(right) and General Curtis LeMay (left) during his visit to Omaha, Nebraska. President Truman traveled there to meet with Governors of states effected by the flooding of the Mississippi and Missouri Rivers. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Governors
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, right of center, stands with his back to the camera with the Governors of various states impacted by the flooding of the Missouri and Mississippi Rivers. Illinois Governor Adlai Stevenson is on the extreme left. Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Midwestern Governors
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is in Omaha, Nebraska to meet with Governors of Midwestern states to discuss flooding conditions related to the Missouri and Mississippi Rivers. From left to right: Sigurd Anderson, South Dakota; Elmer Anderson, Minnesota; Walter Kohler, Wisconsin; President Truman; Val Peterson, Nebraska; Norman Brunsdale, North Dakota; Adlai Stevenson, Illinois; and William Beardsley, Iowa.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends Luncheon with Midwestern Governors
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman sits at a luncheon with governors from seven states before a conference on flood conditions. Seated on the long side of the table from left to right are: Governor Norman Brunsdale of North Dakota, Governor William Beardsley of Iowa, Governor Adlai Stevenson of Illinois, General Curtis LeMay of the Air Force, President Truman, Governor Val Peterson of Nebraska, Governor Sigurd Anderson of South Dakota, Governor Elmer Anderson of Minnesota, and Governor Walter Kohler of Wisconsin. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Midwestern Governors
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is in Omaha, Nebraska to meet with Governors of Midwestern states to discuss flooding conditions related to the Missouri and Mississippi Rivers. From left to right: Sigurd Anderson, South Dakota; Elmer Anderson, Minnesota; Walter Kohler, Wisconsin; President Truman; Val Peterson, Nebraska; Norman Brunsdale, North Dakota; Adlai Stevenson, Illinois; and William Beardsley, Iowa.

title: President Harry S. Truman Saluted by Soldiers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (in civilian clothes, standing at the end of the line of soldiers on the left) is saluted by a group of unidentified soldiers upon his arrival at Offutt Air Base in Omaha, Nebraska. President Truman is in Nebraska to meet with Governors of Midwestern states effected by the flooding of the Mississippi and Missouri Rivers. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman's Plane Over Sioux City, Iowa
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman's plane, the Independence, flies over Sioux City, Iowa. President Truman is on board the plane, touring areas damaged by the flooding of the Missouri and Mississippi Rivers.

title: President Harry S. Truman Before Conference on Flooding of the Missouri River
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman sits at a luncheon with governors from seven states before a conference on flood conditions. Seated on the long side of the table from left to right are: Governor Norman Brunsdale of North Dakota, Governor William Beardsley of Iowa, Governor Adlai Stevenson of Illinois, General Curtis LeMay of the Air Force, President Truman, Governor Val Peterson of Nebraska, Governor Sigurd Anderson of South Dakota, Governor Elmer Anderson of Minnesota, and Governor Walter Kohler of Wisconsin. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Arrives at Offutt Air Force Base
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, left) arrives at Offutt Air Force Base in Omaha, Nebraska for conferences regarding the Missouri River Flood. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Arrives at Offutt Air Force Base
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman arrives at Offutt Air Force Base in Omaha, Nebraska for conferences regarding the Missouri River Flood. Front row, left to right: President Truman; General Curtis LeMay. Second row, left to right: General Harry Vaughan; General Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

title: Grain Storage Surrounded by Flood Water
Scopenote: Grain storage bins and storage sheds near Blencoe, Iowa are completely surrounded by muddy water from the flooding of the Missouri River.

title: President Harry S. Truman's Plane Over Sioux City
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman's airplane, the Independence, flies over flood-ravaged Sioux City, Iowa.

title: President Harry S. Truman Gestures from Airplane
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) gestures out the window of his plane, surrounded by three unidentified men, during an aerial tour of areas effected by flooding of the Missouri and Mississippi Rivers.

title: President Harry S. Truman Points out of Airplane Window
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman points out of the window of his airplane during an aerial tour of areas effected by flooding of the Missouri and Mississippi Rivers.

title: Flood Waters Near Top of Levee
Scopenote: Flood water from the Missouri River reaches near the top of a levee in Omaha, Nebraska. Behind the levee is the American Smelting and Refining Company building, well below the present water level.

title: President Harry S. Truman at a Luncheon in Omaha, Nebraska
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman sits between Governor Val Peterson of Nebraska(right) and General Curtis LeMay (left) during his visit to Omaha, Nebraska. President Truman traveled there to meet with Governors of states effected by the flooding of the Mississippi and Missouri Rivers. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Flood Waters Near the Top of Levee
Scopenote: Flood water from the Missouri River reaches near the top of a levee in Omaha, Nebraska. Behind the levee is the American Smelting and Refining Company building, well below the present water level.

title: Aerial View of Flood Waters
Scopenote: This news photo, transmitted by the Associated Press, shows the Missouri River flood waters in the Omaha, Nebraska-Council Bluffs, Iowa area. In the foreground is the Union Pacific Railroad bridge.

title: Water Nears Top of Levee
Scopenote: Flood water from the Missouri River reaches near the top of a levee in Omaha, Nebraska. Behind the levee is the American Smelting and Refining Company building, well below the present water level.

title: President Harry S. Truman Speaks Regarding Flooding of the Mississippi and Missouri Rivers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaks at a podium during a visit to Omaha, Nebraska to discuss the flooding of the Mississippi and Missouri Rivers. Standing behind him are the Governors of several states effected by the flooding of the rivers. From left to right are: Adlai Stevenson of Illinois; Norman Brunsdale of North Dakota; Val Peterson of Nebraska; Elmer Anderson of Minnesota; Sigurd Anderson of South Dakota; and Walter Kohler  of Wisconsin.

title: Farm Flooding
Scopenote: Aerial view of farm flooding in South Dakota.

title: Percival School
Scopenote: Percival School near Sioux City, Iowa, during a flood of the Missouri River.

title: George Mattes Home
Scopenote: The George Mattes home and farm near Sioux City, Iowa, during a flood of the Missouri River.

title: Flooded Home Near Sioux City, Iowa
Scopenote: The flooded home of Harold Holsclaw near Sioux City, Iowa.

title: Flooded Farm
Scopenote: The flooded farm of Bill Johnson near Sioux City, Iowa.

title: Erosion on Aldrick Farm
Scopenote: Holes washed out in farmland south of McPaul, Iowa caused by flooding of the Missouri River.

title: Theodore Schooley's Home
Scopenote: Damage done to Theodore Schooley's home near McPaul, Iowa, during flooding of the Missouri River.

title: Highway 2 Near Iowa Bluffs
Scopenote: A bridge on Highway 2 near Iowa Bluffs was washed out and damaged by flooding of the Missouri River. Men standing on the bridge are unidentified.

title: Flooded Lumber Mill
Scopenote: Flood damage to the Sherwood-McElroy Lumber Company in Iowa due to flooding of the Missouri River.

title: Flooding of Farmland
Scopenote: Aerial photo of flooded lands in South Dakota.

title: Flooding on Farmland
Scopenote: An aerial view of flooded farmland in South Dakota.

title: Flooding in South Dakota
Scopenote: An aerial image of flood damage in South Dakota.

title: Flooded Bridge
Scopenote: A flooded bridge in South Dakota.

title: Home in Sioux City, Iowa
Scopenote: The flooded home of Ed McElroy near Sioux City, Iowa.

title: Claude Sheldon Garage
Scopenote: The garage of Claude Sheldon damaged by flooding of the Missouri River near Sioux City, Iowa.

title: Jack Neeley Farm Home
Scopenote: Two unidentified women are sweeping the mud out of the home of Jack Neeley, west of Hamburg, Iowa, due to flooding of the Missouri River.

title: Orville Sonner Farm
Scopenote: Sand around the building and farm of Orville Sonner,  near the dike break on Plum Creek, Iowa.

title: Damaged Railroad Tracks
Scopenote: Corn cribs and railroad track damaged by flooding of the Missouri River near McPaul, Iowa.

title: Part of McPaul
Scopenote: The town of McPaul, Iowa flooded by the Missouri River.

title: Flooded Street in Percival
Scopenote: A flooded street near Percival, Iowa, showing damage from a flood of the Missouri River. A motorboat can be seen in the lower left corner of the image.

title: South Dakota Flooding
Scopenote: Flooding of farm in South Dakota.

title: Field in South Dakota
Scopenote: Aerial photograph of a field in South Dakota, showing some flooding in the distance.

title: Flooding Farm
Scopenote: An aerial view of a flooded farm field, somewhere in South Dakota.

title: Flooded House
Scopenote: The flooded home of Bruce O'Dell near Sioux City, Iowa.

title: Flooding in South Dakota
Scopenote: Flooding of farmland in South Dakota.

title: Glen Rogers Farm
Scopenote: The farm and home of Glen Rogers, near Sioux City, Iowa, exposed to flooding of the Missouri River.

title: Ernest Sheldon Home
Scopenote: The home of Ernest Sheldon near Sioux City, Iowa, during a flood of the Missouri River.

title: Missouri Valley Drainage District
Scopenote: This photo shows damage to drainage a ditch, south of Highway 2, caused by flooding of the Missouri River.

title: Middle States Utilities Company Line Crew
Scopenote: Men from the Middle State Utilities Company working on a boat to repair power lines damaged by the Missouri River flood, somewhere near Sioux City, Iowa. All men are unidentified.

title: Clem Woods Barn
Scopenote: Damage to a barn on the farm of Clem Woods can be seen in this photo. The Woods farm is about a quarter-mile south of a dike break at Plum Creek, which broke during flooding of the Missouri River.

title: Sand Covering Farm Land
Scopenote: Sand covers farm land just south of Highway 2, west of Hamburg, Iowa, caused by flooding of the Missouri River.

title: Farm Flooding
Scopenote: Flooding of farm in South Dakota flood.

title: Flooded Town
Scopenote: Aerial view of flood in South Dakota town.

title: Flood Damage at a Farm
Scopenote: Flood damage to tanks on the farm of Claude Sheldon in Sioux City, Iowa.

title: Town Flooding
Scopenote: Flooding of a town in South Dakota.

title: Foundation on Jay Lecks Farm home
Scopenote: A house on the farm of Jay Lecks was washed away just west of McPaul, Iowa, due to flooding of the Missouri River. All that remains is the foundation.

title: Coleman Sheldon Farm
Scopenote: Coleman Sheldon farm near Sioux City, Iowa, flooded by the Missouri River.

title: Land on Sonner farm
Scopenote: Sand washed up on farmland just south of Highway Number 2 on the farm of Orville Sonner. The two men in the photo are unidentified.

title: Clem Woods Farm
Scopenote: The Clem Woods farm residence, about a quarter-mile south of a dike break on Plum Creek, Iowa.

title: Clem Woods Machine Shed
Scopenote: Damage to machinery and machine shed or garage on the farm of Clem Woods farm. The farm is about a quarter-mile south of a dike break on Plum Creek, Iowa, caused by flooding of the Missouri River.

title: Railroad Tracks Damaged by Flooding
Scopenote: Part of the railroad tracks of the Chicago, Burling and Quincy Railroad tracks have washed out, washing gravel and sand onto Quentin Parkinson's land. His land is near the Missouri River, along the Iowa-Nebraska state line.

title: Drowned Car
Scopenote: Cars are inundated with floodwater in a South Dakota town.

title: Flooded Farmland
Scopenote: An aerial view of flooding in South Dakota.

title: People on a Boat
Scopenote: Unidentified people are on a boat in a flooded town in South Dakota.

title: Quentin Parkison Farm
Scopenote: The home and farm of Quentin Parkison near Sioux City, Iowa, during a flood of the Missouri River.

title: Fred Zach Home
Scopenote: Flooding at the Zach home near Sioux City, Iowa.

title: Tom Managhan Home
Scopenote: Flooded home and farm of Tom Managhan near Sioux City, Iowa.

title: McPaul Bin Site
Scopenote: Bins on the McPaul farm near Sioux City, Iowa during a flood of the Missouri River.

title: Inside Theodore Schooley's House
Scopenote: The inside of Theodore Schooley's house in McPaul, Iowa, after flood damage from the Missouri River.

title: Fred Zach Home
Scopenote: The home and farm of Fred Zach near Sioux City, Iowa, during a flood of the Missouri River.

title: President Harry S. Truman Awards General Robert Landry with Second Star
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and other White House staff members congratulate General Robert Landry upon his promotion. This picture was taken while Truman was on vacation in Key West, Florida outside his residence on the naval base. Front row, left to right: Colonel Francis Williams, General Harry Vaughan, General Robert Landry, President Truman, Admiral William Leahy, Admiral Robert Dennison, and Sidney Souers. Back row, from left to right: Irving Perlmeter, Matthew Connelly, unidentified, Charles Murphy, William Hassett, Lieutenant Commander Leo Roberts, Commander William Rigdon, Joseph Fenney, Joseph Short, and Donald Dawson.

title: Farm House
Scopenote: A farm house and field after being damaged by a flood, somewhere along the Missouri River.

title: Sand on Clem Woods Farm
Scopenote: Sand washed out on the farm of Clem Woods from flood waters. The farm is about a quarter-mile south of a dike break on Plum Creek, Iowa, caused by flooding of the Missouri River.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives President's Airport Commission Report
Scopenote: General James H. Doolittle presents the report of the President's Airport Commission to President Harry S. Truman. Standing, left to right: Mr. Charles F. Horne, General Robert Landry, and Paul Johnston, Seated: Dr. Jerome Hunsaker, President Harry S. Truman, and General James Doolittle. This photograph appeared in the June 1952 issue of LIFE Magazine.

title: General Robert Landry Attends Reception
Scopenote: General Robert Landry attended a reception at Fort McNair Officers Club given by Secretary and Mrs. Frank Pace, Jr. in honor of the Minister of War of France and Madame Chevigne. From left, Mrs. Landry, General Robert Landry, Mrs. Pace, Minister Chevigne, Madame Chevigne.

title: General Robert Landry Visits Honolulu, Hawaii
Scopenote: General Robert Landry, second from right, visits Honolulu, Hawaii. From left, Mrs. Mullahey, Roswell Gilpatric, unknown woman, General Wetzel, General Roger Ramey, General Landry, and  William Mullahey.

title: Military Officials Inspect Armament in Pusan, Korea
Scopenote: From left to right, General Robert Lee, Under Secretary of the Air Force Roswell Gilpatric, General Nathan Twining, unidentified man, Colonel Glen C. Nye, Commanding Officer of the 17th Bomb Wing, and General Glenn Barcus inspect armament at Headquarters, 17th Bomb Wing, Pusan, Korea.

title: General Nathan Twining and R. L. Gilpatric Arrive in Pusan, Korea
Scopenote: General Nathan Twining (on stairs) and Under Secretary of the Air Force R.L. Gilpatric (at top of stairs near door) arrive in Pusan, Korea, the headquarters of the United States Air Force 17th Bomb Wing.

title: Bomb Loads for the B-26
Scopenote: Alternate bomb loads for the B-26, stationed in Pusan, Korea, headquarters for the United States Air Force 17th Bomb Wing.

title: General Robert Landry and General Roger Ramey in Taegu, Korea
Scopenote: General Robert (left) Landry and General Roger Ramey (second from left) at the F-84 Base at Taegu, Korea.

title: Military Personnel Examine Photo Laboratory
Scopenote: From left to right, General Nathan Twining, General Glenn Barcus, Under Secretary of the Air Force Roswell Gilpatric, General Otto Weyland, Colonel Edwin Chickering, and General Roger Ramey inspect the photo laboratory at the Kimpo Airport in Seoul, Korea.

title: Military Officials at Kimpo Airport, Seoul, Korea
Scopenote: Under Secretary of the Air Force Roswell Gilpatric (in light shirt, back to camera), Colonel Harrison R. Thyng, Commanding Officer of the 4th Fighter Interceptor Wing, and General Otto Weyland conduct an inspection at Kimpo Airport, Seoul, Korea. Others are unidentified.

title: Air Force Officers with Under Secretary of the Air Force Roswell Gilpatric
Scopenote: From left to right, General Otto Weyland, General Nathan Twining, Under Secretary of the Air Force R. L. Gilpatric, and Colonel Edwin Chickering stand and pose for a photo in front of the 67th Tactical Reconnaissance Wing sign at Kimpo Airport, Seoul, Korea.

title: McPaul School and Sheldon bank
Scopenote: The McPaul School and tanks on a farm during a flood of the Missouri River.

title: Ivy W. Duggan Gets Inducted
Scopenote: Ivy W. Duggan (third from left) is inducted into the Spokane Indian Tribe as Chief Chinchess Hoolulim. His title means "a helper with money" and he was inducted to help the people with their money so they could begin to farm and carry out farm operations.  All others are unidentified.

title: Major General Robert Landry with Three People
Scopenote: Stereo slide of Major General Robert Landry posing for a photo next to two unknown women and an unknown man. The calendar in the photo states that the dates is October 1952.

title: Guests at the Harmon Trophy Presentation and Luncheon
Scopenote: Unidentified guests pose for a photograph at the Harmon Trophy Presentation and Luncheon.

title: Social Gathering
Scopenote: Stereo slide from a social gathering at a person's home. Pictured are three women holding drinks, a waiter holding a pitcher, and two men. All are unidentified. Caption handwritten on slide holder: "Party for Hester & Jesse-Nov '52."

title: President Harry S. Truman and Margaret Truman Attend Army/Navy Game
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and his daughter Margaret Truman attend the Army/Navy game. From left to right: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman, Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman, President Truman, Margaret Truman, Admiral William Leahy, unidentified. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends Army/Navy Game
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) attends the Army/Navy game and shakes hands with an unidentified player for Navy. Seated in the second row, left (lower left corner) is General Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

title: Football Player and Two Men at Game
Scopenote: A stereo slide shows President Harry S. Truman (center) at the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends 1952 Army Navy Game
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends the 1952 Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia, PA. Front row, left to right: Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman, President Harry S. Truman, Margaret Truman. Second row, left to right: Admiral Robert Dennison, Air Force General Robert Landry, unidentified woman. All others are unidentified. Original caption: 1952 A-N game HST-Margaret Dennisons Landrys Bobbye. The original item is a stereo slide, and this scan is the left side.

title: President Harry S. Truman at Army-Navy Game
Scopenote: Stereo slide of President Harry S. Truman attending the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The man just barely visible in the lower right corner is likely photographer Abbie Rowe.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends Army-Navy Game
Scopenote: Stereo slide shows President Harry S. Truman (right) flipping the coin before the start of the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends 1952 Army-Navy Game
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends the 1952 Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia, PA. Seated in the front row, left to right are Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman, President Harry S. Truman, and Margaret Truman. In the second row, left to right are Admiral Robert Dennison, Mrs. Robert Landry, and General Robert Landry. All others are unidentified. Original notation says, "1952 A-N game HST-Margaret Dennisons Landrys Bobbye." Original is a stereo slide, this scan is of the left side.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends 1952 Army-Navy Game
Scopenote: This is a stereo slide showing President Harry S. Truman attending the 1952 Army-Navy football game. Seated in the front row, left to right are Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman, President Harry S. Truman, and Margaret Truman. In the second row, left to right are Admiral Robert Dennison and General Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Margaret Truman Attend Army-Navy Game
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and his daughter Margaret Truman attend the 1952 Army-Navy game. From left to right: Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman, President Truman, and Margaret Truman. Seated in the second row are General Wallace Graham, unidentified woman (mostly obscured), Admiral Robert Dennison, unidentified woman (mostly obscured), and General Robert Landry (mostly obscured). All others are unidentified.

title: 1952 Army-Navy Football Game
Scopenote: This stereo slide shows a view of spectators attending the 1952 Army-Navy football game. All are unidentified. Original caption: "A-N game 1952."

title: View of the Field, Army-Navy Game
Scopenote: Unidentified spectators watch the Army-Navy football game at Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

title: Attendees at Navy/Army Football Game
Scopenote: Unidentified attendees watch the Navy/Army college football game at Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

title: View of Crowd at Army/Navy Game
Scopenote: A view of spectators in attendance at the Army/Navy game in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. All are unidentified.

title: Spectators at the Army-Navy Game
Scopenote: Unidentified spectators watch the Army-Navy football game at Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends 1952 Army/Navy Game
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends the 1952 Army-Navy game. Front row, left to right: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman, Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman, President Truman, Margaret Truman. Seated in the second row, between Mrs. Chapman and President Truman is Admiral Robert Dennison. Seated in the second row between President Truman and Margaret is General Robert Landry. All other are unidentified.

title: President Truman With Vivian Truman and Alex Sachs
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) with his brother J. Vivian Truman (center) and Alex Sachs (right) in Mr. Truman's office at the White House.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits Sedalia Air Force Base
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman visits the Sedalia Air Force Base (now Whiteman AFB) outside of Sedalia, Missouri. He is pictured seated next to Major General Robert Landry. Standing is Colonel Chester Cox.

title: Major General Robert Landry Poses with Unknown Lady
Scopenote: Major General Robert Landry poses for a photo with an unknown woman.

title: Major General Robert Landry with Man
Scopenote: Major General Robert Landry (left) sits next to an unknown man on an airplane. This is a stereo slide.

title: Four Men Holding Coconut Drinks
Scopenote: Stereo slide of four men holding coconut drinks while attending a party. There are other men in the background of the photo. All are unidentified.

title: Major General Robert Landry Plays Cards
Scopenote: Stereo slide of General Robert Landry, second from left, playing cards with other men seated at a table in a fuselage of a military transport aircraft. All others are unidentified.

title: Unknown Man Escorted as Guest
Scopenote: An unknown man wearing a suit is escorted by and unknown military officer. It appears they are at a naval facility.

title: Man and Woman Sit in Chair
Scopenote: A stereo slide of an unidentified man sitting in an upholstered chair in the corner of a room with an unidentified woman beside him sitting on the arm of the chair. A dresser, lamp, green curtains, and window air conditioning unit are visible in the image.

title: Military Review at Unknown Military Base
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a military review at an unknown military base.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks and Rear Admiral Freeland Daubin
Scopenote: From left to right Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks, Paul Suloff, and Rear Admiral Freeland Daubin at NBC Studios in New York City for the Goodyear Program "Salute to Youth."

title: Building Exterior with Welcome Banner
Scopenote: Stereo slide of an exterior of a building. A veranda patio is in the center of the building where a welcome banner is draped across the railing. Six ropes with flags lead up to a flag pole at the center of the building. Several cars are parked out front.

title: Sergeant Baker at Barksdale Air Force Base
Scopenote: This is a stereo slide of Sergeant Baker posing by an Air Force car at Barksdale Air Force Base.

title: Guard of Honor for Winston Churchill
Scopenote: Stereo slide of a military guard of honor assembled at Montego Bay for the arrival of Winston Churchill. Bottom right corner, is Major General Robert Landry facing the Honor Guard. Original caption written on slide: "Montego Bay, Jan '53 Guard of Honor for Churchill - Yours Truly."

title: Senior Officers Indoctrination Course at Keesler Air Force Base
Scopenote: Senior Officers pose for a photo during the Indoctrination Course at Keesler Air Force Base in Mississippi. Class Number 53-7 held on February 5-6, 1953. First row, left to right, Colonel L. E. Bell, Colonel L. C. Dean, Major General Robert Landry, Brigadier General J. P. Kirkendall, Colonel R. D. Dick, Colonel R. V. Dunn. Second row, left to right: Colonel R. R. Haller, Colonel J. R. Ulricson, Colonel J. C. Watkins, Lieutenant Colonel P. E. Chamberlain, Lieutenant Colonel D. W. Corley, Lieutenant Colonel K. W. Mitchim. Third row, left to right: Lieutenant Colonel L. E. Ogozaly, Lieutenant Colonel R. W. Tarvin, Lieutenant Colonel F. R. Webster, Lieutenant Colonel R. L. Wright, Major E. J. Burke, Major J. E. Popham.

title: Second Air Force Commanders' Conference
Scopenote: Armed forces officers attend the Second Air Force Commanders' Conference held at Ramey Air Force Base, Puerto Rico on February 23-26, 1953. Front row, sixth from left is General Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

title: Explosion During Training Exercise
Scopenote: Controlled explosion takes place during a training exercise at a military training facility. Location unknown.

title: Members of Georgia Delegation at National 4-H Breakfast
Scopenote: Ivy Duggan sits with others at the National 4-H Breakfast at the Mayflower Hotel, Washington, D.C. Seated from the left to right: Ivy W. Duggan, Farm Credit Administration; Charles Dana Bennett, for American Agriculture; William A. Davis Jr., of Valdosta, Georgia, national winner in 4-H leadership; Senator Walter F. George; Rhonwyn Lowry, 4-H Fellow from Georgia; Congressman E. L. Forrester;  Adrian Short, national winner in 4-H citizenship; and Walter S. Brown, Associate Director of Extension, Georgia. Others are unidentified.

title: Military Officials at MacDill Air Force Base
Scopenote: During a visit to MacDill Air Force Base in Tampa, Florida, military officials inspect an item. All men are unidentified.

title: General Robert Landry Visits MacDill Air Force Base
Scopenote: General Robert Landry (third from right) visits MacDill Air Force Base in Tampa, Florida. All others are unidentified.

title: Man Climbs Ladder Out of Plane at MacDill Air Force Base
Scopenote: An unidentified man climbs down out of an air craft at MacDill Air Force Base in Tampa, Florida.

title: Military Officials at MacDill Air Force Base
Scopenote: Military officials approach items laid out at MacDill Air Force Base in Tampa, Florida. General Robert Landry is third from right. All others are unidentified.

title: Secretary of Defense Charles E. Wilson Cutting Ribbon at Ceremony
Scopenote: Secretary of Defense Charles E. Wilson announces the Power for Peace Photographic exhibit official open by cutting a satin ribbon. He was accompanied by (left to right) Secretary of the Navy Robert B. Anderson; Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks, Navy Chief of Information; General Nathan Twining, Air Force Chief of Staff; Secretary of the Air Force Harold E. Talbott; General of the Army Omar Bradley, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff (mostly obscured); Secretary of the Army Robert T. Stevens; and General John Hull, Vice Chief of Staff, Army.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks Views Exhibit

This photo was taken while Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks served as a Chief of Staff to the Joint Staff of the United Nations.

title: Aerial View of Japanese City
Scopenote: This is an aerial view over a city in Japan, possibly Hiroshima.

General Fisher, Brig. General Griffis, Brig. General Montgomery, Brig. General Walsh, Brig. General Blanchard, Brig. General Sillin. General Mooney, Brig. General Kalberer, Brig. General Nazzaro, Brig. General Olds, Brig. General Preston, Brig. General Wheless, Brig. General Compton, Brig. General Sanborn, Brig. General Sullivan. General Harrison. Overseas Divisions: Brig. General Musgrave, Brig. General Dougher, Brig. General Caldara.

title: Armed Forces Officers at Hamilton Air Force Base

Todd, Brigadier General C. D. Vincent, Captain J. H. Howell, Colonel G. G. Northrup. First row, from left: Major General Robert Landry, Colonel G. F. Anderson. All others are unidentified.

Scopenote: General Robert Landry arrives for military review in his honor at Hamilton Air Force Base in California. Pictured from left: Colonel G. G. Northrup, Captain J. H. Howell, Colonel G. F. Anderson, Captain F.J. Hampton, Major General Landry, Brigadier General C. D. Vincent, and Major General W. E. Todd.

Scopenote: General Robert Landry and others stand on a platform and watch as airplanes approach for a flyover at an Hamilton Air Force Base in California. Second row from left: Major General W. E. Todd, Brigadier General C. D. Vincent, Captain J. H. Howell, Colonel G. G. Northrup. First row, from left: Major General Robert Landry, Colonel G. F. Anderson.

Scopenote: Airmen stand at attention at Hamilton Air Force Base in California for a military review in General Robert Landry's honor. All are unidentified.

Scopenote: Attendees of a military review held in General Robert Landry's honor at Hamilton Air Force Base in California stand on a reviewing platform. Second row from left: Major General W. E. Todd, Brigadier General C. D. Vincent, Captain G. G. Northrup. First row from left: Major General Robert Landry and Colonel G. F. Anderson.
