title: Alex Sachs at Harry S. Truman Presidential Library Groundbreaking
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right) and Alex Sachs (left) are standing at the groundbreaking ceremony for the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library. The rest of those pictured are unidentified.

title: Dr. Elmer Ellis Speaks at Truman Library Ground Breaking
Scopenote: University of Missouri President Dr. Elmer Ellis is speaking at the ground breaking ceremony for the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri. The Truman family is seated next to the podium: (left to right) Former President Harry S. Truman, Bess Truman, Margaret Truman, and Mary Jane Truman.  Also present is Alex Sachs (extreme right). All others are unidentified.

title: The Truman Family at the Truman Library Ground Breaking Ceremony
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left, just in front of flag) is seated with his family at the ground breaking ceremony for the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri. Margaret can be seen to the right of him, and his sister Mary Jane is to the right of her. University of Missouri President Elmer Ellis (second from right) is also seated with the Trumans, and Basil O'Conner is seated behind Margaret Truman, partly obscured. Edwin Pauley can also be seen (third from the right in the background). All others are unidentified.

title: Harry S. Truman Digging First Shovelful at Ground Breaking Ceremony
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman begins to dig the first shovelful of dirt at the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library ground breaking ceremony in Independence, Missouri. The rest of those pictured are unidentified.

title: Harry S. Truman with Shovel Full of Dirt at Truman Library Ground Breaking Ceremony
Scopenote: Stereo slide of former President Harry S. Truman holding a shovel full of dirt at the Truman Library Groundbreaking ceremony. Behind him is a military band and crowd of on-lookers. All others are unidentified. Original caption: "1955 H.S.T. breaking ground at Lib. Dedication Ind. MO."

title: Harry S. Truman at Truman Library Ground Breaking Ceremony
Scopenote: Stereo slide of former President Harry S. Truman attending the Truman Library Groundbreaking ceremony. He is pictured, shaking hands with an unknown man. Seated in the first row behind Mr. Truman are Bess W. Truman, Margaret Truman, and Mary Jane Truman. All others are unidentified. Original caption: "1955 H.S.T. at Lib. Dedic. Ceremony Ind., MO."

title: Truman Library Ground Breaking Ceremony
Scopenote: Stereo slide of the Truman Library Groundbreaking ceremony. Three men are pictured looking at the camera. There is a red, white, and blue bunting draped behind them. Original caption: "1955 Truman Lib. Dedication Independ. MO." The man seated in the center in Stuart Symington. All others are unidentified.

title: Alex Sachs and Monsignor L. Curtis Tiernan at Truman Library Ground Breaking
Scopenote: Monsignor L. Curtis Tiernan (left) and Alex Sachs (third from left) are among the distinguished guests at the ground breaking ceremony for the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri. The rest of those pictured are unidentified.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman and Family at Ground Breaking
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (center, on right side of podium) with his wife Bess (second from center) and daughter Margaret (third from center) and his sister Mary Jane Truman (second from right) are seated on the stage at the ground breaking ceremony for the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri. Sitting around them are also  University of Missouri President Elmer Ellis (second from right), Basil O'Connor (behind Margaret, partly obscured), and unidentified other people.

title: Dr. Elmer Ellis Speaking at the Truman Library Ground Breaking
Scopenote: University of Missouri President Dr. Elmer Ellis is speaking at the ground breaking ceremony for the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri. The Truman family is seated next to the podium: (left to right) Former President Harry S. Truman, Bess Truman, Margaret Truman, and Mary Jane Truman.  Also present is Alex Sachs (extreme right). All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Library Groundbreaking in 1955
Scopenote: Stereo slide from the Truman Library ground breaking ceremony in Independence, Missouri. Pictured are Margaret Truman (right) and Bess Wallace Truman (left, seated). All others pictured are unidentified. Original caption: "1955 Truman Lib. Dedication Independence MO."

title: Margaret Truman at the Truman Presidential Library Ground Breaking
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (standing) is introduced at the ground breaking ceremony for the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri. Her father, former President Harry S. Truman is seated second to the left of her, along with her mother, Bess (in gray hat).  Seated on the right is Margaret's aunt, Mary Jane  Truman. The rest of those in the picture are unidentified.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Shovels at the Truman Library Ground Breaking
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman digs the first shovel of dirt at the ground breaking ceremony for the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri. The others pictured are unidentified.

title: Stuart Symington and Paul Butler at Truman Library Ground Breaking
Scopenote: Missouri Senator Stuart Symington (background, third from left) and Democratic National Committee Chairman Paul Butler (background, fourth from left) are attending the ground breaking ceremony for the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri. The rest of those pictured are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Speaks to Audience at Truman Library Ground-Breaking
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right) speaks to an audience at the ground-breaking ceremony for the Truman Library. With Mr. Truman are  General Robert Landry, Former Air Force Aide to the President (left) and former Secretary of the Air Force, Stuart Symington (center). Original photograph is autographed by Mr. Truman: " Bob this is a pair I'd always draw to and I win whether I lost or not. You and Stu would beat four aces or a royal flush in my book of Hoyle! Harry S. Truman May 8th, 1955." Others are unidentified.

title: Groundbreaking Ceremony for Truman Library
Scopenote: Left to right: Unknown man, former President Harry S. Truman, Bess Truman, Margaret Truman, and Mary Jane Truman attend the groundbreaking ceremony for the Truman Library. The photo is autographed by Mr. Truman in the lower left corner: "5/8/55 Harry S. Truman."

title: Major General Robert Landry Presents Plaque

title: 2349th Personnel Processing Group at Parks Air Force Base
Scopenote: Major General Robert Landry, second from right, attends the swearing in of the 2349th Personnel Processing Group at Parks Air Force Base in California. All others are unidentified.

Scopenote: From left to right, Mrs. Stelling, Major General Robert Landry, Mrs. Klossner, Howard Klossner, and an unknown man attend an event celebrating the launching of SS Japan Bear in San Francisco, California.

Scopenote: Major General Robert Landry sits in the cockpit of a F-102 at Convair Plant in San Diego, California.

title: Major General Robert Landry Visits Montana Air National Guard
Scopenote: Major General Robert Landry (second from right) visits the Montana Air National Guard in Great Falls, Montana. All others are unknown.

Scopenote: Major General Robert Landry (fourth from right) attends a memorial service while attending the Air Force Association Convention in San Francisco, California. Others are unidentified.

Scopenote: Gill Robb Wilson is speaking at the Air Force Association Convention in San Francisco, California. Major General Robert Landry is fifth from right. All others are unknown.

title: Ronald Reagan Attends Air Force Association Banquet
Scopenote: Actor and World War II veterans Ronald Reagan speaks at an Air Force Association banquet. Others in the background are unidentified.

Antrim, Zelda and Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks, Captain and Mrs. Berry, Lieutenant General and Mrs. Oliver Smith, Captain and Mrs. Arthur Siegel, and Dr. and Mrs. S. E. Buxton, Jr. They are standing behind a cake on a table.

Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis Parks attends a reception given by members of the Pakistani ship, HMPS Muhafiz at Com(Open) in Norfolk, Virginia. Left to right: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks, Captain and Mrs. Ahsan, and Rear Admiral and Mrs. I. N. Kiland. Others in the background are unidentified.

Scopenote: From left: Major General Robert Landry, Brigadier General John Ives, and Brigadier General Loyal Easton at Hamilton Air Force Base in California.

Scopenote: Major General Robert Landry (left) arrives at unknown Air Force base and is greeted by Major General William Hefley (second from left) Colonel J. Dyer and Lieutenant Colonel L .H. Philibosian wait to greet Landry.

title: Korean General Kim and Dinner Guests

Elliott, Major General Robert Landry, Major General Roger Browne, Lieutenant General Charles Stone, Major General M. R. Nelson, Major General George Finch, Major General Robert E. L. Eaton.

Scopenote: A stereo slide of a United States Air Force official seated at a table with General Kim, a foreign military guest. Original caption: "Gen. Kim, Doug, Mary Lynn, Kim's escort at dinner at the Ranch." The young boy is also unidentified.

title: Major General Robert Landry Greets General Ferdinando Raffaelli of Italy
Scopenote: From left: General Ferdinando Raffaelli, Chief of Staff of the Italian Air Force, Major General Roy Lynn, and Major General Robert Landry stand in front of an Air Force plane during Raffaelli's visit to Hamilton Air Force Base in California.

Scopenote: Major General Robert Landry, Lieutenant Colonel L. H. Philibosian, and Major General William Hefley are interviewed by an unknown man (left) during the 2649th Air Reserve Center Advisory Board Luncheon in Sacramento, California.

title: General Ferdinando Raffaelli of Italy Visits Hamilton Air Force Base
Scopenote: General Ferdinando Raffaelli, Chief of Staff of the Italian Air Force visits the Hamilton Air Force Base and is greeted by the Honor Guard upon arrival.

title: Major General Robert Landry Attends Air Reserve Flying Center and Wing Commander's Conference
Scopenote: Major General Robert Landry attends the Air Reserve Flying Center and Wing Commander's Conference. Pictured: Colonel Clarence Schmid, Brigadier General Harold Little, Major General Robert Landry, Colonel John R. Alison, Colonel Robert Sheets.

title: Major General Robert Landry Attends Reception at Phoenix Air Reserve Center
Scopenote: Major General Robert Landry attends reception at Phoenix Air Reserve Center in Phoenix, Arizona. title: Major General Robert Landry Attends Reception at Phoenix Air Reserve Center
Scopenote: Major General Robert Landry Attends Reception at Phoenix Air Reserve Center in Phoenix, Arizona. From left: Brigadier General T. C. Rogers, Mr. W. W. Knorpp, Major General Robert Landry, and Mr. Dave Thomas, President of the Babb Company.

title: Air Explorer's Luncheon at Hamilton Air Force Base
Scopenote: From left to right: Colonel Johnson, Colonel Titus, Colonel Earle, Major General Robert Landry, Mr. George Harding, Major McNeill, and Mr. Don Moyer attend Air Explorer's Luncheon at Hamilton Air Force Base in California.

title: Major General Robert Landry with Miss Air Power 1956
Scopenote: Major General Robert Landry attends the 1956 Air Force Association Convention in New Orleans, Louisiana. From left: Unknown military official; Miss Joanne Alford, Miss Airpower 1956; Representative Hale Boggs of Louisiana; and Major General Robert Landry.

Scopenote: Major General Robert Landry attends the 1956 Air Force Association Convention in New Orleans, Louisiana. From left: Major General Morris Nelson, Lieutenant General Charles Stone, Master Sergeant Charles Hatchell, and Major General Robert Landry.

title: Major General Robert Landry Greets Mr. and Mrs. Jack Carson
Scopenote: Major General Robert Landry shakes hands with Jack Carson at the Air Force Association Convention in New Orleans, Louisiana. Center, Mrs. Jack Carson.

title: Major General Robert Landry Meets the Air Force Reserve Fighter Bomber Gunnery
Scopenote: Major General Robert Landry meets the Air Force Reserve Fighter Bomber Gunnery in Casper, Wyoming. From left: Major Horning, Colonel Roberts, Major General Robert Landry, and Colonel Ochs.

title: Major General Henry Mooney and Major General Robert Landry
Scopenote: Major General Henry Mooney (left) and Major General Robert Landry (right) attend the Air Force Association Jet Age Convention in San Francisco, California.

title: Major General Robert Landry Attends National Resources Conference
Scopenote: Major General Robert Landry (left) and Senator Barry Goldwater (right) attend closing exercises of the National Resources Conference in Tucson, Arizona.

title: Major General Robert Landry Attends National Resources Conference
Scopenote: From left: Colonel Fred R. Stofft, Rear Admiral Charles Hartman, Major General Robert Landry, and Colonel John Miller attend the closing ceremonies of the National Resources Conference in Tucson, Arizona.

title: Hamilton Air Force Base Review

title: Hamilton Air Force Base New Years Day Reception

title: Major General Robert Landry and Albert Schwabacher
Scopenote: Major General Robert Landry, Commander of the Fourth Air Force, right, presents the Department of Defense Reserve Award Pennant to Albert Schwabacher, Senior partner of the San Francisco investment firm of Schwabacher and Company. The award from Secretary Charles Wilson, was conferred as tangible evidence of Department of Defense appreciation for the Company's cooperative personnel practices in support of reserve activities of the Armed Forces.
Institutional Creator: Gabriel Moulin Studios, San Francisco, CA

title: Major General Robert Landry Greets Major General Roy Lynn

title: Former President Harry S. Truman in Omaha to Receive Award from Beth Israel Synagogue
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman shakes hands while standing in the train station in Omaha, Nebraska. He is preparing to return to Independence, Missouri after receiving an award from Beth Israel Synagogue in Omaha.  From right to left, he is with Henry Appel, Maurice Katzman, Rabbi Benjamin Groner, Harry Sidman, and Sam Hahn.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Walks with Group in Omaha
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman is standing outside a building with a group of men while in Omaha, Nebraska, where he received an award from Beth Israel Synagogue. From left to right, the men pictured are Dan Gordman, Mr. Truman, Harry Sidman, Rabbi Benjamin Groner, Sam Hahn, Henry Appel, and an unidentified police detective. The man at the top of the stairs is unidentified.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Eats Breakfast in Omaha
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman eats breakfast at the Fontenelle Hotel in Omaha, Nebraska, where he is to receive an award from Beth Israel Synagogue. From left to right, the men in the picture are Arthur S. Gould, Sam Hahn, Henry Appel, Maurice Katzman, unidentified man, unidentified waiter, Mr. Truman, A. J. Granoff, Harry Sidman, Dr. Greenberg, Max Fromkin, Nelson Gordman, and Dan Gordman.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman with Maury Katzman and Max Fromkin
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman, center, signs a book while Maurice Katzman, left, and Max Fromkin, right, look on.  They are in Omaha, Nebraska, where Truman received an award from Beth Israel Synagogue.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Reads the Paper
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman reads the paper and eats breakfast at the Fontenelle Hotel in Omaha, Nebraska, where he received an award from Beth Israel Synagogue.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman with Maury Katzman
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman sits at breakfast with Maurice Katzman, standing. He appears to be signing his autograph. He is in Omaha, Nebraska, where he received an award from Beth Israel Synagogue.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Eats Breakfast with Members of Beth Israel Synagogue
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman eats breakfast at the Fontenelle Hotel in Omaha, Nebraska, where he received an award from Beth Israel Synagogue. From left to right, the men in the picture are Rabbi Benjamin Groner, Arthur S. Gould, Sam Hahn, unidentified waiter, Henry Appel, Maurice Katzman, unidentified man, unidentified waiter, Mr. Truman, A. J. Granoff, Harry Sidman, Dr. Greenberg, Max Fromken, Nelson Gordman, and Dan Gordman (mostly cut off).

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Walks with Group While in Omaha
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman walks with a group of men while in Omaha, Nebraska, where he received an award from Beth Israel Synagogue. From left to right, the three men in front are Harry Sidman, Mr. Truman, and Rabbi Benjamin Groner. Walking in the background between Mr. Truman and Rabbi Groner is A. J. Granoff. All others are unidentified.

title: Major General Robert Landry with Dan Kimball
Scopenote: Major General Robert Landry (left) presents the Department of Defense Reserve Award to Dan Kimball (right), president of Aerojet General Corporation and former Secretary of the Navy.

title: General Robert Landry Arrives at Schilling Air Force Base Dedication
Scopenote: Stereo slide of two men arriving at Schilling Air Force Base dedication ceremony. On the left is General Robert Landry. Man on the right is possibly Hank Hunter. All others in the background are unidentified.

title: Men Gather Outside House at the Schilling Air Force Base Dedication
Scopenote: This stereo slide shows a small group of people gathering outside a light gray house. Some are wearing United States Air Force uniforms and others are dressed in civilian clothing. All are unknown. They are the attendees of the Schilling Air Force Base dedication.

title: Air Force Generals at Schilling Air Force Base Dedication
Scopenote: This stereo slide shows four United States Air Force generals attending the dedication ceremony at Schilling Air Force Base in Salina, Kansas. All are unidentified.

title: Guests of the Schilling Air Force Base Dedication
Scopenote: This stereo slide shows men wearing United States Air Force uniforms and civilians gathering outside. These are guests that attended the Schilling Air Force Base dedication in Salina, Kansas. All are unidentified.

title: Schilling Air Force Base Dedication
Scopenote: This stereo slide shows the dedication ceremony from Schilling Air Force Base in Salina, Kansas. The image was taken from the stage and shows a man standing at a podium with special guests seated in chairs behind him. Many are wearing Air Force uniforms. Air hangers can be visible in the background. All are unidentified.

title: Woman at Schilling Air Force Base Dedication Receives Medal
Scopenote: This is a stereo slide of a woman seated holding what appears to be a case that a medal would be presented in. A young boy is seated next to her to her left. On her right is a United States Air Force official. There are other people pictured in the in the background seated on a stage. All are unidentified. This took place at the dedication ceremony of Schilling Air Force Base in Salina, Kansas.

title: Schilling Air Force Base Dedication
Scopenote: This stereo slide shows a military dedication ceremony at Schilling Air Force Base in Salina, Kansas. A military official stands at a red, white, and blue podium with military officials and guests seated behind him on a stage. There are people gathered in the audience. A photographer is perched in a yellow ladder above the stage. Hangars can be seen in the background. All pictured are unknown.

title: Speaker at Schilling Air Force Base Dedication
Scopenote: This is a stereo slide of a speaker standing at a red, white, and blue podium at the dedication ceremony for the Schilling Air Force Base. There are people seated behind him. Media members are at the base of the stage and small boy looks through binoculars. A video cameraman stands on top of a yellow ladder over the stage. The event is outside with a brick building in the background. All people are unidentified.

title: Statue of David C. Schilling at Schilling Air Force Base
Scopenote: This stereo slide shows a statue of Colonel David C. Schilling at a dedication ceremony of the Schilling Air Force Base. There is a stage behind the bust of the statue with people standing on it. A building is in the background. All people are unidentified.

title: Banquet and Ceremony Memorializing Colonel David Schilling
Scopenote: Military officers and others attend a banquet and ceremony memorializing Colonel David Schilling in which Smokey Hill Air Force Base was renamed Schilling Air Force Base at Salina, Kansas. All are unidentified.

title: Men Arrive at Schilling Air Force Base Dedication
Scopenote: This is a stereo slide of three men arriving at the Schilling Air Force Base dedication ceremony in Salina, Kansas. Members of the media focus on their arrival. There are people gathered in the background for the ceremony. All people are unidentified.

title: Woman Observes a Medal with Her Son and Air Force General
Scopenote: This is a stereo slide of a woman seated holding what appears to be a case that a medal would be presented in. A young boy is seated next to her to her left. On her right is a United States Air Force official. There are other people pictured in the in the background seated on a stage. All are unidentified. This took place at the dedication ceremony of Schilling Air Force Base in Salina, Kansas.

title: Schilling Air Force Base Dedication
Scopenote: This is a stereo slide of guests and military officials seated on the stage of the dedication ceremony at Schilling Air Force Base in Salina, Kansas. Members of the media are standing at the base of the stage. A brick building is in the background. All are unidentified.

title: Schilling Air Force Base Dedication Guests
Scopenote: This is a stereo slide of guests who attended the Schilling Air Force Base dedication ceremony in Salina, Kansas. From left: Hank Stovall, General Carl Spaatz, Ceylon Frazer, Sid Farnsworth, Short, Hank Hunter, and Everett Cook. They are standing in front of a gray house.

title: Five Men Arrive at Schilling Air Force Base Dedication
Scopenote: This is a stereo slide of five unknown men arriving at the dedication ceremony at the Schilling Air Force Base in Salina, Kansas. There is a large crowd of people gathering at the ceremony. In the distance are an airplane and hangars.

title: Small Girl Sits on a Man's Lap at Schilling Air Force Base Dedication
Scopenote: This is a stereo slide of a small girl wearing a navy blue coat and hat sits on the lap of a man. Next to them is an older woman in a red coat. They are guests at the dedication for Schilling Air Force Base in Salina, Kansas. All are unidentified.

title: SS President Wilson Arrives in Japan
Scopenote: Crowds of people gather to see the arrival of the SS President Wilson, a civilian cruise liner, in Japan.

title: Carved Bear Statue in Japan
Scopenote: A carved bear statue outside of a building greets visitors in Japan.

title: Three Unknown Women Aboard SS President Wilson
Scopenote: Three unidentified female passengers are seated on a bed aboard the SS President Wilson as they traveled across the Pacific Ocean to Japan.

title: Swimming Pool Aboard SS President Wilson
Scopenote: Guests are gathered around a swimming pool aboard the cruise liner SS President Wilson.

title: SS President Wilson Arrives in Japan
Scopenote: The SS President Wilson arrives at the docks in Japan and is greeted by crowds of people.

title: Zelda Parks and Unknown Woman Aboard SS President Wilson
Scopenote: Zelda Parks, right, sits next to an unknown woman aboard the SS President Wilson as they traveled across the Pacific Ocean to Japan.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks and Zelda Parks with Guests Aboard SS President Wilson
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks, third from right and his wife, Zelda Parks, second from left, travel aboard the SS President Wilson across the Pacific Ocean to Japan. All others are unidentified.

title: View of a Japanese Building and People Gathered Outside
Scopenote: A group of unknown people are standing outside a building in Japan.

title: Zelda Parks Aboard SS President Wilson
Scopenote: Zelda Parks poses for a photo while sitting in a lounge chair aboard the cruise liner SS President Wilson.

title: Zelda Parks Aboard SS President Wilson in Room
Scopenote: Zelda Parks sits in a chair holding flowers in the cabin aboard the SS President Wilson.

title: Zelda Parks and Unknown Couple
Scopenote: Zelda Parks, wife of Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks, right, sits in a chair next to an unknown couple while in Japan.

title: Zelda Parks and Unknown Man Aboard SS President Wilson
Scopenote: Zelda Parks, wife of Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks, right, sits next to an unknown man aboard the SS President Wilson as they traveled across the Pacific Ocean to Japan.

title: Cruise Liner Passes SS President Wilson in the Distance
Scopenote: An unknown cruise ship passes the SS President Wilson in the Pacific Ocean.

title: Zelda Parks Aboard SS President Wilson
Scopenote: Zelda Parks sits on a bed in the cabin aboard the SS President Wilson.

title: Zelda Parks and Unknown Man
Scopenote: Zelda Parks, wife of Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks, right, sits next to an unknown man aboard the SS President Wilson as they traveled across the Pacific Ocean to Japan.

title: Zelda Parks with Six People Aboard SS President Wilson
Scopenote: Zelda Parks, wife of Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks, second row, second from right, sits with a group of six people aboard the SS President Wilson as they traveled across the Pacific Ocean to Japan. All others are unidentified.

title: Unknown Passengers Aboard SS President Wilson
Scopenote: Unknown passengers are seated on a bed aboard the SS President Wilson as they traveled across the Pacific Ocean to Japan.

title: Tour Group in Japan
Scopenote: A tour group visits a location in Japan. All people are unidentified.

title: Bear and Frog Carving Statues in Japan
Scopenote: Statutes of two bears and a frog are outside of a shop in Japan.

title: Zelda Parks Aboard SS President Wilson
Scopenote: Zelda Parks stands on the deck of the SS President Wilson cruise liner during a trip to Japan.

title: Unknown Couple Aboard SS President Wilson
Scopenote: An unidentified naval officer and a woman are seated on a bed aboard the SS President Wilson as they traveled across the Pacific Ocean to Japan.

title: Zelda Parks and Unknown Woman
Scopenote: Zelda Parks, right, sits in a chair next to an unknown woman while in Japan. The other woman is holding up a glass with her left hand.

title: Zelda Parks with Guests Aboard SS President Wilson
Scopenote: Zelda Parks, left, sits in a chair next to an unknown man and woman aboard the SS President Wilson as they traveled across the Pacific Ocean to Japan. The woman is wearing a kimono and wearing gloves.

title: Major General Robert Landry Attends Reception
Scopenote: General and Mrs. Parker (left) greet and Major General and Mrs. Robert Landry (right) at the Western Air Defense reception for General and Mrs. Parker at Hamilton Air Force Base in California. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Lieutenant General Charles Stone and Mrs. John White Geary
Scopenote: Lieutenant General Charles Stone III greets Mrs. John White Geary during the 4th Air Force Reception at the Hamilton Air Force Officers Club.

title: Hamilton Air Force Base Officer's Club
Scopenote: From left: Major General Hugh Parker, Mrs. Parker, Mrs. Robert Stone, Lieutenant General Charles B. Stone III, Mrs. Robert Landry, Major General Robert Landry, Lieutenant Robert Stone, and Major Emmerson Cook attend an event at the Hamilton Air Force Base Officer's Club.

title: 4th Air Force Reception
Scopenote: From left: Major General Hugh Parker, Mrs. Hugh Parker, Lieutenant General Charles Stone III, Mrs. Robert Landry, Major General Robert Landry, and Lieutenant General Robert N. Young attend a 4th Air Force reception at Hamilton Air Force Base in California.

title: 4th Air Force Reception
Scopenote: Air Force officers and their wives and guests mingle at the 4th Air Force Reception at the Hamilton Air Force Base Officers Club. Third from the left is Lieutenant General Charles Stone. Others are unidentified.

title: 4th Air Force Reception
Scopenote: From left: Major General Hugh Parker, Mrs. Parker, Lieutenant General Charles Stone III, Mrs. Robert Landry, Major General Robert Landry, and Major Emmerson Cook attend a 4th Air Force Reception at the Officers Club at Hamilton Air Force Base in California.

title: 4th Air Force Reception
Scopenote: From left: Major General Hugh Parker, Mrs. Hugh Parker, Lieutenant General Charles B. Stone III, Mrs. Robert Landry, and Major General Robert Landry attend a 4th Air Force Reception at the Hamilton Air Force Base Officers' Club.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks in Hawaii on Vacation
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks stands next to his wife Zelda Parks (center) and an unknown woman, possibly their daughter Zelda Louise Parks-Berry while in Hawaii. They are wearing leis.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks and Zelda Parks
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks and his wife Zelda Parks stand by a life preserver wearing leis while in Hawaii.

title: Zelda Parks Aboard SS President Wilson
Scopenote: Zelda Parks looks off from the deck of the ship aboard the SS President Wilson.

title: Zelda Parks in Hawaii
Scopenote: Zelda Parks, wife of Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks feeds birds while on vacation in Hawaii.

title: Hotel in Honolulu, Hawaii
Scopenote: This is an image of hotel building in Honolulu, Hawaii from the vacation scrapbook of Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks.

title: Zelda Parks Poses for Photo on Waikiki Beach
Scopenote: Zelda Parks (left), wife of Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks, stands next to an unknown woman, possibly Zelda Louise Berry, her daughter. They are standing on Waikiki Beach in Honolulu, Hawaii with Diamond Head in the background.

title: Zelda Parks in Hawaii
Scopenote: Zelda Parks, wife of Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (left) is seated at a table outside with an unknown woman. The unknown woman is possibly her daughter Zelda Louise Berry.

title: Zelda Parks in Hawaii
Scopenote: Zelda Parks, wife of Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (left), feeds birds while sitting at an outdoor table. The Parks were on vacation in Hawaii.

title: Zelda Parks in Hawaii
Scopenote: Zelda Parks, wife of Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (left), feeds birds while seated at an outdoor table. The unknown woman to her right is possibly her daughter Zelda Louise Berry while the Parks were on vacation in Hawaii.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks and Zelda Parks with Fish Caught During Fishing Trip
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (right) poses for a photo with his wife, Zelda Parks (left), with their fish that they caught during a fishing trip.

title: Vice Admiral Charles R. Brown in Highline
Scopenote: Vice Admiral Charles R. Brown is seated in the basket of a highline as he departed and arrived to the USS Wisconsin. He came aboard for an official visit. Brown was Commander of the 6th Fleet. All others are unidentified.

title: Vice Admiral C. R. Brown in Highline
Scopenote: Vice Admiral C. R. Brown, Commander of the 6th Fleet, came aboard the USS Wisconsin for an official visit. He arrived and departed by highline. Others in the photo are unidentified.

title: Vice Admiral Charles R. Brown on Highline
Scopenote: Vice Admiral Charles R. Brown is seated in a basket in the highline across the ocean as he goes from one ship to the USS Wisconsin. Brown was Commander of the 6th Fleet. All others are unidentified.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks and Vice Admiral Henry Crommelin
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (right) shakes hands with Vice Admiral Henry Crommelin aboard the USS Wisconsin. Parks relived Crommelin on May 27, 1957 as commander of Battleship Two Division.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks and Vice Admiral Henry Crommelin
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (right) shakes hands with Vice Admiral Henry Crommelin aboard the USS Wisconsin.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks and Vice Admiral Henry Crommelin
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (right) shakes hands with Vice Admiral Henry Crommelin (center) aboard the USS Wisconsin. Parks relieved Crommelin on May 27, 1957 as commander of Battleship Two Division. Officer far left is unknown.

title: Zelda Parks Outside of House
Scopenote: Zelda Parks stands outside of a house that has a large palm tree in the yard.

title: Zelda Parks Aboard A Fishing Boat With Unknown People
Scopenote: Zelda Parks, second from right, poses for the camera seated next to an unknown man and woman. An unknown man drives the fishing boat.

title: Zelda Parks Sits in Living Room
Scopenote: Zelda Parks sits on the arm of a sofa in a living room.

title: USS Canberra at the International Naval Review
Scopenote: The USS Canberra acts as the reviewing ship during the International Naval Review held at Norfolk, Virginia, and attended by seventeen navies from around the world.

title: USS Canberra at International Naval Review
Scopenote: USS Canberra leads the International Naval Review as the reviewing ship. Seventeen navies from around the world joined the United States Atlantic Fleet for the International Naval Review held at Norfolk, Virginia.

title: Jets Fly Over USS Boston at International Naval Review
Scopenote: Jets in formation fly over the USS Boston. During the International Naval Review held at Norfolk, Virginia.

title: USS Iowa During International Naval Review
Scopenote: In 1957, seventeen navies from around the world joined the United States Atlantic Fleet for the International Naval Review held at Norfolk, Virginia. Included among the ships that participated from the United States is the USS Iowa.

title: President Carlos Ibanez del Campo and Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (fourth from right) meets with Chilean President Carlos Ibanez del Campo (center) while in Valparaiso, Chile. All others are unidentified.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks in Valparaiso, Chile
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (left) receives an honor from the Chilean Navy while in Valparaiso, Chile.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks Attends Party in Chile
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (left) stands with three unknown guests at a party held in Valparaiso, Chile.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks Attends Party in Chile
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (right) attends a party in Valparaiso, Chile. Two guests pictured are unknown.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks at Escobedo Luncheon
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks stands to give remarks at a luncheon held by Rear Admiral Jorge Escobedo Diaz of Chile. Rosemary Escobedo is seated next to him.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks and Arthur Cranmer Kenrick
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (left) stands with Arthur Cranmer Kenrick at a party in Valparaiso, Chile.

title: Camella Cranmer Kendrick with Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks
Scopenote: Camella Cranmer Kendrick sits with Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (right) when he visited Valparaiso, Chile.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks at Party in Chile
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (left) stands with an unknown man and Arthur Cranmer Kenrick (right) at a party in Valparaiso, Chile.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks Attends Party in Chile
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks attended a party while in Valparaiso, Chile. From right, Zelda Parks, Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks, unknown man, unknown waiter.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks at Dinner
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks attends a dinner with several guests aboard a ship. From left: Paul Runnestrand, General Hightower, Governor of the Panama Canal Zone Governor William Potter, General George Schlatter, Judge Crowe, Captain Warner Rodiman, Captain St. Angelo, unknown man, Lieutenant General Gather Montague, Rear Admiral Parks, Major General Harrold, Colonel Hugh Arnold.

title: Rosemary de Escobedo and Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks
Scopenote: Rosemary de Escobedo, wife of Rear Admiral Jorge Escobedo Diaz of the Chilean Navy, dances with Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks at an event in Valparaiso, Chile.

title: Memorial Service for USS Essex Crew Members in Valparaiso, Chile
Scopenote: The United States Ambassador to Chile, Cecil Lyon, stands at the podium and speaks in honor of the men that died from the USS Essex during the Battle of Valparaiso in 1814. Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks is pictured third from left. All others are unidentified.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks Receives Honor in Chile
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (left) toasts his glass with an unknown man from the Chilean Navy after Parks received an honor in Chile. The other man is unidentified.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks in Valparaiso, Chile
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks attends an event held in Valparaiso, Chile. From left to right: Otto Neimann, Mrs. Parks (no relation), Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks, Sophie Eastman, Captain K. C. Walpole, Captain Thompson.

title: Chilean President Carlos Ibáñez del Campo and Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks
Scopenote: Chilean President Carlos Ibáñez del Campo (left) meets with Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (second from right) and Captain K. C. Walpole (right) while in Valparaiso, Chile.

title: Memorial Service of USS Essex Crew Members in Valparaiso, Chile
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis Parks attends a memorial service in honor of the men that died from the USS Essex during the Battle of Valparaiso in 1814. From left, Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks, United States Ambassador Cecil Lyon, and Rear Admiral Jorge Escobedo Diaz. All others pictured are unidentified.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks Receives Gift
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (right) receives a gift from Rear Admiral Jorge Escobedo Diaz of the Chilean Navy while visiting Valparaiso, Chile.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks Receives Honor in Chile
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (center) receives a naval honor from the Chilean Navy while in Valparaiso, Chile. Others are unidentified.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks with Rear Admiral Jorge Escobedo
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (second from left) shakes hands with Rear Admiral Jorge Escobedo during a luncheon while in Valparaiso, Chile. Otto Neimann and Sophie Eastman are pictured to the right.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks Meets President Carlos Ibanez del Campo of Chile
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks shakes hands with President Carlos Ibanez del Campo of Chile. From left: Cecil Lyon, United States Ambassador to Chile, unknown translator, President Ibanez del Campo, Rear Admiral Parks.

title: Memorial Service for Crew Members of USS Essex
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (center) attends a memorial service in Valparaiso, Chile for American navy crew members that died during the Battle of Valparaiso in 1814 from the USS Essex. From left to right: Mayor of Valparaiso, Santiago Diaz Buzeta; Commander of National Police of Valparaiso; Rear Admiral Parks; United States Ambassador to Chile, Cecil Lyon; and Rear Admiral Jorge Escobedo of the Chilean Navy. All others are unidentified.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks with Rear Admiral Jorge Escobedo Diaz and Sophie Eastman
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (right) stands and talks with Rear Admiral Jorge Escobedo Diaz of the Chilean Navy (center) and Sophie Eastman at an event in Valparaiso, Chile.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks with Rear Admiral Jorge Escobedo
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (right) toasts drinking glasses with Rear Admiral Jorge Escobedo of the Chilean Navy while in Valparaiso, Chile.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks at Party in Chile
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (left) and his wife, Zelda (second from right) stand with two unknown people at a party in Valparaiso, Chile.

title: USS Wisconsin Crew in Guantanamo Bay, Cuba
Scopenote: Officers of the USS Wisconsin are seated at a table. From left: Lindsey Williamson, Jack Miner, Dave Welchel, Grimshaw Moore, and Joe Williams.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks and Four Women
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (left) sits with four women, identified as Eliana Salas de DelSolar, Emma Vizcarra de Neiman, Josephine Walbaum de Arrellano, Adriana Pfeiffer de Varela.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks Attends Party in Valparaiso, Chile
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks attends a party in Valparaiso, Chile. From left to right: an unknown couple, Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks, Rear Admiral Jorge Escobedo, and Mrs. Rosemary Escobedo.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks and Rear Admiral Jorge Escobedo Dias of the Chilean Navy
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (right) stands next to Rear Admiral Jorge Escobedo Dias of the Chilean Navy aboard the USS Wisconsin while in Valparaiso, Chile.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks in Chile
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks visits Valparaiso, Chile. From left to right: Aide to Rear Admiral Escobedo; Lieutenant Junior Grade Brian F. McCrane, Midshipman Lawrence, Rear Admiral Jorge Escobedo Diaz, Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks, Captain E. K. Thompson, Captain de Corbeta Otto Neimann.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks in Chile
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (second from right) stands on board the USS Wisconsin with officials from Chile. From left, Aide to the Intendente; Mayor of Valparaiso, Chile, Santiago Diaz Buzeta; Intendente Jorge Vio Valdivisio; Rear Admiral Parks; Mayor of Vina del Mar, Chile, Vladimir Huber Wastavino.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks Attends Party in Valparaiso, Chile
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks attends a party in Valparaiso, Chile. From left to right: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks, Rear Admiral Jorge Escobedo, Captain H. G. Moore, and Mrs. Rosemary de Escobedo.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks and Rear Admiral Jorge Escobedo
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks of the United States Navy (left) sits with Rear Admiral Jorge Escobedo of the Chilean Navy while in Valparaiso, Chile.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks at Party in Chile
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (left) sits with Captain E. K. Thompson, Naval Attache, and Sophie Eastman Cortez at a party held in Valparaiso, Chile.

title: Basil O'Connor at the Podium at the Truman Library Dedication Ceremony
Scopenote: Basil O'Connor stands at the podium at the dedication ceremony for the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri. Standing behind the wall of bunting, from left to right: Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn (partly obscured by cameraman), former First Lady Bess W. Truman, Former President Herbert Hoover, Mr. O'Connor, Supreme Court Chief Justice Earl Warren, former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt, Senator William Knowland, Missouri Governor James T. Blair, and Franklin Floete. All others are unidentified.

title: Basil O'Connor Speaks At Truman Library Dedication Ceremony
Scopenote: Basil O'Connor (at podium) speaks at the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library dedication ceremony in Independence, Missouri. From left to right: three unidentified men, Charles Halleck (in front of man with the hat), Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn, First Lady Bess W. Truman (in white hat, partly obscured by the podium), former President Herbert Hoover, former President Harry S. Truman, Mr. O'Connor, Rabbi Samuel Mayerberg (in second row), Supreme Court Chief Justice Earl Warren, former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt, Senator William Knowland, Regina McGranery (in second row), and former Attorney General James McGranery (in second row). All others are unidentified.

title: Earl Warren and Others at Truman Library Dedication
Scopenote: Chief Justice Earl Warren (left), Former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt (center), and Senator William Knowland (right) are sitting in the front row at the dedication ceremony for the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri. Seated behind Mrs. Roosevelt and Mr. Knowland is former Attorney General James McGranery. Seated in the top row are, from left to right: unidentified man, unidentified woman in red hat, Orville Freeman, Governor G. Mennen Williams of Michigan, and Averell Harriman. All others are unidentified.

title: Eleanor Roosevelt At Truman Library Dedication
Scopenote: Former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt (center) at the dedication of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri. Behind Mrs. Roosevelt is Senator Lyndon B. Johnson, and partly visible behind Mr. Johnson is Senator Stuart Symington. Partly obscured on the right is former First Lady Bess W. Truman. All others are unidentified.

title: Crowd of Unidentified People at the Harry S. Truman Library Dedication
Scopenote: A crowd of unidentified people are standing on the front steps of the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri during the library's dedication ceremonies.

title: Crowd of Unidentified People at the Harry S. Truman Library Dedication
Scopenote: A crowd of unidentified people are standing on the front steps of the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri during the library's dedication ceremony. The speaker at the podium is unidentified.

title: Former President Herbert Hoover at the Truman Library Dedication
Scopenote: Former President Herbert Hoover (at the podium) speaks at the dedication of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri. All others are unidentified.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Speaks at Library Dedication
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (standing at podium) speaks at the Harry S. Truman Library dedication ceremony in Independence, Missouri. All other people are unidentified.

title: Chief Justice Earl Warren Speaking at the Harry S. Truman Library Dedication
Scopenote: Chief Justice of the United States Supreme Court Earl Warren (standing at podium on the right) is speaking at the Harry S. Truman Library dedication ceremony in Independence, Missouri. All other people are unidentified.

title: Former President Harry Truman Speaks at the Harry S. Truman Library Dedication
Scopenote: Former President Harry Truman (behind podium, turned toward the crowd behind him) speaks at the Harry S. Truman Library dedication ceremony in Independence, Missouri. All other people are unidentified.

title: Former President Herbert Hoover at the Harry S. Truman Library Dedication
Scopenote: Former President Herbert Hoover (at the podium) speaks at the dedication of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri. All others are unidentified.

title: Missouri Senator Stuart Symington Talking With A Woman
Scopenote: Missouri Senator Stuart Symington (left) talking with an unidentified woman at the dedication of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Crowd of People at Truman Library Dedication Ceremony
Scopenote: A large crowd of people are milling around, waiting for the dedication ceremony to begin at the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri. Among those present are Leon Keyserling (standing, near the center, wearing dark navy jacket) and former Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan (standing, near center, wearing white hat). All others are unidentified.

title: Earl Warren Speaks at Truman Presidential Library Dedication
Scopenote: Chief Justice Earl Warren is speaking at the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library dedication ceremony in Independence, Missouri. The people seated behind Justice Warren that are visible include (from right to left): Senator William Knowland, former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt, Rabbi Samuel Mayerberg, and Basil O'Connor. All others are unidentified.

title: Crowd of Unidentified People at the Harry S. Truman Library Dedication
Scopenote: A crowd of unidentified people are standing on the front steps of the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri during the library's dedication ceremony. The speaker at the podium is unidentified.

title: Former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt Speaks at the Harry S. Truman Library Dedication
Scopenote: Former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt (at podium) speaks at the Harry S. Truman Library dedication ceremony in Independence, Missouri. All other people are unidentified.

title: Crowd of Unidentified People at the Harry S. Truman Library Dedication
Scopenote: A crowd of unidentified people is gathered on the front steps of the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri during the library's dedication ceremony.

title: Crowd of Unidentified People at the Harry S. Truman Library Dedication
Scopenote: A crowd of unidentified people are standing on the front steps of the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri during the library's dedication. The speaker at the podium on the right is unidentified.

title: Crowd of Unidentified People at the Harry S. Truman Library Dedication
Scopenote: A crowd of unidentified people stands on the front steps of the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri during the library's dedication ceremonies.

title: Basil O'Connor Speaking at the Harry S. Truman Library Dedication
Scopenote: Basil O'Connor (standing at the podium on the right) is speaking at the Harry S. Truman Library dedication in Independence, Missouri. All other people are unidentified.

title: Crowd of Unidentified People at the Harry S. Truman Library Dedication

title: Attendees of the Truman Library Dedication
Scopenote: Senator William Knowland (background left), Senator Lyndon B. Johnson (second from left, back to camera), Senator Stuart Symington (third from left in background), Basil O'Connor (center), former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt (third from right), and former First Lady Bess W. Truman (in white hat, back to camera) are attending the dedication ceremony for the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library Dedication in Independence, Missouri. All others in the picture are unidentified.

title: Crowd of People at the Truman Presidential Library Dedication Ceremony
Scopenote: A crowd of people are seated in the distinguished guests section behind the speakers at the dedication ceremony for the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri. Standing at the center is G. Mennen "Soapy" Williams, the Governor of Michigan. Directly below and in front of him is India Edwards, former Vice-Chairman of the Democratic National Committee. The man in the lower left corner, wearing the white hat is likely former Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder. All others are unidentified.

title: Chief Justice Earl Warren Speaking at the Harry S. Truman Library Dedication
Scopenote: Chief Justice Earl Warren of the United States Supreme Court (standing at podium) is speaking at the Harry S. Truman Library dedication ceremony in Independence, Missouri. All other people are unidentified.

title: Crowd of Unidentified People at the Harry S. Truman Library Dedication
Scopenote: A crowd of unidentified people gathers on the front steps of the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri during the Library's dedication ceremonies

title: Chief Justice Earl Warren Speaking at the Harry S. Truman Library Dedication
Scopenote: Chief Justice Earl Warren of the United States Supreme Court (standing behind podium) is speaking at the Harry S. Truman Library dedication ceremony in Independence, Missouri. All other people are unidentified.

title: Dedication of the Harry S. Truman Library, Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: Basil O'Connor (in dark suit with flower on his jacket at the podium) turns over the deed to the Harry S. Truman Library to Franklin G. Floete of the General Services Administration. They are standing before the crowd of people at the dedication ceremony for the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri. All others are unidentified.

title: Crowd of Unidentified People at the Harry S. Truman Library Dedication
Scopenote: A crowd of unidentified people are standing on the front steps of the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri during the library's dedication ceremony.  The speaker at the podium on the right is unidentified.

title: Distinguished Guests at the Truman Library Dedication Ceremony
Scopenote: The distinguished guests and speakers are standing in the front row at the dedication ceremony for the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri. Front row, from left to right: unidentified, Independence Mayor Robert Weatherford, Charles Halleck, Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn, former First Lady Bess W. Truman, Former President Herbert Hoover, former President Harry S. Truman, Phil Regan, Basil O'Connor, Supreme Court Chief Justice Earl Warren, former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt, Senator William Knowland, and Missouri Governor James Blair. Others in the background are unidentified.

Scopenote: A crowd of unidentified people are watching the dedication ceremony of the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri. A bank of film and television cameras stands behind the people.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks Attends Luncheon
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (second from right) attends a luncheon held in his honor by the Mayor of Valparaiso, Chile. Santiago Diaz Buzeta, Mayor of Valparaiso shakes Parks' hand. The two men in the background are unknown.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks at Dinner in Chile
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (right0 has dinner in Valparaiso, Chile. From left to right: Mrs. Huber, Henry Gardiner, Mrs. Walpole, Captain Lyons, Captain Thompson, Mrs. Kenrick, Rear Admiral Escobedo, Mrs. Eastman, Alcade Huber, Mrs. Gardiner, Captain Walpole, Captain Williamson, Mrs. Thompson, Mr. Kenrick, Rosemary Escobedo, Rear Admiral Parks.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis Parks and Other Naval Officials Attends Luncheon

Parks; Mayor of Valparaiso, Santiago Diaz Buzeta; unknown translator; Captain Kleber Masterson, United States Navy, Commanding Officer of the USS Boston; Mayor of Vina del Mar, Huber Wasavino; Captain William B. Sieglaff, United States Navy, Commanding Officer USS Albany.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks Receives Gift from Mayor of Valparaiso, Chile

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks Attends Luncheon in Chile

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks at Luncheon in Chile

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks at Dinner in Valparaiso, Chile

Parks, Roger Allen, Jerry Bunch Jr., Emory Tiffany, Lieutenant William Knaebel, Lieutenant Brian McCrane, Edwin Weinberg.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman with Paul-Henri Spaak

Also present are General Thomas Power, Strategic Air Command Commander (second from right) and General Leon Johnson, United States Representative to NATO.

title: Aftermath from Panama Citizens Protest of United States Military Forces in Panama Canal Zone
Scopenote: This photographs shows the aftermath of a protest by citizens of Panama against United States Military Forces in Panama Canal Zone. Debris litters the street, and barbed wire can be seen around some of the buildings.

title: Panama Citizens Participate in Protest of United States Military Forces in Panama
Scopenote: Citizens of Panama participate in a protest of United States Military Forces in Panama Canal Zone. All are unidentified.

title: Panama Citizens Participate in Protest of United States Military Forces in Panama
Scopenote: Citizens of Panama participate in a protest of United States Military Forces in Panama Canal Zone. All are unidentified.

title: Visit of General Barros of the Chilean Air Force
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks, fourth from left, attends a dinner for the official visit of General Barros of the Chilean Air Force to Quarry Heights military base in Panama. All others are unidentified.

title: Retired Major General Robert Landry Attends Dinner
Scopenote: Retired Major General Robert Landry, fourth from left, attends a dinner. All others pictured are unknown.

title: Major General Robert Landry's Officer's House
Scopenote: Major General Robert Landry's residence while he was stationed at McClellan Air Force Base in Sacramento, California. A large palm tree is in the front yard of the white brick home.

title: United States Military Transport Airplane
Scopenote: A United States military airplane is sitting on tarmac with door open and stairs ejected.

title: Man and Woman Sit at Colonel David Schilling's Desk
Scopenote: Stereo slide of an unidentified man and woman seated at the desk of United States Air Force Colonel David Schilling. Outside the windows, a fight jet can be seen.

title: Major General Robert Landry's Home at McClellan Air Force Base
Scopenote: Front view of a white brick exterior home that was assigned to Major General Robert Landry during his stationing at McClellan Air Force Base in Sacramento, California. Front door plaque says, "Landry, Robert B./ Major General, USAF"

title: European Styled Architecture Scene
Scopenote: This is a stereo slide of a scene from what appears to be a European location. In the background, there is a large white ornate tower and trees. In the foreground, six thin green trees line a marble double stairway leading down to a pond where there are statues.

title: Fifteenth Naval District Headquarters in Balboa, Panama Canal Zone
Scopenote: This is a photograph of the Fifteenth Naval District Headquarters in Balboa, Panama Canal Zone.

title: Statue of General Henry "Hap" Arnold at Air Force Academy
Scopenote: This is a photo of a  statue of General Henry "Hap" Arnold that stands at the Air Force Academy in Colorado Springs, Colorado. Mat border is signed "Bob/Thanks for getting/us started!!/Ben Bellis"

title: 1960 World Wide Commanders Conference
Scopenote: Attendees of the 1960 World-Wide Commanders Conference at Ramey Air Force Base, Puerto Rico. Secretary of the Air Force Dudley Sharp is in the front row, fifth from the left. Major General Robert Landry is in the fifth row, sixth from the left. Others are unidentified.

title: Meeting of the Air Force Civilian Personnel Council
Scopenote: Meeting of the Air Force Civilian Personnel Council on February 1-5, 1960 in Washington D.C. Major General Robert Landry is seated at the back table, second from the left (mostly obscured). All others are unidentified.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks and Spectators at Banyan Tree II
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks, left, with unknown spectators pays careful attention to paradrops in Exercise Bayan Tree II, at Rio Hato in Panama. Five Latin American nations and the United States cooperated in Banyan Tree II to rout Agressor, a force attempting a mythical "invasion" of Panama.

title: Spectators at Exercise Banyan Tree II in Panama
Scopenote: Original caption: A crowd of military and civilian observers pay careful attention to paradrops in Exercise Bayan Tree II, at Rio Hato in Panama. Five Latin American nations and the United States cooperated in Banyan Tree II to rout Agressor, a force attempting a mythical "invasion" of Panama. All are unidentified.

title: Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks and Vice Admiral Fitzburg Lee at Exercise Banyan Tree II
Scopenote: Vice Admiral Fitzhugh Lee, Rear Admiral Lewis S. Parks (right), and Lieutenant Anthony Dopazo watch at Exercise Banyan Tree II, observing the paradrop at the Rio Hato maneuver area in Panama.

title: Four Military Officials at Hong Kong Airport
Scopenote: Stereo slide of General Robert Landry, Ed Cleary, and Ray Jones with unknown man, second from left. They are standing under plane at the Hong Kong Airport.

title: Mohan's Store Located in Hong Kong
Scopenote: A stereo slide of Mohan's Store, and tailor shop located in Hong Kong. Ray Jones and General Robert Landry (right) are standing under the Mohan sign. Other people in the photo are unidentified. Original caption: Mohan's Store Ray Jones Bob L. Hong Kong Nov '60.

title: Repulse Bay Hotel in Hong Kong
Scopenote: Stereo slide from Repulse Bay Hotel in Hong Kong, with people standing in front of the hotel. Original caption: "Repulse Bay hotel Ray Jones Ed Cleary Hong Kong Nov '60."

title: Pan-Am DC-7
Scopenote: Stereo slide of a Pan-American DC-7 airplane during a layover at Midway. Original caption: "Midway - our DC-7 en route to Japan Nov '60."

title: Street Scene in Aberdeen, Hong Kong
Scopenote: Stereo slide of a street scene in Aberdeen, Hong Kong. Pictured is three lanes of traffic, predominately taxi cabs. A row of buildings line the street with laundry draped over the balconies. A mountain top hill is in the background. Original caption written on slide: "Street scene in Aberdeen Nov '60."

title: Mohan's Store in Hong Kong
Scopenote: Stereo slide of Mohan's Store, a custom tailor shop located in Hong Kong. Ed Cleary and Ray Jones are standing under the Mohan sign. Cars can be seen on the street. Original caption: "Mohans Store Ed Cleary Ray Jones Hong Kong Nov '60."

title: Arrival at Hong Kong
Scopenote: A stereo slide of Ed Cleary and Ray Jones arriving in Hong Kong. There is a car and airplane pictured in the photo. Others in the photo are unidentified. Original caption: Arrival at Hong Kong Ed Cleary Ray Jones Nov '60.

title: Ray Jones and Ed Cleary Ride Rickshaws in Hong Kong
Scopenote: Stereo slide of Ray Jones and Ed Cleary, United States Air Force officials, riding a rickshaws during their visit to Hong Kong. Public transportation buses appear in the background. Original caption: "Hong Kong Ray Jones Ed Cleary in Rickshaws Nov '60."

title: Outdoor Patio at Repulse Bay Hotel in Hong Kong
Scopenote: Stereo slide of the outdoor patio area of the Repulse Bay Hotel in Hong Kong. Ed Cleary and Ray Jones are pictured center. Others are unidentified. Original caption: Repulse Bay Hotel Hong Kong Ed Cleary; Ray Jones Nov '60.

title: General Robert Landry Sits in Rickshaw
Scopenote: Stereo slide of General Robert Landry seated in a rickshaw during his trip to Hong Kong. Others in the photo are unidentified. Original caption: Bob L. in rickshaw Hong Kong Nov '60.

title: Aberdeen, Hong Kong
Scopenote: Stereo slide of scenic view of Aberdeen, Hong Kong, with many boats in the harbor and hills in the distance. Original caption: "Aberdeen - Center of fishing industry & floating restaurants Hong Kong Nov '60."

title: Ivy W. Duggan With Associates
Scopenote: Ivy W. Duggan (right) poses with two unidentified men on a business trip to Madrid, Spain.

title: General Robert Landry Pays A Cashier
Scopenote: General Robert Landry (left) hands an unknown female cashier a check. Landry is most likely buying items at a McClellan Air Force Base Post Exchange. The check says "Pay to the order of McClellan Air Force Exchange."

title: General Robert Landry Holds Paper With General Smith
Scopenote: General Robert Landry (right) holds a paper in front of a flag with General Smith (first name unknown).

title: Change of Command Ceremony at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base
Scopenote: Change of Command Ceremony held on August 1st, 1961 at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base in Dayton, Ohio. Fifteen military officers stand at attention. Front row, far left is General Robert Landry. All others are unknown.

title: Meeting on the Youth Educational Program
Scopenote: Held at Mr. Garcia Gutierrez's office, different heads of organizations discuss the Youth Educational Program carried out by the Agricultural Extension Service. From left to right sits Alfonso Cosme Matesanz, Administrator General of the Government at the S. E. A.; Jose Javier Rivera, Director for Spain and Portugal, U.S. Feed Grains Council; Jose Garcia Gutierrez, Director General of the Agricultural Education Centers; Ivy W. Duggan, United States Agricultural Attache; Gonzalo Rivera, Director for Spain, Soybean Council of America; Edward Quinones, Assistant Agricultural Attache; and Jose Cabrerizo Rodriguez, Agent, Agricultural Extension Service.

title: Meeting in Madrid
Scopenote: United States Agricultural Attache Ivy W. Duggan (seated at the right corner of the table) meets with a group of unidentified men in Madrid, Spain.

title: United States Ambassador Visiting United States Fair Building in Madrid, Spain
Scopenote: United States Ambassador to Spain Robert F. Woodward (center, in glasses) visits the United States Fair building in Madrid, Spain, with General Francisco Franco (second from right). Also present is Agricultural Attache Ivy Duggan (in background, fourth from left). All others are unidentified.   This group is leaving the U.S. Fair Building in Madrid, Spain. Among them in the center with glasses is Ambassador Woodward, second from the right is Franco, and fourth from the left is Ivy W. Duggan.

title: Ivy Duggan at United States Fair Event in Spain
Scopenote: Ivy Duggan (second from left, leaning in) and Mrs. Ivy Duggan (third from left) chat with General Francisco Franco (right) and others during a visit to the United States Fair building in Madrid, Spain. All others are unidentified.

title: Visit to United States Fair Building in Madrid
Scopenote: United States Ambassador Robert F. Woodward (foreground, second from right) pays a visit to the United States Fair Building in Madrid, Spain with President of Spain Francisco Franco (third from right) and United States Agricultural Attache Ivy Duggan (background, between Franco and Woodward). All others are unidentified.

title: Visiting the United States Fair Building in Madrid, Spain
Scopenote: Ivy W. Duggan (center right, with badge on his pocket) accompanies Generalissimo Francisco Franco (center), the Ambassador of the United States to Spain Robert F. Woodward (in glasses next to Duggan), and the Secretary of Agriculture of Spain while they visit the U.S. Fair Building in Madrid, Spain. All others are unidentified.

title: Mrs. Ivy Duggan Conversing at a Table
Scopenote: From left to right Mr. Garcia-Gutierrez, Mrs. Ivy Duggan, and Mr. Eladio Asensio talk at an unknown event in Madrid, Spain.

title: Dinner Party
Scopenote: Ivy Duggan stands and prepares to speak at a dinner party, likely in Spain. Sitting clockwise around the table are Mrs. Echegaray, Mrs. Asensio, Mr. Cavero, Mre. Cantos-Figuerola, Mr. Escardo, Mr. Echegaray, Mrs. Crawford, Mr. Ramon Cantos-Figuerola.

title: Ivy W. Duggan at a Dinner Party
Scopenote: Gathered for a dinner party sits from left to right Ivy W. Duggan, Mrs. Asensio, Mr. Miguel Cavero, Mrs. Cantos-Figuerola, Mr. Escardo, Mrs. Vidal, and Mr. Manchado. This photo was likely taken in Spain.

title: The Truman Family Farmhouse at Grandview
Scopenote: Front view of the family farm of President Harry S. Truman.

title: Route From Ceremonial Site to Pick-Up Point
Scopenote: A view of East Mechanic Street near the corner of North Lynn Street in Independence, Missouri, looking towards William Chrisman High School. This photo was taken as part of the planning for the funeral of former President Harry S. Truman. Some attendees of the funeral parked their cars at Chrisman High School and were driven to the ceremony site at the Harry S. Truman Library. This street is part of the route back to the school from the Library.  Donor:  Terry Van Meter, U. S. Cavalry Museum, Fort Riley, Kansas.

title: Sketch of Proposed Harry S. Truman Statue
Scopenote: This sketch of a proposed Harry S. Truman statue in front of the Jackson County Courthouse in Independence, Missouri was done by Franta Belsky.

title: Gilbert Franklin Speaks at Viewing of Model of Harry S. Truman Statue
Scopenote: Artist Gilbert Franklin speaks at a viewing of the model of the Harry S. Truman statue.

title: Harry Jonas and Gilbert Franklin with Model of the Harry S. Truman Statue
Scopenote: Harry Jonas, left, and Gilbert Franklin, center, pose with a model of the Harry S. Truman statue.  The man on the right is unidentified.

title: Gilbert Franklin Speaks at Viewing of Model of Harry S. Truman Statue
Scopenote: Artist Gilbert Franklin speaks at a viewing of the model of the Harry S. Truman statue.

title: Gilbert Franklin and Harry Jonas with Model of the Harry S. Truman Statue
Scopenote: Gilbert Franklin, left, and Harry Jonas, right, examine a model of the Harry S. Truman statue.  The man in the center is unidentified.

title: Unidentified Man Speaks at Viewing of Model of Harry S. Truman Statue
Scopenote: An unidentified man speaks at a viewing of the model of the Harry S. Truman statue.

title: Harry S. Truman Statue
Scopenote: This is a picture of the Harry S. Truman statue while it was unfinished.  An unidentified woman is standing on the left.

title: Harry S. Truman Statue Lowered into Place
Scopenote: Workmen remove a statue of Harry S. Truman from a crate. Artist Gilbert Franklin stands on the far left in the tan coat and black hat. All others are unidentified.

title: Harry S. Truman Statue
Scopenote: A Harry S. Truman statue takes shape in the studio of Gilbert Franklin during the design and fabrication process.

title: Sculpture Artist Gilbert Franklin with Harry S. Truman Statue
Scopenote: Sculpture artist Gilbert Franklin poses with the Harry S. Truman statue while it is under construction.

title: Gilbert Franklin with Harry Jonas and the Harry S. Truman Statue
Scopenote: Artist Gilbert Franklin, left, looks at the Harry S. Truman statue with Harry Jonas, right.

title: Gilbert Franklin Shows the Harry S. Truman Statue
Scopenote: Gilbert Franklin, right, shows the unfinished Harry S. Truman statue to an unidentified woman, left.

title: Gilbert Franklin Works on Harry S. Truman Statue
Scopenote: Sculpture artist Gilbert Franklin works on a statue of President Harry S. Truman.

title: Harry S. Truman Statue
Scopenote: A statue of Harry S. Truman statue is under construction at the studio of artist Gilbert Franklin.

title: Gilbert Franklin, Harry Jonas, and Others with Harry S. Truman Statue
Scopenote: Artist Gilbert Franklin (front right with his back to the camera) and Harry Jonas (back center) examine the Harry S. Truman statue while it is being designed in Mr. Franklin's studio. The two women are unidentified.

title: Two Women Examine the Harry S. Truman Statue
Scopenote: Two unidentified women examine the Harry S. Truman statue while it is under construction at the studio of artist and sculptor Gilbert Franklin.

title: Two Unidentified Women with the Harry S. Truman Statue
Scopenote: Two unidentified women stand next to the Harry S. Truman Statue at the workshop of artist Gilbert Franklin.

title: Retired Major General Robert Landry Visits Air Force Flight Test Center
Scopenote: Retired Major General Robert Landry, first row, third from right, visits Edwards Air Force Base in California at the Air Force Flight Test Center. All others are unknown.

title: Retired Major General Robert Landry and Friend
Scopenote: Retired Major General Robert Landry, right, poses with an unidentified friend at Edwards Air Force Base in California at the Air Force Flight Test Center.

title: Sculpture Artist Gilbert Franklin
Scopenote: Gilbert Franklin (left), creator of the Harry S. Truman statue, stands with Harry S. Jonas (right), chairman of the Harry S. Truman Statue Committee. They are near the Jackson County Courthouse in Independence, Missouri.

title: First Lady Betty Ford and Senator Stuart Symington
Scopenote: First Lady Betty Ford (second from the right) and Senator Stuart Symington (right) sit around a luncheon table, probably at the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri.  All others are unidentified.

title: Unidentified Men in Doorway
Scopenote: Unidentified men, including a police officer, stand around and inside a doorway at the Jackson County Courthouse in Independence, Missouri. This photo was probably taken during the dedication ceremony for the Harry S. Truman statue.

title: President Gerald Ford and Margaret Truman Daniel
Scopenote: President Gerald Ford, left, shakes hands with Harry Jonas, center. Standing behind President Fort is Missouri Governor Christopher Bond. Standing on the right, partly obscured, is President Harry S. Truman's daughter, Margaret Truman Daniel. President Fort is in Independence, Missouri to attend the dedication of the Harry S. Truman statue at the Jackson County Courthouse. All others are unidentified.

title: Dedication of the Harry S. Truman Statue
Scopenote: Harry Jonas stands at the podium at the dedication of the Harry S. Truman statue in front of the Jackson County Courthouse in Independence, Missouri.  Seated in the front row are (from left to right): Missouri Governor Christopher Bond, President Gerald Ford, First Lady Betty Ford, Margaret Truman, E. Clifton Daniel, four unidentified people, and creator of the statue Gilbert Franklin (far right and standing). All others are unidentified.

title: Margaret Truman at Statue Dedication
Scopenote: A group of unidentified people are standing in a doorway at the Jackson County Courthouse in Independence, Missouri, as they take part in the Harry S. Truman statue dedication. The woman in the blue dress on the left is Margaret Truman Daniel.

title: Harry Jonas Speaks at Dedication of Harry S. Truman Statue
Scopenote: Harry Jonas, at the podium, speaks at the dedication of the Harry S. Truman Statue in front of the Jackson County Courthouse in Independence, Missouri. Standing in the front row from left to right are Senator Hubert Humphrey, Senator Stuart Symington, Missouri Governor Christopher Bond, President Gerald Ford, First Lady Betty Ford, and Margaret Truman. The man standing behind Stuart Symington is Clark Clifford. All others are unidentified.

title: President Gerald Ford and First Lady Betty Ford
Scopenote: First Lady Betty Ford and President Gerald Ford stand on the podium underneath the flag near the Jackson County Courthouse in Independence, Missouri. They are in Independence for the dedication of the Harry S. Truman statue outside the Courthouse.  All others are unidentified.

title: President Gerald Ford Speaks at Dedication of Harry S. Truman Statue
Scopenote: President Gerald Ford speaks at the dedication of the Harry S. Truman statue in front of the Jackson County Courthouse in Independence, Missouri.  Behind him, seated in the front row, are (left to right): Senator Hubert Humphrey, Senator Stuart Symington, Harry Jonas, Missouri Governor Christopher Bond, First Lady Betty Ford, Margaret Truman Daniel, and E. Clifton Daniel. Seated behind Senator Symington is Clark Clifford. Seated behind and to the right of Mr. Daniel is Dr. Benedict Zobrist, Director of the Harry S. Truman Library. All others are unidentified.
